trans-unit.source: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
trans-unit.target: I roto i te ingoa o Allah, te Me te aroha, te Rawa aroha.

trans-unit.source: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Lord of the worlds -
trans-unit.target: whakamoemiti [katoa] he [e tika] ki Allah, te Ariki o nga ao -

trans-unit.source: The Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
trans-unit.target: Te Me te aroha, te Rawa aroha,

trans-unit.source: Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.
trans-unit.target: Ariki o te Day o utua.

trans-unit.source: It is You we worship and You we ask for help.
trans-unit.target: Ko koe koropiko matou me koe matou ani i te tauturu.

trans-unit.source: Guide us to the straight path -
trans-unit.target: Arata'i ia tatou ki te ara tika -

trans-unit.source: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked [Your] anger or of those who are astray.
trans-unit.target: Te ara o te hunga nei ki runga ki te manakohia kua homai e koe, e kore o te hunga e kua whītiki [tou] riri o te ranei te hunga e e kotiti ke.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Meem.

trans-unit.source: This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah -
trans-unit.target: Ko te Buka tenei e pā ana ki i te mea kahore he feaa, he arata'iraa mo te hunga mohio o Allah -

trans-unit.source: Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them,
trans-unit.target: Ko wai whakapono i roto i te kitea, whakapumautia inoi, a ka noho i roto i o te mea kua whakaratohia matou mo ratou,

trans-unit.source: And who believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: A e whakapono i roto i te mea kua whakakitea ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], a te mea i whakakitea mai e koe ki te aroaro o, a he etahi [i roto i te whakapono] ratou o te ake.

trans-unit.source: Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga i runga i [tika] arata'iraa i to ratou Ariki, a ko reira te hunga e te angitu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga whakaponokore - ko reira te taua katoa hoki ratou ranei whakatupato koe ratou ranei e kore e whakatupato ia ratou - e kore ratou e whakapono.

trans-unit.source: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: kua whakaturia Allah he hiri ki runga ki o ratou ngakau, me te ki runga ki to ratou rongo, a mo to ratou kitenga ko te arai.

trans-unit.source: And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allah and the Last Day," but they are not believers.
trans-unit.target: A, o nga iwi ko etahi e mea, "Te ti'aturi nei matou i roto i Allah me te Day Last," engari e kore e ratou whakapono.

trans-unit.source: They [think to] deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves and perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: Ratou [whakaaro ki] tinihangatia Allah me te hunga e whakapono ana, heoi kihai ratou teka; kore ai ratou, ka kite [te reira] e kore.

trans-unit.source: In their hearts is disease, so Allah has increased their disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they [habitually] used to lie.
trans-unit.target: I roto i to ratou ngakau he mate, na kua nui Allah ratou mate;

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Do not cause corruption on the earth," they say, "We are but reformers."
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "Kaua e meinga pirau i runga i te whenua," e mea ratou, "Ko matou engari faaapî."

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: Te feaa ore, Ko reira te hunga e nga whakangau ke ratou, engari kite ratou [te reira] e kore.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Believe as the people have believed," they say, "Should we believe as the foolish have believed?" Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they know [it] not.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "Me whakapono rite te iwi i whakapono," e mea ratou, "Kia whakapono tatou rite te wairangi i whakapono?"

trans-unit.source: And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We believe"; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers."
trans-unit.target: A, no ka tutaki ratou te hunga e whakapono ana, e mea ana ratou, "e whakapono ana matou";

trans-unit.source: [But] Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.
trans-unit.target: whakahi [Ko] Allah ratou, a, roa noa ratou i roto i to ratou poka ke [ia] ratou kopikopiko matapo.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga e kua hapa [i roto i te utu] no te arata'iraa hokona, kia kawea mai ratou tauwhitinga kua kahore pai, e kore ano i arahi ratou.

trans-unit.source: Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.
trans-unit.target: Ratou hi'oraa Ko e o tetahi nei mura he ahi, engari ka marama te reira te mea i tetahi taha ia, ka tangohia e atu Allah ratou marama, a mahue ratou i roto i te pouri [na] ratou i ahei te kore kite.

trans-unit.source: Deaf, dumb and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].
trans-unit.target: Deaf, wahangu, me te matapo - na ratou e kore hoki [ki te ara tika].

trans-unit.source: Or [it is] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ranei [He reira] rite te ua i te rangi i roto i te mea pouri, te whatitiri, me te uira.

trans-unit.source: The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: tata kapo i te uira i to ratou aroaro.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous -
trans-unit.target: E te taata, koropiko koutou Ariki, nana nei i hanga e koe, me te hunga e koutou i mua, e riro ai koe tika -

trans-unit.source: [He] who made for you the earth a bed [spread out] and the sky a ceiling and sent down from the sky, rain and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not attribute to Allah equals while you know [that there is nothing similar to Him].
trans-unit.target: [Ia] te tangata i hanga hoki koutou te whenua he moenga [horahia atu] me te rangi i te tuanui, a tonoa iho i te rangi, te ua, me te kawea ki waho reira hua rite whakaratonga mo koutou.

trans-unit.source: And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our Servant [Muhammad], then produce a surah the like thereof and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te he koe i roto i te feaa e pā ana ki te mea i tonoa e matou ki raro, ki runga ki to tatou pononga [Muhammad], ka hua i te Surah te rite o reira, ka karanga ki runga ki o koutou kaiwhakaatu atu atu Allah, ki te kia koe pono.

trans-unit.source: But if you do not - and you will never be able to - then fear the Fire, whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Otiia ki te kahore koutou mahi - a kore e taea ki a koutou - ka wehi te ahi, ko tona wahie he tangata me nga kohatu, rite mo nga iino.

trans-unit.source: And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with a provision of fruit therefrom, they will say, "This is what we were provided with before." And it is given to them in likeness. And they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: A ka hoatu te rongo pai ki te hunga e whakapono ana, e mahi ana tika e ka whai ratou māra [i roto i te Parataito] i raro e rere awa.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah is not timid to present an example - that of a mosquito or what is smaller than it. And those who have believed know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, "What did Allah intend by this as an example?" He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, e kore he Allah i hopohopo ai ki te tapaea he tauira - e o te waeroa ranei aha he iti ake te reira.

trans-unit.source: Who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and cause corruption on earth. It is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai pakaru te kawenata o Allah i muri i kirimana reira, ka wehewehe i taua kua whakahau nei Allah ki te kia piri, ka meinga te pirau i runga i te whenua.

trans-unit.source: How can you disbelieve in Allah when you were lifeless and He brought you to life; then He will cause you to die, then He will bring you [back] to life, and then to Him you will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Nahea e nehenehe e koe whakateka i Allah ia oa koutou, a kawea ia koutou ki te ora;

trans-unit.source: It is He who created for you all of that which is on the earth. Then He directed Himself to the heaven, [His being above all creation], and made them seven heavens, and He is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Ko ia te tangata e hanga hoki koutou katoa o taua i te mea i runga i te whenua.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority." They said, "Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?" Allah said, "Indeed, I know that which you do not know."
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua, e Muhammad], ka mea koutou Ariki ki nga anahera, "Ko e mo'oni, ka meinga e ahau i runga i te whenua i te mana ngā."

trans-unit.source: And He taught Adam the names - all of them. Then He showed them to the angels and said, "Inform Me of the names of these, if you are truthful."
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaako ia Arama nga ingoa - katoa o ratou.

trans-unit.source: They said, "Exalted are You; we have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Indeed, it is You who is the Knowing, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "ake ia koe:. to matou e mohio ki te kore te mea kua whakaako tatou e koe e mo'oni, he reira koe nei ko te matau, te Potó."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O Adam, inform them of their names." And when he had informed them of their names, He said, "Did I not tell you that I know the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth? And I know what you reveal and what you have concealed."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E Arama, e ratou o ratou ingoa."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate before Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka mea matou ki nga anahera, "koropiko ki te aroaro o Adamu";

trans-unit.source: And We said, "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea matou, "Adamu, noho, e, ia koe me tou wahine, i roto i te Paradaiso, me te kai i reira i roto i [humarie, me te] nui i nga wahi katoa e koutou. Otiia e kore e whakatata tenei rakau, kei waiho koutou i roto i nga hara."

trans-unit.source: But Satan caused them to slip out of it and removed them from that [condition] in which they had been. And We said, "Go down, [all of you], as enemies to one another, and you will have upon the earth a place of settlement and provision for a time."
trans-unit.target: Otiia meinga Hatana ki a ratou te paheke i roto i taua mea, ka nekehia atu ana ratou i taua [huru] i roto i nei ratou i kua.

trans-unit.source: Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Na ka riro Adamu i tona Ariki [etahi] kupu, a farii e ia tona ripeneta.

trans-unit.source: We said, "Go down from it, all of you. And when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: ka mea matou, "Haere iho i reira, katoa o koutou A ka tae mai te arata'iraa ki a koutou i ahau, te tangata e whai toku arata'iraa -. reira e kore e wehi mo ratou, e kore ano e pouri ratou.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those will be companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally."
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakateka, ka whakakahore tatou tohu - te hunga e hei hoa o te ahi;

trans-unit.source: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and fulfill My covenant [upon you] that I will fulfill your covenant [from Me], and be afraid of [only] Me.
trans-unit.target: E tamariki o Iharaira, kia mahara toku manako e kua homai e ahau ki runga ki a koutou, ka fakahoko taku kawenata [ki runga ki a koutou] e ka fakahoko e ahau to koutou kawenata [i ahau], a kia wehi o [anake] ahau.

trans-unit.source: And believe in what I have sent down confirming that which is [already] with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it. And do not exchange My signs for a small price, and fear [only] Me.
trans-unit.target: Na whakapono i roto i te mea i tonoa e ahau ki raro, whakau i te [kua] ki a koutou, a ka kia e kore te tuatahi ki te whakateka i roto i te reira.

trans-unit.source: And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].
trans-unit.target: A e kore e uru te pono ki te teka huna i te parau mau i te mohio koutou [te reira] ranei.

trans-unit.source: And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in worship and obedience].
trans-unit.target: A ka whakapumautia te inoi, me te hoatu zakah me koropiko ki te hunga e koropiko [i roto i te haamoriraa e te haapa'o].

trans-unit.source: Do you order righteousness of the people and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: Mahi te tono koe te tika o te iwi, me te wareware koutou i taki koe te karaipiture?

trans-unit.source: And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive [to Allah]
trans-unit.target: A imi i te tauturu na roto i te manawanui me te inoi, a ka pono, he uaua anake mo te haehaa auraro [ki Allah]

trans-unit.source: Who are certain that they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai e etahi e ka whakatau ratou to ratou Ariki, a ka hoki mai ratou ki a ia.

trans-unit.source: O Children of Israel, remember My favor that I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
trans-unit.target: E tamariki o Iharaira, kia mahara toku manako e kua homai e ahau ki runga ki a koutou, me i pai koe e ahau ki runga ki nga ao.

trans-unit.source: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be aided.
trans-unit.target: A wehi te Day ina e rato kore wairua mo tetahi wairua i katoa, e kore e inoi kia manakohia i reira, e kore ano e tangohia utu i reira, e kore ano ka whakakaha ratou.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We saved your forefathers from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment, slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara], no te ora matou o koutou matua i te iwi o Parao, e tukinotia koe ki te kino mamae, tukitukia koutou [hou] tama, te haapa'oraa i to koutou wahine ora.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara], no te wehe matou i te moana hoki koutou, a ora ai koutou, ka paremo te iwi o Parao, ia i titiro koe i runga i.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We made an appointment with Moses for forty nights. Then you took [for worship] the calf after him, while you were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka hanga e matou he mea whakarite ki a Mohi mo te wha tekau nga po.

trans-unit.source: Then We forgave you after that so perhaps you would be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakarerea noatia matou a koutou i muri e pera pea e kia koe mauruuru.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We gave Moses the Scripture and criterion that perhaps you would be guided.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka hoatu e matou a Mohi te karaipiture me te paearu e pea e koe arata'ihia.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship]. So repent to your Creator and kill yourselves. That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator." Then He accepted your repentance; indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka mea a Mohi ki tona iwi, "E taku iwi, pono kua tukinotia e koe koutou e tau hao o te kuao kau [mo koropiko]. Na ripeneta ki tou Kaihanga, me te patu koutou. Ko pai hoki [katoa o] koutou

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we will never believe you until we see Allah outright"; so the thunderbolt took you while you were looking on.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka mea koe, "E a Mohi, matou e kore whakapono koe kia kite ra tatou Allah ëtahi";

trans-unit.source: Then We revived you after your death that perhaps you would be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Na ka ora matou ia koe i muri i tou matenga e pea e kia koe mauruuru.

trans-unit.source: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not - but they were [only] wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kaurukutia matou ki a koutou ki te kapua, a ka tono tangata ki raro, ki te mana, me te koitareke koutou, [mea], "kai i te mea pai ki nei kua whakaratohia matou ki a koutou."

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We said, "Enter this city and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance, and enter the gate bowing humbly and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens.' We will [then] forgive your sins for you, and We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka mea matou, "E tomo tenei pa, me te kai i reira nga wahi katoa e koutou i roto i [humarie, me te] tini, ka tomo i te kuwaha piko haehaa, ka mea, 'Kua whakanuia tatou o tatou kawenga.'

trans-unit.source: But those who wronged changed [those words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them, so We sent down upon those who wronged a punishment from the sky because they were defiantly disobeying.
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga e tukinotia ke [aua kupu] ki te tauākī atu atu e i kua mea ki a ratou, na ka tonoa e matou ki raro, ki runga ki te hunga e tukino i te whiu i te rangi no te mea i ratou kaki talangata'a.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people, so We said, "Strike with your staff the stone." And there gushed forth from it twelve springs, and every people knew its watering place. "Eat and drink from the provision of Allah, and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka inoi a Mohi mo te wai mo tana iwi, na ka mea matou, "Patua a ki tou tokotoko te kohatu."

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food. So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic and its lentils and its onions." [Moses] said, "Would you exchange what is better for what is less? Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked." And they were covered with humiliation and poverty and returned with anger from Allah [upon them]. That was because they [repeatedly] disbelieved in the signs of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and were [habitually] transgressing.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka mea koe, "E a Mohi, kore rawa e taea e tatou e mau tetahi [ahua o] te kai. Na karanga ki runga ki to koutou Ariki ki kawea mai hoki tatou i te whenua ona otaota matomato, me ona kukama, me tona karika me ona pi, me ona

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who believed and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabeans [before Prophet Muhammad] - those [among them] who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e whakapono, me te hunga i Hurai, ranei Karaitiana ranei Hapeana [te aroaro o Palōfita Muhammad] - te hunga [i roto ia ratou] nei i whakapono i Allah me te Day Last, a i te tika - ka whai ratou utu ki a ratou Ariki, me kahore te wehi e reira

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [O Children of Israel, to abide by the Torah] and We raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that perhaps you may become righteous."
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka tangohia e matou tou kawenata, [e tamariki o Iharaira, ki te noho i te ture] a whakaarahia matou mo koutou i te maunga, [mea], "Tangohia ta Kua hoatu matou ki a koutou ki te faaotiraa, me te mahara ki nga mea kei roto i te reira e

trans-unit.source: Then you turned away after that. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have been among the losers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tahuri atu ia koutou i muri i.

trans-unit.source: And you had already known about those who transgressed among you concerning the sabbath, and We said to them, "Be apes, despised."
trans-unit.target: Na i mohio koe kua e pā ana ki te hunga i he nei i roto ia koutou mo te hapati, a ka mea matou ki a ratou, "Kia makimaki, whakahawea."

trans-unit.source: And We made it a deterrent punishment for those who were present and those who succeeded [them] and a lesson for those who fear Allah.
trans-unit.target: A hanga e matou i te reira i te whiu haamăta'ui mo te hunga i reira, me te hunga e muri [ratou] me he haapiiraa mo te hunga e wehi ana ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow." They said, "Do you take us in ridicule?" He said, "I seek refuge in Allah from being among the ignorant."
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka mea a Mohi ki tona iwi, "Ko e mo'oni, faaue Allah ki a koe patua te kau."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is." [Moses] said, "[Allah] says, 'It is a cow which is neither old nor virgin, but median between that,' so do what you are commanded."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Karangatia ki runga ki to koutou Ariki ki kia mārama ki a matou he aha te he te reira."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Call upon your Lord to show us what is her color." He said, "He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers.' "
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Karangatia ki runga ki to koutou Ariki ki te whakaatu ki a matou he aha te mea ia tae."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is. Indeed, [all] cows look alike to us. And indeed we, if Allah wills, will be guided."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Karangatia ki runga ki to koutou Ariki ki kia mārama ki a matou he aha te he te reira. Oia mau, [katoa] kau titiro rite tahi ki a matou. Na ka pono matou, ki te pai Allah, ka arata'ihia."

trans-unit.source: He said, "He says, 'It is a cow neither trained to plow the earth nor to irrigate the field, one free from fault with no spot upon her.' " They said, "Now you have come with the truth." So they slaughtered her, but they could hardly do it.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "ta ia, 'Ko te kau kore whakaakona ki te parau i te whenua ranei ki te ngahere i te mara, tetahi free i te hape ki kore wahi ki runga ki a ia.'

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when you slew a man and disputed over it, but Allah was to bring out that which you were concealing.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ina patua koutou i te tangata, totohe ana ki runga reira, engari ko Allah ki te kawe i roto i taua i huna nei e koe.

trans-unit.source: So, We said, "Strike the slain man with part of it." Thus does Allah bring the dead to life, and He shows you His signs that you might reason.
trans-unit.target: Na, ka mea matou, "Patua te tangata i patua ki te wahi o taua mea."

trans-unit.source: Then your hearts became hardened after that, being like stones or even harder. For indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth, and there are some of them that split open and water comes out, and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allah. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakapakeke o koutou ngakau ka muri e, te rite kohatu ara uaua ranei.

trans-unit.source: Do you covet [the hope, O believers], that they would believe for you while a party of them used to hear the words of Allah and then distort the Torah after they had understood it while they were knowing?
trans-unit.target: E hiahia koe [te tumanako, e whakapono], e e whakapono ai ratou mo koutou i te ope o ratou whakamahia ki te whakarongo ki te kupu a Allah, me ka ketia te ture i muri i ratou i matau ki taua mea, ia i mohio ratou?

trans-unit.source: And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We have believed"; but when they are alone with one another, they say, "Do you talk to them about what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue with you about it before your Lord?" Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: A, no ka tutaki ratou te hunga e whakapono ana, e mea ana ratou, "Kua whakapono matou";

trans-unit.source: But do they not know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare?
trans-unit.target: Otiia kahore ratou e mohio e matau ana Allah ta ratou huna me aha ratou e whakaatu?

trans-unit.source: And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Scripture except in wishful thinking, but they are only assuming.
trans-unit.target: A i roto ia ratou he hunga kuware kahore nei e matau ki te karaipiture anake i roto i te whakaaro pohehe, engari e mana'o anake ratou.

trans-unit.source: So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands, then say, "This is from Allah," in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.
trans-unit.target: Na aue ki te hunga e tuhituhi i te "folofolá" ki o ratou ringa ake, ka mea, "Ko tenei i Allah," i roto i te i te tikanga ki te whakawhiti i te reira no te te utu iti.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Never will the Fire touch us, except for a few days." Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will never break His covenant. Or do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "Kaua rawa e te ahi ka pa ki a matou, ki te kahore hoki he torutoru nga ra."

trans-unit.source: Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Ae, te tangata whiwhi kino, me te kua karapotia tona hara i ia - te hunga ko nga hoa o te ahi;

trans-unit.source: But they who believe and do righteous deeds - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Ko ratou te hunga e whakapono, me te mahi mahi tika - te hunga ko nga hoa o Pararaiha;

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], "Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah." Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara], no te ka mau matou i te kawenata i nga tamariki o Iharaira, [enjoining ki runga ki a ratou], "Kaua e koropiko anake Allah: a ki ngā mātua e pai, ki whanaunga, pani, me te rawakore, me te korero ki te iwi pai [kupu.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [saying], "Do not shed each other's blood or evict one another from your homes." Then you acknowledged [this] while you were witnessing.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka tangohia e matou tou kawenata, [mea], "Kaua e whakaheke i nga toto tahi i te tahi o ranei pana tetahi ki tetahi i to outou mau fare."

trans-unit.source: Then, you are those [same ones who are] killing one another and evicting a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest of punishment. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Na, ko koe te hunga [taua hunga e] te patu tetahi ki tetahi, me te pei ia he rōpū o tou iwi i to ratou mau fare, fāitaha mo ratou i roto i te hara, me te fakaaoao.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world [in exchange] for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga e kua hokona i te ora o tenei ao [i roto i te utu] mo te ake, kia kore e kia marama i te whiu mo ratou, e kore ka e whakakaha ratou.

trans-unit.source: And We did certainly give Moses the Torah and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.
trans-unit.target: Na i tino hoatu e matou a Mohi te ture, a aru ana i muri ia ia ki te karere.

trans-unit.source: And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped." But, [in fact], Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea ratou, "E takaia to matou ngakau."

trans-unit.source: And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which was with them - although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: A, no te reira ka haere mai ki a ratou i te Buka i Allah whakau i te tahi ratou - ahakoa i mua ratou whakamahia ki te inoi mo te wikitoria ki te hunga e whakapono - engari [ka] ka haere mai ki a ratou e i mohio ratou, i whakapono ana ratou i roto i reira;

trans-unit.source: How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed through [their] outrage that Allah would send down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they returned having [earned] wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Kia pehea te waikorohuhu Ko e hoki i hokona e ratou ia ratou - e e whakateka ratou i roto i te mea kua whakakitea Allah i roto i [to ratou] poauau e e tonoa iho Allah tana manako ki runga ki pai nei ia i roto i ana pononga.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Believe in what Allah has revealed," they say, "We believe [only] in what was revealed to us." And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are [indeed] believers?"
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "Me whakapono i roto i te mea kua whakakitea Allah," e mea ratou, "e whakapono ana matou [anake] i roto i te mea i whakakitea mai ki a tatou."

trans-unit.source: And Moses had certainly brought you clear proofs. Then you took the calf [in worship] after that, while you were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka i pono kawea Mohi mārama tohu koe.

trans-unit.source: And [recall] when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and listen." They said [instead], "We hear and disobey." And their hearts absorbed [the worship of] the calf because of their disbelief. Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers."
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara] ka tangohia e matou tou kawenata, a whakaarahia mo koutou i te maunga, [mea], "Tangohia ta Kua hoatu matou ki a koutou ki te faaotiraa, me te whakarongo."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If the home of the Hereafter with Allah is for you alone and not the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Ki te ko te kāinga o te ake ki Allah anake, a kihai te [tahi atu] iwi mo koutou, ka hiahia hoki te mate, ki te kia koe pono.

trans-unit.source: But they will never wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Otiia e kore ratou e hiahia hoki reira, ake ake, no te mea o ta i totoro o ratou ringa.

trans-unit.source: And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - [even] more than those who associate others with Allah. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years, but it would not remove him in the least from the [coming] punishment that he should be granted life. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: A pono ka kitea e koe a ratou te apo tino o te iwi mō te ora - [ara] neke atu i te hunga e piri etahi ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is [none but] he who has brought the Qur'an down upon your heart, [O Muhammad], by permission of Allah, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "te tangata ko te hoariri ki a Kapariera - he reira [tetahi, engari] ia nei i kawe kua te Qur'an iho ki runga ki o koutou ngakau, [e Muhammad], na roto i te whakaaetanga o Allah, whakau ai i te aroaro o reira, me rite ki te arata'iraa, me te pai

trans-unit.source: Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ko te hoariri ki a Allah, me ana anahera, me ana karere ko Kapariera ko Michael te tangata - ka pono, Allah he he hoariri ki te iino.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly revealed to you verses [which are] clear proofs, and no one would deny them except the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino whakakitea matou ki a koutou irava [e he] mārama tohu, me kahore tetahi e whakakahore ratou anake te kaki tutu.

trans-unit.source: Is it not [true] that every time they took a covenant a party of them threw it away? But, [in fact], most of them do not believe.
trans-unit.target: He kore [pono] taua wa katoa ka mau ratou i te kawenata he ope o ratou maka reira atu?

trans-unit.source: And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].
trans-unit.target: A, no te taenga mai tetahi karere i Allah ki te whakau ia ratou e e te tahi ratou, maka ana te rōpū o te hunga i homai te karaipiture te karaipiture o Allah i muri ratou tuara, me te mea kihai ratou i mohio ki [he aha i roto i te reira].

trans-unit.source: And they followed [instead] what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon. It was not Solomon who disbelieved, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]." And [yet] they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew.
trans-unit.target: A [hei utu] aru ratou ta nga rewera takina i i te kingitanga o Horomona.

trans-unit.source: And if they had believed and feared Allah, then the reward from Allah would have been [far] better, if they only knew.
trans-unit.target: A ki te mea i whakapono ratou, ka wehi Allah, na te utu i Allah e kua [tawhiti] pai, ki te ratou i mohio anake.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, say not [to Allah 's Messenger], "Ra'ina" but say, "Unthurna" and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono ki, e kore e mea [ki Messenger 'o Allah], "Ra'ina" engari e mea, "Unthurna" me te whakarongo.

trans-unit.source: Neither those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture nor the polytheists wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: E kore ano te hunga e whakateka i nga iwi o te karaipiture e kore nga polytheists hiahia kia kia tonoa tetahi pai ki raro ki a koutou i to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: We do not abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten except that We bring forth [one] better than it or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah is over all things competent?
trans-unit.target: E kore matou e whakakahore i te irava meinga ki kia wareware reira anake e kawea mai matou [kotahi] pai atu te reira ranei rite ki reira ranei.

trans-unit.source: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and [that] you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper?
trans-unit.target: kahore koutou e mohio e ki Allah no te kawanatanga o nga rangi, me te whenua, me [e] koe e kore haunga Allah tetahi kaitiaki tetahi kaiawhina ranei?

trans-unit.source: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
trans-unit.target: Ranei e koe mea ki te ui koutou anahera rite ui a Mohi i te aroaro o?

trans-unit.source: Many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves [even] after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allah delivers His command. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: E rave rahi o te iwi o te karaipiture hiahia ratou i taea tahuri koe hoki ki te whakateka i muri kua whakapono koe, i roto i te hae i ratou [ara] i muri hei te pono, kua mārama ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: A ka whakapumautia te inoi, me te hoatu zakah, a mea katoa e pai hoatu koe i mua hoki koutou - ka kitea e koe te reira ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "None will enter Paradise except one who is a Jew or a Christian." That is [merely] their wishful thinking, Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "E kore tetahi e tomo Pararaiha kotahi nei te mea he Hurai he Karaitiana ranei anake."

trans-unit.source: Yes [on the contrary], whoever submits his face in Islam to Allah while being a doer of good will have his reward with his Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
trans-unit.target: Ae [i runga i te ke], te tangata tuku tona mata i roto i te Ihirama ki Allah i te he mahi o te pai, ka whai i tona utu ki tona Ariki.

trans-unit.source: The Jews say "The Christians have nothing [true] to stand on," and the Christians say, "The Jews have nothing to stand on," although they [both] recite the Scripture. Thus the polytheists speak the same as their words. But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
trans-unit.target: Nga Hurai te mea "tetahi [pono] ki te tu i runga i nga Karaitiana i," a ka mea nga Karaitiana, "kahore ki te tu i runga i nga Hurai i," ahakoa ratou [e rua] taki te karaipiture.

trans-unit.source: And who are more unjust than those who prevent the name of Allah from being mentioned in His mosques and strive toward their destruction. It is not for them to enter them except in fear. For them in this world is disgrace, and they will have in the Hereafter a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na ko wai e nui atu kino atu i te hunga e ārai i te ingoa o Allah i te faahitihia i roto i ana pereoo me feinga ki to ratou whakangaromanga.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs the east and the west. So wherever you [might] turn, there is the Face of Allah. Indeed, Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A ki Allah no te rawhiti, me te hauauru.

trans-unit.source: They say, "Allah has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him,
trans-unit.target: mea ratou, "tangohia Allah kua he tama."

trans-unit.source: Originator of the heavens and the earth. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
trans-unit.target: Tupu'anga o nga rangi, me te whenua.

trans-unit.source: Those who do not know say, "Why does Allah not speak to us or there come to us a sign?" Thus spoke those before them like their words. Their hearts resemble each other. We have shown clearly the signs to a people who are certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: Te hunga kahore nei e matau ki te mea, "He aha e kore e Allah korero ki a matou ranei haere mai i reira ki a matou he tohu?"

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have sent you, [O Muhammad], with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Kua tonoa e matou a koutou, [e Muhammad], me te pono ano te kaikawe o te rongo pai, me te Warner, a kore e ui koe e pā ana ki te hoa o po auahi.

trans-unit.source: And never will the Jews or the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance." If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah no protector or helper.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e nga Hurai, nga Karaitiana ranei whakaaetia o koutou tae noa te whai koutou i to ratou haapa'oraa.

trans-unit.source: Those to whom We have given the Book recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it. And whoever disbelieves in it - it is they who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga kua homai ki nei tatou i te Buka taki reira ki tona recital pono.

trans-unit.source: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
trans-unit.target: E tamariki o Iharaira, kia mahara toku manako e kua homai e ahau ki runga ki a koutou, me i pai koe e ahau ki runga ki nga ao.

trans-unit.source: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, and no compensation will be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided.
trans-unit.target: A wehi te Day ina e rato kore wairua mo tetahi wairua i katoa, a ka kore utu e manakohia i reira, e kore ano e whai hua i te reira tetahi inoi, e kore ka e whakakaha ratou.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them. [Allah] said, "Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people." [Abraham] said, "And of my descendants?" [Allah] said, "My covenant does not include the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua, e Muhammad], i te tamata Aperahama e tona Ariki ki te whakahau a rite ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We made the House a place of return for the people and [a place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], "Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying [there] for worship and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer]."
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua], no te hanga matou i te Whare te wahi o te hoki mo te iwi, me te [te wahi o] haumaru.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." [Allah] said. "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka mea a Aperahama, "E toku Ariki, kia tenei te pa haumaru, me te whakarato i ona iwi ki te hua -. Tangata o ratou e whakapono i roto i Allah me te Day Last"

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua], i te whakatairanga i Aperahama nga turanga o te Whare, a [ki a ia] Ihimaera, [mea], "to tatou Ariki, farii i [tenei] i tatou. Nana ko koe te rongo, te matau.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: To tatou Ariki, a ka meinga tatou Mahometa [i roto i te tāpaetanga] ki koe, me i to tatou uri i te iwi Muslim [i roto i te tāpaetanga] ki koe.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: To tatou Ariki, a ka tukua atu he karere i ratou nei e taki ki a ratou au irava, me te whakaako ia ratou i te Buka a te whakaaro nui, me te pure ia ratou i roto ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Na ko wai e kia e ngakaukore ana ki te karakia o Aperahama tetahi e hanga he wairangi o ia anake.

trans-unit.source: When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted [in Islam] to the Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea i tona Ariki ki a ia, "tuku", ka mea ia "Kua tuku e ahau [i roto i te Ihirama] ki te Ariki o nga ao."

trans-unit.source: And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaakona a Aperahama ana tama [ki te mahi i te taua] me [na i] a Hakopa, [mea], "E aku tama, pono kua whiriwhiri Allah hoki koutou i tenei karakia, kia kaua e mate anake i he Mahometa koe."

trans-unit.source: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" They said, "We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
trans-unit.target: Ranei ko koe hei kaiwhakaatu, no te whakatata te mate a Hakopa, ka mea ia ki ana tama, "He aha e koe te koropiko i muri i ahau?"

trans-unit.source: That was a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ko te iwi i haere atu nei i runga i.

trans-unit.source: They say, "Be Jews or Christians [so] you will be guided." Say, "Rather, [we follow] the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of the polytheists."
trans-unit.target: mea ratou, "Kia Hurai, Karaitiana ranei [na] koe ka arata'ihia."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O believers], "We have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e whakapono], "Kua whakapono matou i roto i Allah, ka kua te mea kua whakakitea ki a matou, ka mea i whakakitea ki a Aperahama, a Ihimaera, a Ihaka, a Hakopa, me nga uri me nga mea i hoatu ki a Mohi, a Ihu, me nga mea i hoatu ki te

trans-unit.source: So if they believe in the same as you believe in, then they have been [rightly] guided; but if they turn away, they are only in dissension, and Allah will be sufficient for you against them. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Na, ki te whakapono ratou i roto i te taua rite whakapono koe i roto i, na ka kua ratou i [tika] arahina;

trans-unit.source: [And say, "Ours is] the religion of Allah. And who is better than Allah in [ordaining] religion? And we are worshippers of Him."
trans-unit.target: [A mea, "tatou ko] te karakia o Allah. Na ko wai te mea pai atu Allah i roto i [faatoro'araa] karakia? A he karakia o ia tatou."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Do you argue with us about Allah while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. And we are sincere [in deed and intention] to Him."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "E tautohe koe ki a matou e pā ana ki Allah i te mea kei ia to tatou Ariki, me to koutou Ariki? E hoki tatou i to tatou mahi, a ka hoki ko koe koutou mahi. Na ko tatou mau [i roto i te mahi, me te whakaaro] ki a ia.

trans-unit.source: Or do you say that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants were Jews or Christians? Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allah?" And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Ranei e mea koutou i a Aperahama, me te Ihimaera, a Ihaka, a Hakopa, me nga uri Hurai Karaitiana ranei?

trans-unit.source: That is a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ko te iwi i haere atu nei i runga i.

trans-unit.source: The foolish among the people will say, "What has turned them away from their qiblah, which they used to face?" Say, "To Allah belongs the east and the west. He guides whom He wills to a straight path."
trans-unit.target: Te wairangi i roto i te iwi, ka mea, "He aha i tahuri atu ia ratou i to ratou qiblah, i whakamahia e ratou ki te kanohi?"

trans-unit.source: And thus we have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels. And indeed, it is difficult except for those whom Allah has guided. And never would Allah have caused you to lose your faith. Indeed Allah is, to the people, Kind and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Na ko te kupu kua hanga e matou a koutou he hapori tika e ka hei koe kaiwhakaatu mo te iwi, me te anahera ka hei hei kaiwhakaatu mo koutou.

trans-unit.source: We have certainly seen the turning of your face, [O Muhammad], toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [in prayer]. Indeed, those who have been given the Scripture well know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Kua tino kite matou i te koki o to koutou mata, [e Muhammad], whaka te rangi, a ka tahuri rawa matou ki a koutou ki te qiblah ki e ka waiho koutou pai.

trans-unit.source: And if you brought to those who were given the Scripture every sign, they would not follow your qiblah. Nor will you be a follower of their qiblah. Nor would they be followers of one another's qiblah. So if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, indeed, you would then be among the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te kawea e koe ki te hunga i homai te karaipiture nga tohu, e kore ratou e whai koutou qiblah.

trans-unit.source: Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know [it].
trans-unit.target: e matau ana te hunga i hoatu ki nei matou i te karaipiture ki a ia rite matau ana ratou a ratou ake tama.

trans-unit.source: The truth is from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
trans-unit.target: Ko i to koutou Ariki te pono, pera kore i roto i nga turaki.

trans-unit.source: For each [religious following] is a direction toward which it faces. So race to [all that is] good. Wherever you may be, Allah will bring you forth [for judgement] all together. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Hoki ia [e whai ake fakalotu] ko te aronga ki e anga te reira.

trans-unit.source: So from wherever you go out [for prayer, O Muhammad] turn your face toward al- Masjid al-Haram, and indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Na i nga wahi katoa e haere ia koutou i roto i [mo te inoi, e Muhammad] tahuri tou mata ki ¨ Masjid al-Haram, a pono, he reira te pono i to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And from wherever you go out [for prayer], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] may be, turn your faces toward it in order that the people will not have any argument against you, except for those of them who commit wrong; so fear them not but fear Me. And [it is] so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: A i nga wahi katoa e haere ia koutou i roto i [mo te inoi], tahuri koutou mata ki al-Masjid al-Haram.

trans-unit.source: Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know.
trans-unit.target: Just rite Kua tonoa e matou i roto ia koutou i te karere i koutou taki ki a koutou o matou irava, me te pure koutou, me whakaako i te Buka a te whakaaro nui koutou, me te whakaako i taua kihai nei i mohiotia e koutou a koutou.

trans-unit.source: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.
trans-unit.target: Na kia mahara ki ahau;

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono, rapu te tauturu na roto i te manawanui me te inoi.

trans-unit.source: And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, "They are dead." Rather, they are alive, but you perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e mea e pā ana ki te hunga e patua i roto i te ara o Allah, "He mate ratou."

trans-unit.source: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient,
trans-unit.target: A ka pono whakamatautau koutou e matou ki te tahi mea o te wehi, me te matekai, me te mate o te taonga, me te ora, me hua, engari hoatu te rongo pai ki te manawanui,

trans-unit.source: Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return."
trans-unit.target: Ko wai, ka patu ratou kino, e mea, "Nana no tatou ki Allah, a ka hoki mai matou pono ki a ia."

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga nei ki runga ki he ngaahi tāpuaki mei to ratou Ariki, a te atawhai.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is appreciative and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, rite-Safa me al-Marwah kei roto i nga tohu o Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e huna te mea ka tonoa e matou ki raro, o mārama tohu me te ārahitanga i muri i hanga e matou mārama reira mo te iwi i roto i te karaipiture - kua kanga te hunga e Allah me kanga e te hunga e kanga,

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent and correct themselves and make evident [what they concealed]. Those - I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore hoki te hunga e ripeneta, ka fakatonutonu ratou, ka kia kitea [ta ratou huna].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - upon them will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and the people, all together,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e whakateka me mate ia he iino ratou - ki runga ki ka waiho ratou te kanga o Allah me o nga anahera, me te iwi, huihui katoa,

trans-unit.source: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: Noho e amuri noa'tu reira.

trans-unit.source: And your god is one God. There is no deity [worthy of worship] except Him, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Na to koutou atua ko te kotahi te Atua.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, and the [great] ships which sail through the sea with that which benefits people, and what Allah has sent down from the heavens of rain, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and dispersing therein every [kind of] moving creature, and [His] directing of the winds and the clouds controlled between the heaven and the earth are signs for a people who use reason.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, kua tonoa i roto i te hanganga o te rangi, me te whenua, me te whakarerekētanga o te po, me te ra, me te [nui] kaipuke e rere i roto i te moana ki taua i painga iwi, a he aha Allah iho i te rangi o te ua,

trans-unit.source: And [yet], among the people are those who take other than Allah as equals [to Him]. They love them as they [should] love Allah. But those who believe are stronger in love for Allah. And if only they who have wronged would consider [that] when they see the punishment, [they will be certain] that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is severe in punishment.
trans-unit.target: A [ano], te iwi ko te hunga e tango atu i te Allah rite i waenganui [ki a ia] i roto i.

trans-unit.source: [And they should consider that] when those who have been followed disassociate themselves from those who followed [them], and they [all] see the punishment, and cut off from them are the ties [of relationship],
trans-unit.target: [A kia whakaaro ratou e] ka disassociate te hunga kua aru ratou i te hunga e whai [ratou], a ratou [katoa] kite i te whiu, ka hatepea atu i a ratou ko nga taamuraa [o hononga],

trans-unit.source: Those who followed will say, "If only we had another turn [at worldly life] so we could disassociate ourselves from them as they have disassociated themselves from us." Thus will Allah show them their deeds as regrets upon them. And they are never to emerge from the Fire.
trans-unit.target: ka mea te hunga e aru ana, "Ki te noa i tatou tetahi tahuri [i te ora te ao] kia taea disassociate tatou ia tatou iho i ratou rite ratou i tētehi ratou i a tatou."

trans-unit.source: O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth [that is] lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: E te taata, e kai i te mea kei runga i te whenua [e ko] tika, me te pai, me te kore e whai i nga tapuwae o Hatana.

trans-unit.source: He only orders you to evil and immorality and to say about Allah what you do not know.
trans-unit.target: Ia whakahau koutou anake ki te kino, me te moepuku, me ki te mea e pā ana ki Allah te mea kahore koutou e mohio.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that which we found our fathers doing." Even though their fathers understood nothing, nor were they guided?
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "i muri i te mea kua whakakitea Allah," e mea ratou, "Engari, ka whai tatou e i kitea e tatou i to tatou matua, mahi."

trans-unit.source: The example of those who disbelieve is like that of one who shouts at what hears nothing but calls and cries cattle or sheep - deaf, dumb and blind, so they do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Te tauira o te hunga e whakateka he rite taua o tetahi e hamama i tetahi aha rongo engari waea me karanga kau ranei he hipi - turi, wahangu, me te matapo, na e kore e ratou matau.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono, e kai i te mea pai i whakaratohia e matou mo koutou, ka kia mauruuru ki Allah, ki te he te reira [pono] ia e koropiko koe.

trans-unit.source: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Kua anake riria ia ki a koutou kararehe mate, toto, te kikokiko o te poaka, me i oti e kua whakatapua ki te tahi atu i te Allah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those consume not into their bellies except the Fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ratou te hunga huna i tonoa ta Allah iho o te Buka a whakawhitia mo te utu iti - e kore te hunga pau ki o ratou puku anake te ahi.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who have exchanged guidance for error and forgiveness for punishment. How patient they are in pursuit of the Fire!
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga e kua whakawhiti ārahitanga mo te he, me te murunga mō whiu.

trans-unit.source: That is [deserved by them] because Allah has sent down the Book in truth. And indeed, those who differ over the Book are in extreme dissension.
trans-unit.target: Ko [tika e ratou] no te mea kua tonoa mai iho Allah te Buka i te pono.

trans-unit.source: Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask [for help], and for freeing slaves; [and who] establishes prayer and gives zakah; [those who] fulfill their promise when they promise; and [those who] are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous.
trans-unit.target: kahore he tika e tahuri koe tou mata ki te rawhiti i te hauauru ranei, engari [pono] te tika he [i roto i] te tangata whakapono i Allah, te Day muri, nga anahera, te Buka, me nga poropiti, me te homai taonga, i roto i te noa'tu o

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever overlooks from his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono, i whakaritea hoki koutou he utu ture hoki te hunga kohurutia - te utu mo te free, te pononga mo te pononga, me te wahine hoki te wahine.

trans-unit.source: And there is for you in legal retribution [saving of] life, O you [people] of understanding, that you may become righteous.
trans-unit.target: Na reira kei hoki koe i roto i te utu ture [faaoraraa o] te ora, e te koutou [iwi] o te matauranga, kia riro ai koutou tika.

trans-unit.source: Prescribed for you when death approaches [any] one of you if he leaves wealth [is that he should make] a bequest for the parents and near relatives according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Whakaritea hoki koutou ina huarahi mate [tetahi] tetahi o koutou ki te mahue ia taonga [ko e kia hanga e ia] te koha mo nga mātua me whanaunga tata rite ki nga mea ka manakohia - he fatongia ki runga ki te hunga tika.

trans-unit.source: Then whoever alters the bequest after he has heard it - the sin is only upon those who have altered it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Na ko te tangata e ketia te koha i muri i kua rongo ia i te reira - ko te hara anake i runga i te hunga e kua puta ke te reira.

trans-unit.source: But if one fears from the bequeather [some] error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Otiia ki te wehi tetahi i te bequeather [etahi] hapa hara ranei me papaki i te waenganui ratou, kahore he hara i runga ia ia.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous -
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono, tu'utu'uni ki runga ki te nohopuku koe rite hoki i whakaritea ki runga ki te hunga i mua ia koutou e riro ai koe tika -

trans-unit.source: [Fasting for] a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but with hardship] - a ransom [as substitute] of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: [Nohopuku hoki] he iti te maha o nga ra.

trans-unit.source: The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Te marama o Ramadhan [ko e] i roto i i whakakitea mai te Qur'an, he arata'iraa mo te iwi, me te mārama tohu o te arata'iraa, me te paearu.

trans-unit.source: And when My servants ask you, [O Muhammad], concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka ui aku pononga koutou, [e Muhammad], mo ahau - pono ahau tata ahau.

trans-unit.source: It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives [for sexual relations]. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits [set by] Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous.
trans-unit.target: Kua hanga te reira whakaaetia mo koutou i te po i mua nohopuku ki te haere ki a koutou wahine [mo taatiraa].

trans-unit.source: And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].
trans-unit.target: A e kore e pau tetahi i tetahi o taonga he tukua reira [i roto i te utu] ki nga rangatira i roto i te tikanga e [ai āwhina ratou] koe [ki] pau te wahi o te taonga o te iwi i roto i te hara, ia mohio koutou ranei [ko reira tika]

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: ui ana ratou koutou, [e Muhammad], e pā ana ki te kowhititanga marama.

trans-unit.source: Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Whawhai i roto i te ara o Allah te hunga e whawhai koe engari e kore e takahi.

trans-unit.source: And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: A ka whakamatea ratou wahi katoa mau koe ratou i pei i ratou i nga wahi katoa i peia ratou e koe, a ka fitnah he kino atu patu.

trans-unit.source: And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A ki te mutu ratou, ka pono, he Fakamolemole, me te aroha Allah.

trans-unit.source: Fight them until there is no [more] fitnah and [until] worship is [acknowledged to be] for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.
trans-unit.target: Whawhai ratou tae noa ki reira he kore [ake] fitnah me [tae noa] koropiko te [whakaae ki kia] mo Allah.

trans-unit.source: [Fighting in] the sacred month is for [aggression committed in] the sacred month, and for [all] violations is legal retribution. So whoever has assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he has assaulted you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is with those who fear Him.
trans-unit.target: [Fighting i] te marama mo'a he hoki [fakaaoao mahia i roto i] te marama mo'a, a hoki [katoa] maumaui he utu ture.

trans-unit.source: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction [by refraining]. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Na noho i roto i te ara o Allah me kore e maka [koutou] ki a koutou [ake] ringa ki te whakangaromanga [i te faka'ehi'ehi].

trans-unit.source: And complete the Hajj and 'umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head [making shaving necessary must offer] a ransom of fasting [three days] or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'umrah [during the Hajj months] followed by Hajj [offers] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find [or afford such an animal] - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned [home]. Those are ten complete [days]. This is for those whose family is not in the area of al-Masjid al-Haram. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Na whakaoti i te Hajj me 'Umrah mo Allah.

trans-unit.source: Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.
trans-unit.target: Hajj he [i roto i] nga marama pai-mohiotia, na kua meinga tangata Hajj obligatory ki runga ki a ia i reira [i te āhua o te ihram tomo], i reira he [ki kia hoki a ia] e kore taatiraa me kahore tutu me kahore tautohetohe i roto i Hajj.

trans-unit.source: There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord [during Hajj]. But when you depart from 'Arafat, remember Allah at al- Mash'ar al-Haram. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were before that among those astray.
trans-unit.target: Kahore he whakahenga kahore ki a koutou mo te rapu pai i to koutou Ariki [i roto i Hajj].

trans-unit.source: Then depart from the place from where [all] the people depart and ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Na haere atu i te wahi i te wahi [katoa] i te iwi haere me te ui te faaoreraa o Allah.

trans-unit.source: And when you have completed your rites, remember Allah like your [previous] remembrance of your fathers or with [much] greater remembrance. And among the people is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world," and he will have in the Hereafter no share.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka oti ia koe tō tikanga, mahara Allah rite tou whakamahara [mua] o koutou matua ranei ki whakamahara [nui] nui.

trans-unit.source: But among them is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire."
trans-unit.target: Ko roto ia ratou ko ia te tangata e mea, "to tatou Ariki, homai ki a matou i roto i teie nei ao [e te mea] pai a roto i te ake [i te] pai, me te tiaki ia tatou i te whiu o te ahi."

trans-unit.source: Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: ka whai i te wahi o te mea kua ratou roaa te hunga, a he tere i roto i te pūkete Allah.

trans-unit.source: And remember Allah during [specific] numbered days. Then whoever hastens [his departure] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays [until the third] - there is no sin upon him - for him who fears Allah. And fear Allah and know that unto Him you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: A ka mahara Allah i [motuhake] ra taua.

trans-unit.source: And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah to witness as to what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents.
trans-unit.target: A, o nga iwi ko ia nei kupu pai koutou i roto i te ora te ao, a ka karanga ia Allah ki kaititiro rite ki te mea kei roto i tona ngakau, ano ko ia te nui rawa o hoariri.

trans-unit.source: And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka haere atu ia, takakawe ia puta noa i ki te whenua meinga pirau reira, ka whakangaro hua me te kararehe.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and how wretched is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ia, "e wehi Allah," whakapehapeha i roto i te hara e mau o ia.

trans-unit.source: And of the people is he who sells himself, seeking means to the approval of Allah. And Allah is kind to [His] servants.
trans-unit.target: A, o nga iwi ko ia te tangata e hoko ia, e rapu ana tikanga ki te whakaae o Allah.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: E koe te hunga i whakapono, tomo ki Ihirama tino [a maitai], a kahore e whai i te tapuwae o Hatana.

trans-unit.source: But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Otiia, ki te peka koe i muri i haere mai mārama tohu ki a koutou, ko reira koutou mohio ai whakanui Allah te i roto i te Kaha, me te whakaaro nui.

trans-unit.source: Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds and the angels [as well] and the matter is [then] decided? And to Allah [all] matters are returned.
trans-unit.target: Mahi ratou taria engari kia haere mai Allah ki a ratou i roto i rakau o kapua me nga anahera [rite te pai] me te mea kei te [reira] whakatau?

trans-unit.source: Ask the Children of Israel how many a sign of evidence We have given them. And whoever exchanges the favor of Allah [for disbelief] after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: A ani i te tamariki o Iharaira, e hia nga he tohu o te taunakitanga i hoatu e matou ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: Beautified for those who disbelieve is the life of this world, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.
trans-unit.target: Ataahua hoki te hunga e whakateka ko te ora o tenei ao, a ka whakorekore ratou te hunga e whakapono ana.

trans-unit.source: Mankind was [of] one religion [before their deviation]; then Allah sent the prophets as bringers of good tidings and warners and sent down with them the Scripture in truth to judge between the people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over the Scripture except those who were given it - after the clear proofs came to them - out of jealous animosity among themselves.
