Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: Hoki te hunga e kua pahono ki to ratou Ariki, ko te pai [utu], engari te hunga e kore i te whakautu ki a ia - ki te i ratou katoa e he i roto i te whenua katoa, me te rite o taua mea ki taua mea, i pai ratou [ngana ki] utu ratou

trans-unit.source: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -
trans-unit.target: Na ko ia te tangata e mohio e te mea kua whakakitea ki a koe i tou Ariki, ko te pono rite tetahi ko wai te matapo?

trans-unit.source: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract,
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga e fakahoko i te kawenata o Allah, a kahore e whatiia te kirimana,

trans-unit.source: And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e uru e kua whakahau nei Allah ki te kia piri a wehi ratou Ariki, a he wehi o te kino o [to ratou] pūkete,

trans-unit.source: And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e manawanui, rapu i te mata o to ratou Ariki, a ka whakapumautia te inoi, me te noho i te mea kua whakaratohia e matou mo ratou puku, me te nuitia ki te ārai i te kino ki te pai - ka whai te hunga te hopearaa pai o [tenei] kāinga -

trans-unit.source: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],
trans-unit.target: Gardens o noho mau tonu;

trans-unit.source: "Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home."
trans-unit.target: "Kia tau te rangimarie ki runga ki a koe mo ta koutou whakamanawanui ana. Na pai ko te whare whakamutunga."

trans-unit.source: But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga e whati i te kawenata o Allah i muri i kirimana reira, ka wehewehe i taua kua whakahau nei Allah ki te kia piri, ka horahia te pirau i runga i te whenua - he hoki ratou te kanga, a ka whai ratou i te kino kāinga.

trans-unit.source: Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.
trans-unit.target: toro Allah whakaratonga mo e pai ia, e whakawhāiti [te reira].

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakapono mea, "He aha i te tohu e kore i tonoa iho ki a ia i tona Ariki?"

trans-unit.source: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured."
trans-unit.target: Te hunga kua whakapono a e fakapapau'i e te mahara o Allah nei ngakau.

trans-unit.source: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.
trans-unit.target: He ratou me he hoki pai te kāwanatanga pai - te hunga kua whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika.

trans-unit.source: Thus have We sent you to a community before which [other] communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return."
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu i tono tangata matou ki a koutou ki te hapori i mua i nei i haere [te tahi atu] hapori i runga i pera ai te taki koe ki a ratou e i whakakitea matou ki a koutou, ia ratou e whakateka i te aroha Rawa.

trans-unit.source: And if there was any qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur'an], but to Allah belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in [His] promise.
trans-unit.target: A ki te mea i reira ko tetahi Qur'an i ai e nga maunga kia nekehia atu ranei e kia pakaru te whenua motu ranei e hanga te tupapaku kia ki te korero, [e riro te reira tenei Qur'an], engari ki Allah no katoa te take.

trans-unit.source: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.
trans-unit.target: Na ko kua [atu] karere kataina koe i mua, a atu ahau i te wa o te hunga e whakapono;

trans-unit.source: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, [knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]? But to Allah they have attributed partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent of speech?" Rather, their [own] plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allah leaves astray - there will be for him no guide.
trans-unit.target: Katahi ia Ko te te tangata ko te kaiwhakamau o nga wairua, [mohio] he aha te kua roaa te reira, [rite ki tetahi atu]?

trans-unit.source: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector.
trans-unit.target: No te mea ka waiho ratou whiu i roto i te ora o te ao [tenei], a ko atu nui te whiu o te ake.

trans-unit.source: The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Te tauira o Pararaiha, i tei fafauhia i te tika, ko te [e] i raro rere reira awa.

trans-unit.source: And [the believers among] those to whom We have given the [previous] Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not associate [anything] with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."
trans-unit.target: Na [te whakapono i roto i] te hunga Kua hoatu e matou te karaipiture [mua] ki nei koa i te mea kua whakakitea ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], engari i roto i te [hoariri] wehenga ko te hunga e whakakahore wahi o reira.

trans-unit.source: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector.
trans-unit.target: Na ko te kupu kua whakakitea e matou i te reira hei ture Arabic.

trans-unit.source: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.
trans-unit.target: A kua tonoa matou kē karere koutou i mua, ka whakaritea ki a ratou wahine, me uri.

trans-unit.source: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.
trans-unit.target: Allah faaore aha pai ia ranei ne fakapapau◊i, a ki a ia ko te Mother o te Buka.

trans-unit.source: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.
trans-unit.target: A ahakoa whakaatu matou ki a koutou wahi o te mea fafau tatou ratou ranei e tangohia e koe i roto i te mate, ki runga ki te mea koe anake te [ohipa o] whakamōhiotanga, a ki runga ki tatou ko te pūkete.

trans-unit.source: Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: kahore i ratou i kite i whakaturia matou i runga i te whenua, whakaiti i te reira i ona rohe?

trans-unit.source: And those before them had plotted, but to Allah belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.
trans-unit.target: A te hunga ratou i mua i whakaaroa, engari ki Allah no katoa te mahere.

trans-unit.source: And those who have disbelieved say, "You are not a messenger." Say, [O Muhammad], "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you, and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga kua whakapono mea, "E kore e te anahera koe."

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Ra.

trans-unit.source: Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment
trans-unit.target: Allah, ki nei no te mea kei roto i te rangi, me te mea e kei i runga i te whenua.

trans-unit.source: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah, seeking to make it (seem) deviant. Those are in extreme error.
trans-unit.target: Nga mea e hiahia i te ora te ao i runga i te ake, ka karohia [iwi] i te ara o Allah, e whai ana ki te hanga i te reira (mea) Deviant.

trans-unit.source: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: A kihai tatou i tonoa e tetahi anahera ki te kahore [korero] i roto i te reo o tona iwi ki te kī mārama hoki ratou, a ka tukua Allah kotiti [reira] e pai ia, me nga kaiarahi e pai ia.

trans-unit.source: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tino tonoa e matou a Mohi ki to tatou tohu, [mea], "Whakaputaina mai tou iwi i pouri ki te marama, me te fakamanatu ratou o nga ra o Allah."

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when Moses said to His people, "Remember the favor of Allah upon you when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
trans-unit.target: A [maumahara, e tamariki o Iharaira], ka mea a Mohi ki tana iwi, "Kia mahara ki te manakohia o Allah ki runga ki a koutou, ka whakaorangia ia koutou i te iwi o Parao, i whakatupu kino ia koutou ki te kino mamae me te i patu koutou [hou]

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.' "
trans-unit.target: A [mahara] ka karangatia koutou Ariki, 'Ki te ko koe mauruuru, ka whakanui i pono ahau a koutou [i roto i te manako];

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "If you should disbelieve, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea a Mohi, "Ki te kia whakateka koe, koutou me te tangata kei runga i te whenua katoa - pono, he Free o hiahia, me te whakamoemiti Allah."

trans-unit.source: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."
trans-unit.target: Kua reira e kore tae koutou ki te rongo o te hunga i mua ia koutou - te iwi o Noa, me 'tō ko Thamud me te hunga i muri ia ia ratou?

trans-unit.source: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou karere, "Ka taea e reira kia feaa e pā ana ki Allah, Kaihanga o nga rangi, me te whenua? karangatia e ia a koutou e kia whakarerea noatia e ia a koutou o koutou hara, a ka roa e ia to koutou mate mo te wā i tohua."

trans-unit.source: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou karere ki a ratou, "He matou tangata anake rite koe, engari foaki Allah manakohia pai nei ki runga ki ia o ana pononga. kore Kua riro te reira no ki a tatou kawea koutou taunakitanga anake i te whakaaetanga o Allah. A i runga i Allah kia te whakapono whakawhirinaki.

trans-unit.source: And why should we not rely upon Allah while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allah let those who would rely [indeed] rely."
trans-unit.target: A he aha e kore matou e whakawhirinaki ki runga ki Allah ia kua arahina e ia tatou ki to tatou [pai] ara.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea te hunga e whakapono ki a ratou karere, "pono ​​ka peia e matou ki a koutou i roto i o matou whenua, me hoki koe ki ta tatou haapa'oraa e aore."

trans-unit.source: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."
trans-unit.target: A ka meinga rawa matou ki a koutou noho i roto i te whenua i muri ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tono ratou wikitoria i Allah, a whakama, [Na reira], ko nga nanakia pakeke.

trans-unit.source: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.
trans-unit.target: I mua i a ia ko te reinga, a ka hoatu e ia he inu wai purulent.

trans-unit.source: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.
trans-unit.target: ka horomia e ia i te reira engari whakauaua [e taea ki] horomia reira e.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.
trans-unit.target: Te tauira o te hunga e whakateka i roto i to ratou Ariki ko [e] e ratou mahi ano he pungarehu i pupuhi te hau kaha i runga i te ra, e te paroro;

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.
trans-unit.target: kahore i kite koutou i hanga Allah te rangi me te whenua i roto i te pono?

trans-unit.source: And that is not difficult for Allah.
trans-unit.target: A kahore he uaua hoki Allah e.

trans-unit.source: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."
trans-unit.target: A ka haere mai ratou i roto i [mo te whakawa] te aroaro o Allah tahi katoa, a ka mea te ngoikore ki te hunga i whakakake, "Ko e mo'oni, ko o koutou muimuí tatou, kia taea e koe te aua tatou tetahi mea ki te whiu o Allah?"

trans-unit.source: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allah] before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea a Hatana kua ina kua mutu te mea, "Ko e mo'oni, i korero Allah i koe te kupu whakaari o te pono. Na ka korero ahau ki a koutou, engari i tuku ahau ki a koutou. Otiia i ahau kahore he mana mo koutou anake i karangatia e ahau ki a koutou, a ka pahono koe ki

trans-unit.source: And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakapono, ka i ka uru mahi tika ki nga kari i raro nei nga awa rere, noho e amuri noa'tu reira na roto i te whakaaetanga o ratou Ariki;

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?
trans-unit.target: kore i koe whakaaro pehea E whakaatu ana Allah he tauira, [whakaritea] rite te rakau pai he kupu pai, tona pakiaka te mau whakaritea me ona manga [tiketike] i roto i te rangi?

trans-unit.source: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: hua te reira i ona hua i te wa katoa, i te whakaaetanga o ona Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.
trans-unit.target: Na te tauira o te kupu kino kei rite te rakau kino, hutia i te mata o te whenua, e kore e he tetahi pūmautanga.

trans-unit.source: Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.
trans-unit.target: pupuri Allah to te hunga e whakapono ana, te kupu u ki, i roto i te ora te ao, me te i roto i te ake.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?
trans-unit.target: kore i koe whakaaro te hunga e whakawhiti te manakohia o Allah mō te ti'aturi ore, a noho ratou iwi [i roto i] te fare o te whakangaromanga?

trans-unit.source: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.
trans-unit.target: [Ko] te reinga, e ka ratou [tomo ki] tahu, a mate ko te whakataunga.

trans-unit.source: And they have attributed to Allah equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."
trans-unit.target: A kua pēnei ana ratou ki ōrite Allah ki te whakapohehe [iwi] i tona ara.

trans-unit.source: [O Muhammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange, nor any friendships.
trans-unit.target: [E Muhammad], korero ki aku pononga nei kua whakapono ki te whakapumautia inoi, me te noho i te mea i whakaratohia e matou ratou, puku, me te nuitia, i mua i haere mai he Day i roto i nei i reira e kia kore utu, e kore ano tetahi auhoaraa.

trans-unit.source: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.
trans-unit.target: Ko Allah nana nei i hanga nga rangi, me te whenua, a tonoa iho ua i te rangi, a hua reira etahi hua rite whakaratonga mo koutou, ka waiho i raro hoki koutou i te kaipuke ki te rere i roto i te moana i tona kupu ka raro hoki koutou i te awa.

trans-unit.source: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.
trans-unit.target: Na i raro ia mo koutou i te ra me te marama, tonu [i roto i te ohuraa], ka raro hoki koutou i te po, me te ra.

trans-unit.source: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoatu e ia ki a koutou i katoa ui koe o ia.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua, e Muhammad], ka mea a Aperahama, "E toku Ariki, kia tenei pa [Makkah] haumaru, me te pupuri i ahau, me aku tama atu i koropiko whakapakoko.

trans-unit.source: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Toku Ariki, pono kua arahina e ratou kotiti ke tokomaha i roto i te iwi.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.
trans-unit.target: To tatou Ariki, kua noho ahau etahi o aku uri i roto i te awaawa noa iho e tata ana tou Whare tapu, to tatou Ariki, kia whakapumautia ratou inoi.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.
trans-unit.target: To tatou Ariki, pono mohio koe ki ta huna matou me aha matou whakaatu, me tetahi mea e ngaro i Allah i runga i te whenua ranei i roto i te rangi.

trans-unit.source: Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
trans-unit.target: Whakamoemititia ki Allah, e kua homai ki ahau i roto i te koroheketanga Ihimaera ko Ihaka.

trans-unit.source: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
trans-unit.target: Toku Ariki, kia ahau he whakapumau o te inoi, a [tokomaha] i oku uri.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."
trans-unit.target: To tatou Ariki, whakarerea noatia iho ahau, me aku mātua me te whakapono te Day whakapumautia te pūkete te. "

trans-unit.source: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].
trans-unit.target: A e kore whakaaro e he mohio o ta te kino te mahi Allah.

trans-unit.source: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.
trans-unit.target: Racing mua, whakaarahia ratou matenga ake, e kore e ratou mawhiti hoki ki a ratou haere mai, a he whakakahore ratou ngakau.

trans-unit.source: And, [O Muhammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?
trans-unit.target: Na, [e Muhammad], faaara te iwi o te Day, ina ka tae mai i te whiu ki a ratou, a ka mea te hunga e mea ai he, "to tatou Ariki, whakaroa tatou hoki te wā poto:. E whakahoki matou tou karanga, me te whai i nga karere"

trans-unit.source: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."
trans-unit.target: Na ka noho koutou i roto i nga nohoanga o te hunga e tukinotia ana ratou, a kua riro te reira mārama ki a koutou pehea ta matou ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.
trans-unit.target: A i whakaritea e ratou to ratou mahere, engari ki a Allah te [tuhia] ratou mahere, ara, ki te i i to ratou mahere [rawaka] ki te mahi atu ki nga maunga.

trans-unit.source: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
trans-unit.target: Na e kore te whakaaro e ka kore Allah i roto i tona kupu whakaari ki ana karere.

trans-unit.source: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
trans-unit.target: [Ka waiho te reira i] i runga i te Day ka te whenua kia whakakapia e tetahi whenua, a ka tae mai i te rangi [rite te pai], me mea katoa i te aroaro o Allah, te Mea, te kaha.

trans-unit.source: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,
trans-unit.target: A ka kite koe i te kaimahi kino i herea tahi Day i roto i mekameka,

trans-unit.source: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Ratou kakahu o wai te ware me o ratou mata hipoki e te ahi.

trans-unit.source: So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: Na e Allah e utu nga wairua hoki te mea roaa te reira.

trans-unit.source: This [Qur'an] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: [Qur'an] he whakamōhiotanga mō te iwi tenei e kia fakatokanga ratou reira me e kia mohio ratou e he ia ko tetahi i te Atua, me te e ka te hunga o te matauranga e fakamanatu.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Ra.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.
trans-unit.target: Mahalo te hunga e whakateka, ka hiahia e i ratou Mahometa.

trans-unit.source: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Kia kai ratou, ka pārekareka ki ratou, ka kia whakarere i te tumanako [teka], e haere hoki ratou ki te mohio ki.

trans-unit.source: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i whakangaromia matou tetahi pa engari e hoki reira ko te ture mohiotia.

trans-unit.source: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.
trans-unit.target: ka pahika atu ki mua he iwi ona wā, e kore ano e ratou noho muri.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "E te koe kua i te karere i tonoa iho nei ki runga ki, pono he haurangi koe.

trans-unit.source: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"
trans-unit.target: He aha e kore e koutou kawea mai matou i te anahera, ki te kia waiho koe i roto i te pono? "

trans-unit.source: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: E kore matou e tukua iho nga anahera anake ki te pono;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko reira matou e tonoa iho te Qur'an, a pono, ka waiho matou tona kaitiaki.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.
trans-unit.target: Na ka i tino tonoa e matou [karere] koutou i mua, [e Muhammad], i roto i nga mau haapa'oraa o te iwi o mua.

trans-unit.source: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.
trans-unit.target: A e haere mai kahore karere ki a ratou anake e kataina ratou ia.

trans-unit.source: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu e tatou kōkuhu whakakāhoretanga ki te ngakau o nga kaimahi kino.

trans-unit.source: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e whakapono i roto i reira, i te reira kua kua puta te tauira o nga iwi o mua.

trans-unit.source: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,
trans-unit.target: A [ara] ki te tuwhera matou ki a ratou i te kuwaha i te rangi, a haere tonu ratou ki reira ki te piki,

trans-unit.source: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: e mea ratou, "Kua anake kua atarua tatou kanohi. Engari, ko te iwi pāngia e te makutu tatou."

trans-unit.source: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.
trans-unit.target: A kua whakanohoia e matou i roto i nga whetu nui te rangi me te kua ataahua reira mo nga mataitai.

trans-unit.source: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]
trans-unit.target: Na kua tiakina matou i te reira i nga rewera i peia e [i te aroha o Allah]

trans-unit.source: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore tetahi e tahae ana i tetahi rongo, me te te whaia e te mura mārama tahu.

trans-unit.source: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.
trans-unit.target: Na te whenua - kua horahia e matou i te reira, ka maka ki roto mau whakaturia maunga, ka meinga ki te tupu reira [te tahi mea] o nga mea pai-taurite.

trans-unit.source: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga e matou mo reira te tikanga koutou i te ora, me te [mo] te hunga hoki e kore e koe kaiwhakarato.

trans-unit.source: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.
trans-unit.target: A kahore he mea i reira engari i ki tatou ko ona depositories, a kore matou e tukua ki raro anake rite ki te mehua mohiotia.

trans-unit.source: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.
trans-unit.target: A kua tonoa e matou nga hau fertilizing a tonoa iho wai i te rangi, a homai inu koe i te reira.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.
trans-unit.target: A pono, he reira matou e hoatu e te ora, me te tohe te mate, a ko matou te ma'u.

trans-unit.source: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].
trans-unit.target: Na kua mohio tatou kua te mua [whakatupuranga] i roto ia koutou, a kua mohio kua matou te [feia ki mai] i muri mai.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A pono, ka kohikohia ratou to koutou Ariki;

trans-unit.source: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
trans-unit.target: Na i tino hanga tatou i te tangata i roto i te paru i te paru pango rereke.

trans-unit.source: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.
trans-unit.target: Na te jinn hanga i mua tatou i te ahi.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua, e Muhammad], ka mea koutou Ariki ki nga anahera, "ka hanga e ahau he tangata te i roto i te paru i te paru pango rereke.

trans-unit.source: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."
trans-unit.target: A, no ka kua proportioned ahau ia, ka hemo ki a ia o toku [hanga] wairua, ka taka ki raro, ki a ia i roto i te prostration. "

trans-unit.source: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
trans-unit.target: Na piko nga anahera - katoa o ratou katoa,

trans-unit.source: Except Iblees, he refused to be with those who prostrated.
trans-unit.target: Te kore Iblees, kihai ia ki te hei ki te hunga e koropiko.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], e Iblees, he aha te mea [te mea] ki a koutou e kore e koe ki te hunga e koropiko? "

trans-unit.source: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Kaua rawa e koropiko ahau ki te tangata i hanga nei e koe i roto o te paru i te paru pango rereke."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "Na te tiki i roto i taua mea, mo pono, kua peia e koutou.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."
trans-unit.target: A pono, ki a koutou ko te kanga noa te Day o utua. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E toku Ariki, ka reprieve ahau tae noa ki te Day e faatiahia mai ratou."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "Na pono, ko koe o te hunga reprieved

trans-unit.source: Until the Day of the time well-known."
trans-unit.target: Tae noa te Day o te wa pai-mohiotia. "

trans-unit.source: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all
trans-unit.target: mea [Iblees], "E toku Ariki, no te mea kua whakatakotoria ahau e koe i roto i te hapa, he pono ka meinga e ahau [tutu] ātaahua ki a ratou i runga i te whenua, a ka whakapohehetia e ahau ki a ratou katoa

trans-unit.source: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore, au pononga i whiriwhiri i roto ia ratou,. "

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "Ko te ara [o te hoki] ki ahau [e ko] tika tenei.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, aku pononga - e kore te mana e whai koe mo ratou, kahore te hunga e whai koutou o nga deviators.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.
trans-unit.target: A pono, reinga ko te wahi fafauhia mo ratou katoa.

trans-unit.source: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."
trans-unit.target: E whitu nga kuwaha;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka hei te tangata tika i roto i ngā māra, me puna.

trans-unit.source: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."
trans-unit.target: [He kua korerotia], "E tomo te reira i roto i te rangimarie, haumaru [me te mau]."

trans-unit.source: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.
trans-unit.target: A ka tango matou nga mea katoa kei roto i to ratou uma o inoino, [na ka waiho ratou] teina, i runga i nga torona anga ia atu.

trans-unit.source: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.
trans-unit.target: No rohirohi ka pa ki a ratou i reira, e kore ano i ka ratou [ake] kia nekehia atu te reira.

trans-unit.source: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: [E Muhammad], e aku pononga e ko te reira e ahau te Fakamolemole e ahau, i te aroha.

trans-unit.source: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A, e ko te reira te whiu mo toku nei ko te whiu mauiui.

trans-unit.source: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
trans-unit.target: A e ratou e pā ana ki te manuhiri o Aperahama,

trans-unit.source: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."
trans-unit.target: A, no ka tomo ratou ki runga ki a ia, ka mea, "te rangimarie."

trans-unit.source: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."
trans-unit.target: mea [te mau melahi], "Kaua e wehi. He pono, hoatu e matou a koutou te rongopai o te tamaiti ako."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Kua homai e koe ki ahau te rongopai ahakoa kua tae mai koroheketanga ki runga ki ahau? Na ka o ta [miharo] e koe e?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Kua hoatu e matou a koutou te rongo pai i roto i te pono, kia kaua e o te tumanako."

trans-unit.source: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Na te tangata Kahore o te aroha o tona Ariki kahore hoki te hunga kotiti ke?"

trans-unit.source: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
trans-unit.target: mea [a Aperahama], "Na te aha te mea koutou mahi [konei], e karere?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "He pono, kua tonoa e matou ki te iwi o te kino,

trans-unit.source: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all
trans-unit.target: I kahore te hapu o Rota;

trans-unit.source: Except his wife." Allah decreed that she is of those who remain behind.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore tana wahine. "Whakaritea Allah e ko ia o te hunga e toe i muri.

trans-unit.source: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,
trans-unit.target: A, no te haere mai nga karere ki te hapu o Rota,

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko e mo'oni, ko koe te iwi unknown."

trans-unit.source: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko kua tae mai matou ki a koutou ki taua e pā ana ki i i totohe ratou,

trans-unit.source: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tae mai matou ki a koutou ki te pono, a pono, he pono matou.

trans-unit.source: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."
trans-unit.target: Na whakaturia i roto i to outou utuafare i roto i te wahi o te po, me te whai i muri ia ratou, ka kia kaua tetahi i roto ia koutou e titiro ki muri, ka haere tonu i runga i ki te wahi e whakahaua e koe. "

trans-unit.source: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kawea matou ki a ia [te ture] o taua mea: e pai te hunga [hunga hara] kia whakakorea e wawe te ata.

trans-unit.source: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
trans-unit.target: Na ka haere mai te iwi o te pa hari.

trans-unit.source: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.
trans-unit.target: mea [a Rota], "Ko e mo'oni, ko oku manuhiri enei, na e kore mahi whakama ahau.

trans-unit.source: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."
trans-unit.target: A wehi Allah me kaua e whakaititia ahau. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Kahore riria koe e matou i [tiaki] iwi?"

trans-unit.source: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."
trans-unit.target: [Rota] mea, "Ko taku tamahine enei -., Ki te pai kia koutou kaimahi [o te faaipoiporaa tika]"

trans-unit.source: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.
trans-unit.target: E to outou oraraa, [e Muhammad], pono ratou i, i roto i to ratou haurangi, e pohehe matapo.

trans-unit.source: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.
trans-unit.target: Heoi ka hopukina ratou te karanga i te putanga mai.

trans-unit.source: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e matou te wahi teitei [o te pa] ona raro a uaina ki runga ki a ratou te kohatu o te paru pakeke.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i te hunga tohu mo te hunga e mohio.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.
trans-unit.target: A pono, he [kei] i runga i te huarahi whakapumautia aua pa.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu mo te whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Na ko nga hoa o te puia [ano] hara.

trans-unit.source: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mau matou utu i a ratou, a pono, e rua [pa] kei i runga i te ara mārama.

trans-unit.source: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.
trans-unit.target: A tino i whakakahore i te karere nga hoa o Thamud.

trans-unit.source: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoatu e matou a ratou to tatou tohu, engari i tahuri atu ratou i ratou.

trans-unit.source: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
trans-unit.target: A ka whakamahia ratou ki whakairo i nga maunga, whare, ongo'i haumaru.

trans-unit.source: But the shriek seized them at early morning.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mau ratou ki te karanga i te tīmatanga o te ata.

trans-unit.source: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.
trans-unit.target: Na tetahi mea awhina ratou [i] ta ratou whakamahia ki te whiwhi.

trans-unit.source: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i hanga e matou nga rangi me te whenua, me e waenganui ia ratou anake i roto i te pono.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te matau Kaihanga.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino hoatu e matou a koutou, [e Muhammad], e whitu o te maha toutou [irava] me te Qur'an nui.

trans-unit.source: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers
trans-unit.target: Kaua e whakawhānui koutou kanohi ki taua i nei i hoatu e matou oaoaraa ki [etahi] kāwai o nga iino, a kaua e pouri mo ratou.

trans-unit.source: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -
trans-unit.target: A mea, "Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau te marama Warner" -

trans-unit.source: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators
trans-unit.target: Just rite i whakakitea matou [papa'iraa mo'a] ki te whakawehe

trans-unit.source: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai kua hanga nga Qur'an ki wahi.

trans-unit.source: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all
trans-unit.target: Na i to koutou Ariki, he pono ka ui matou ratou katoa

trans-unit.source: About what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Mō ta ratou whakamahia ki te mahi.

trans-unit.source: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaatu he aha e whakahaua e koe, ka tahuri atu i te polytheists.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, He rawaka matou mo koutou ki te hunga whakahi

trans-unit.source: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai hanga [rite] ki Allah tetahi atua.

trans-unit.source: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
trans-unit.target: A ka mohio kua matou e tohea koutou uma e ta ratou e mea.

trans-unit.source: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].
trans-unit.target: Na whakanui [Allah] ki whakamoemiti a koutou Ariki, a kia o te hunga e koropiko [ki a ia].

trans-unit.source: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).
trans-unit.target: A ka koropiko koutou Ariki noa i reira tae mai ki a koutou te tino (te mate).

trans-unit.source: The command of Allah is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Kei te haere mai i te whakahau a Allah, kia kaua e pouri hoki reira.

trans-unit.source: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."
trans-unit.target: tukua ana e ia ki raro nga anahera, ki te faaururaa o tona whakahau, pai nei ki runga ki ia o ana pononga, [korero ratou], "Whakatūpato e te mea kahore he atua ahau anake; na wehi ahau."

trans-unit.source: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: hanga e ia nga rangi, me te whenua i roto i te pono.

trans-unit.source: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.
trans-unit.target: hanga e ia te tangata i te parāoa-te maturuturunga iho;

trans-unit.source: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.
trans-unit.target: Na te kararehe karaihe kua hanga e ia mo koutou;

trans-unit.source: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].
trans-unit.target: A mo koutou i roto i a ratou ko [te oaoaraa o] ataahua, ina kawea ratou koutou i roto i [mo te ahiahi] a, ka tonoa koe ratou i roto i [ki te wahi kai].

trans-unit.source: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A kawe ratou koutou kawenga ki te whenua kihai i taea kua tae koutou ki te kahore ki te uaua ki a koutou.

trans-unit.source: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.
trans-unit.target: A [hanga e ia] te hoiho, nga muera, me nga kaihe mo koutou ki te eke a [rite] whakarākei.

trans-unit.source: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among the various paths are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.
trans-unit.target: A ki a Allah ko te aronga o te [tika] ara, a i roto i te ngā huarahi e te hunga raa'tu.

trans-unit.source: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata e tuku iho te ua i te rangi;

trans-unit.source: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
trans-unit.target: ai ia ki te tupu hoki a koutou reira nga hua, oriwa, nikau, waina, a i nga hua katoa.

trans-unit.source: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
trans-unit.target: A i waiho e ia mo koutou te po ra me ko te ra me te marama, ka riro nei ki raro nga whetu i tona kupu.

trans-unit.source: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.
trans-unit.target: A [i waiho e ia] mea katoa whakanuia e ia mo koutou i runga i te whenua o rerekē tae.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te kaiwhakarite i te moana hoki ki a koutou e kai i te reira i te kai ngawari, me te ki te tango i reira whakapaipai e kakahu koe.

trans-unit.source: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,
trans-unit.target: Na kua maka e ia ki te whenua mau whakaturia maunga, kei nuku reira ki a koutou, a [i hanga] awa me rori, e arata'ihia ai koutou,

trans-unit.source: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.
trans-unit.target: A pou whenua.

trans-unit.source: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?
trans-unit.target: Na ko ia te tangata e hanga rite tetahi e kore e hanga?

trans-unit.source: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te kia tatau koe i te ara o Allah, kihai koutou i ahei te tatau ratou.

trans-unit.source: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.
trans-unit.target: Na e mohio ana Allah te mea huna koutou me te mea e whakaatu koe.

trans-unit.source: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga mahara ratou atu atu Allah kahore waihanga, a kua hanga ratou [ratou].

trans-unit.source: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.
trans-unit.target: Ko ratou, [i roto i te meka], kua mate, e kore e ora, a ratou e kore e kite ina ka ratou e toetu'u.

trans-unit.source: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.
trans-unit.target: To koutou atua ko te kotahi te Atua.

trans-unit.source: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
trans-unit.target: Pono, e mohio ana Allah ta huna ratou, me ta ratou whakaatu.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the former peoples,"
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "He aha i tonoa iho koutou Ariki?"

trans-unit.source: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
trans-unit.target: Kia mau ratou to ratou ake kawenga i roto i te ki tonu i runga i te Day o raa me etahi o nga kawenga o te hunga e misguide ratou kahore matauranga.

trans-unit.source: Those before them had already plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ratou i mua i whakatupu kua, engari ka haere mai Allah i hanga ratou i nga turanga, na hinga te tuanui ki runga ki a ratou i runga ia ratou, a ka haere mai te whiu ki a ratou i te wahi kihai ratou i kite.

trans-unit.source: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -
trans-unit.target: Na i runga i te Day o raa ia e whakaititia ratou, ka mea, "Kei hea he toku 'hoa' hoki nei whakamahia koe ki te whakahe [te whakapono]?"

trans-unit.source: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: Nga mea nei tango nga anahera i roto i te mate [ia] nana ratou, a [e] ka whakahere tāpaetanga, [mea], "E kore matou i mahi i tetahi he."

trans-unit.source: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
trans-unit.target: Na tomo nga kuwaha o te reinga ki noho noa'tu reira, a pehea waikorohuhu ko te noho o te hunga whakakake.

trans-unit.source: And it will be said to those who feared Allah, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -
trans-unit.target: A ka mea te reira ki te hunga e wehi Allah, "He aha i to koutou Ariki tukua iho?"

trans-unit.source: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous -
trans-unit.target: Gardens o noho mau tonu, e ratou e tomo, raro nei rere awa.

trans-unit.source: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Nga mea nei tango nga anahera i roto i te mate, [te] pai, me te ma;

trans-unit.source: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Kaua tatari nga iino [tetahi] anake e kia haere mai nga anahera ki a ratou i reira mai te whakahau a to koutou Ariki ranei?

trans-unit.source: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Na i patua e ratou i nga hopearaa kino o mea i mea ai ratou, a i hipoki i ta ratou whakamahia ki te manuki.

trans-unit.source: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e piri etahi ki Allah mea, "Ki te i pai Allah, kua kore e koropiko matou tetahi atu atu a ia, kihai ano hoki i tatou ranei o matou matua, e kore ano riria tatou tetahi mea i roto i te tahi atu i te ia."

trans-unit.source: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid Taghut." And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tino tonoa e matou ki nga iwi katoa te karere, [mea], "koropiko Allah me te karo Taghut."

trans-unit.source: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muhammad], indeed, Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.
trans-unit.target: [Ahakoa] ki te feinga koe mo ratou arata'iraa, [e Muhammad], pono, Allah e kore ārahi te hunga tukua ia kotiti ke, a ka whai ratou kahore kaiawhina.

trans-unit.source: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.
trans-unit.target: A oati ana ratou e Allah ratou oati kaha [e] kore Allah e faatia kotahi e mate.

trans-unit.source: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.
trans-unit.target: [Ko] pena ka meinga ia mārama ki a ratou [te parau mau o] e rerekē ai ratou, a na te hunga kua whakapono kia mohio ai he teka ratou.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, tatou kupu ki te mea ka hiahia tatou he reira engari e mea matou ki a reira, "Kia," a ko reira.

trans-unit.source: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e heke hoki [te take o] Allah i muri i ratou i tukinotia - ka pono noho ratou matou i roto i tenei ao i roto i te wahi pai;

trans-unit.source: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.
trans-unit.target: [Ko ratou] te hunga e whakamanawanui ana me runga i okioki ratou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.
trans-unit.target: A e kore matou tonoa koutou i te aroaro o te kore nga tangata whakakitea ki nei matou [tatou parau poro'i].

trans-unit.source: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.
trans-unit.target: [Tonoa e matou ratou] ki mārama tohu me ouau tuhituhia.

trans-unit.source: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?
trans-unit.target: Na, mahi te hunga i whakaritea mahi kino ite mau e kore e meinga Allah te whenua ki te horomia ratou ranei e kore e tae mai i te whiu ki runga ki a ratou i te wahi e kore ratou e kite?

trans-unit.source: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure?
trans-unit.target: Ranei e kore e hopukia ia ratou i roto i to ratou mahi [mua], a kihai i ahei te meinga ratou kore?

trans-unit.source: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ranei e kore e hopukia ia ratou āta [i roto i te āhua o te wehi]?

trans-unit.source: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah, while they are humble.
trans-unit.target: kahore i ratou whakaaro i hanga nga mea mea kua Allah?

trans-unit.source: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.
trans-unit.target: A ki prostrates Allah mea katoa kei roto i te rangi me nga mea kei runga i te whenua o mea, me nga anahera [rite te pai], a kahore e ratou whakakake.

trans-unit.source: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
trans-unit.target: wehi ana ratou to ratou Ariki i runga ia ratou, a ka mahi ratou ki ta e whakahau ratou.

trans-unit.source: And Allah has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea a Allah kua, "Kaua e tango hoki atua koutou rua. Ko ia ko tetahi Atua, na ahau e wehi anake."

trans-unit.source: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?
trans-unit.target: A no ki a ia nga mea katoa kei roto i te rangi me te whenua, a ka he [tika] koropiko ki a ia tonu.

trans-unit.source: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.
trans-unit.target: A mea katoa whai koe te manakohia - he reira i Allah.

trans-unit.source: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord
trans-unit.target: Na ka tango ia i te ati i a koutou, i kotahi te rōpū o koutou pāhono etahi ki to ratou Ariki

trans-unit.source: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore ratou ki ta i hoatu e matou ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.
trans-unit.target: A faataa i ratou ki te mea ratou kahore e mohio ki te wahi o taua i whakaratohia e matou ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.
trans-unit.target: A parau ratou ki Allah tamahine - whakanuia ko ia - a mo ratou ko te ta ratou hiahia.

trans-unit.source: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka mōhio tetahi o ratou te o [te whanau o] te wahine, riro pouri tona mata, a ka Kōpeke ia pouri.

trans-unit.source: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.
trans-unit.target: huna ia ia i te iwi no te mea o te mate o e kua ia kua ana.

trans-unit.source: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Hoki te hunga e kore e whakapono i roto i te ake ko te whakaahuatanga o te kino;

trans-unit.source: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
trans-unit.target: A, ki te ko Allah ki te tangohia whakahenga i runga i te iwi mo to ratou he, kihai i pai ki kua mahue ia i runga i te whenua i tetahi mea, engari faataupupuraa e ia a ratou mo te wā whakaritea.

trans-unit.source: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.
trans-unit.target: A parau ratou ki Allah i kāore ratou, a ka whakapuaki ratou arero i te teka e ka whai ratou i te pai [i ia].

trans-unit.source: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: E Allah, i pono tono tatou i [karere] ki nga iwi koutou i mua, otiia hanga Hatana ratou mahi ātaahua ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i matou whakakitea ki a koutou i te Buka, [e Muhammad], kahore hoki ki a koutou kia mārama ki a ratou e kua taa ê ai ratou, a rite arata'iraa me tohu hoki te iwi nei i whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kua tonoa Allah iho ua i te rangi, me te ora i homai reira ki te whenua i muri i tona lifelessness.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.
trans-unit.target: A pono, mo koutou i roto i whangai kararehe ko te haapiiraa.

trans-unit.source: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.
trans-unit.target: A i nga hua o nga rakau nikau me waina tango koe kai intoxicant me te pai.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.
trans-unit.target: Na ka faauruhia to koutou Ariki ki te pī, "Tangohia hoki koe i roto i nga maunga, whare, a i roto i nga rakau, me te [i roto i] e e hanga e ratou.

trans-unit.source: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
trans-unit.target: Na kai i nga hua katoa, me te whai i nga ara o tou Ariki whakatakotoria iho [mo koutou]. "He puta i to ratou puku i te inu, rerekē i roto i ngā tae, i roto i nei i reira te te whakaora i hoki te iwi. Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu mo te iwi

trans-unit.source: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e Allah koutou;

trans-unit.source: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?
trans-unit.target: Na kua titiro atu Allah etahi o koutou i runga i ētahi atu i roto i te kai.

trans-unit.source: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga Allah mo koutou i hoa koutou, a kua meinga hoki koutou i a koutou hoa tama me mokopuna, me kua whakaratohia hoki koutou i nga mea pai.

trans-unit.source: And they worship besides Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.
trans-unit.target: Na koropiko ana ratou haunga Allah e kore nei e riro mo ratou [te mana o] kai i te rangi, me te whenua i katoa, a [i roto i te meka], e taea e ratou.

trans-unit.source: So do not assert similarities to Allah. Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.
trans-unit.target: Na e kore e whakapuaki ritenga ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: E whakaatu ana Allah he tauira: he pononga [e te] whenua, me te taea ki te mahi i te mea, me ia ki kua whakaratohia nei matou i Us kai pai, kia Ahatia ia i reira puku, me te nuitia.

trans-unit.source: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?
trans-unit.target: A he hakari Allah he tauira o tokorua tangata, tetahi o ratou wahangu me te taea ki te mahi i te mea, i te mea kei ia he pikaunga ki tona kaitiaki.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: A ki Allah no te [āhuatanga] kitea o te rangi, me te whenua.

trans-unit.source: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tangohia Allah koutou i te kopu o koutou whaea kore mohio i te mea, a ka meinga e ia mo koutou rongo, me te kite, me te maramarama e pea e kia koe mauruuru.

trans-unit.source: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e kite i nga manu te mana i roto i te huru o te rangi?

trans-unit.source: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga Allah mo koutou i to outou mau utuafare i te wahi o te okiokinga, ka hanga hoki koutou i nga hiako o nga teneti kararehe e kitea e koe marama i runga i tou ra o te haere, me koutou ra i noho ai;

trans-unit.source: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga Allah mo koutou, kua hanga i taua e ia, atarangi, me kua hanga hoki koutou i nga maunga, wharau, me te kua hanga hoki koutou kakahu e tiaki koe i te wera me te kakahu e tiaki koe i tou [hoariri i roto i] te whawhai.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: Otiia ki te tahuri ke atu ratou, [e Muhammad] - ka anake ki runga ki a koutou he [fatongia mo] whakamōhiotanga mārama.

trans-unit.source: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: ia ite ratou i te manako o Allah;

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] te Day ina e fokotu'u matou i nga iwi he kaiwhakaatu.

trans-unit.source: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
trans-unit.target: A, no te, e kore e marama te hunga nei e tukinotia ana kite i te whiu reira mo ratou, e kore ka e reprieved ratou.

trans-unit.source: And when those who associated others with Allah see their "partners," they will say," Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."
trans-unit.target: A, no ka te hunga e pā ana etahi ki a Allah kite ratou "hoa," ka mea ratou, "to tatou Ariki, he matou hoa [ki koe] nei whakamahia matou ki te ti'aoro koe anake enei."

trans-unit.source: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: A ka horo'a ratou ki Allah e Day [ratou] tāpaetanga, ka ngaro i a ratou ko te ta ratou whakamahia ki te whakaaroa.

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga i whakapono, ka mutu [etahi] i te ara o Allah - ka whakapiki ake i matou ratou i roto i te whiu ki runga [ratou] whiu mo te mea pirau i meinga ratou.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] te Day ina e fokotu'u matou i roto i nga iwi i tetahi kaiwhakaatu mo ratou i a ratou ano.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Allah whakahau whakawa me te whakahaere pai, me te hoatu ki whanaunga, ka riria te moepuku, me te whakahaere kino, me te tukino.

trans-unit.source: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.
trans-unit.target: Na fakahoko te kawenata o Allah, ina kua riro koe i te reira, [e whakapono], a kahore e whatiia oati i muri i to ratou haamauraa i kua meinga koutou Allah, mo koutou, he kaiwhakaatu.

trans-unit.source: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e rite ia te hunga e untwisted tona miro whatu i muri ko reira kaha [e] tango koutou oati rite [rave'a o] tinihanga waenganui koutou no te mea he nui ake nui [i roto i te tau taonga ranei] atu tetahi hapori kotahi hapori.

trans-unit.source: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te i pai Allah, taea kua meinga e ia a koutou [o] kotahi karakia, engari ai ia ki te kotiti e pai ia, me nga kaiarahi e pai ia.

trans-unit.source: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allah, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e tangohia koutou oati rite [rave'a o] tinihanga waenganui koutou, kei te pepa waewae i muri ko reira [i mua] u, a e pangia koutou kino [i roto i tenei ao] mo te mea [iwi] whakarere koutou i te ara o Allah,

trans-unit.source: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e taui i te kawenata o Allah mo te utu iti.

trans-unit.source: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Ko nga mea katoa i a koutou, ka mutu, engari te mea kua Allah te tonu.

trans-unit.source: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Te tangata e tika, ahakoa tane, wahine ranei, i te mea kei ia he whakapono - ka meinga matou he pono ia ki te ora i te ora pai, a he pono ka hoatu e matou a ratou to ratou utu [i roto i te ake] rite ki te pai o ta ratou whakamahia ki te mahi.

trans-unit.source: So when you recite the Qur'an, [first] seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].
trans-unit.target: Na, no te te taki koe te Qur'an, [tuatahi] rapu rerenga i roto i te Allah i Hatana, te peia [i tana mahi tohu].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, i reira he hoki ki a ia e kore mana mo te hunga e kua whakapono me whakawhirinaki ki runga ki to ratou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah.
trans-unit.target: Ko anake i runga i te hunga e tango ia hei hoa me te hunga e na roto i piri ia etahi ki Allah tona mana.

trans-unit.source: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka fetongi tatou he irava i roto i te wahi o te irava - a he mohio rawa o te mea e tuku iho ia Allah - mea ratou, "koe, [e Muhammad], he ko te ihi [o teka]."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "kawea te Wairua Pure kua reira iho i to koutou Ariki i roto i te pono ki te hanga te hunga u e whakapono, me te rite te arata'iraa, me te rongo pai ki nga Mahometa."

trans-unit.source: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.
trans-unit.target: A tino mohio tatou e mea ratou, "Ko reira anake te tangata e haapii te peropheta i."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e kore e whakapono i roto i te mau irava o Allah - e kore e Allah ārahi ratou, a hoki ratou he whiu mamae he.

trans-unit.source: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah, and it is those who are the liars.
trans-unit.target: Ratou whakaaroa anake teka nei e kore e whakapono i roto i te mau irava o Allah, a ko reira te hunga e nga teka.

trans-unit.source: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment;
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata e whakapono i roto i te Allah i muri i tona whakapono ... anake mo te kotahi te tangata takoha te [ki whakarere i tona karakia] i te mea kei haumaru i roto i te whakapono tona ngakau.

trans-unit.source: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: Ko no te mea ratou pai te ora ao i runga i te ake, a e kore Allah e ārahi te iwi whakateka.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga kua hiri ki runga nei ngakau, me te rongo me te kite Allah, a ko reira te hunga e te mea herekore.

trans-unit.source: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.
trans-unit.target: Pono, he ratou, i roto i te ake, ko wai ka waiho i te mole.
