trans-unit.source: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to renounce their religion] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful
trans-unit.target: Na, pono koutou Ariki, ki te hunga e heke i muri i ratou i meinga [ki kanga to ratou haapa'oraa] a muri whawhai [mo te take o Allah] a ko manawanui - pono, koutou Ariki, i muri i te, he Fakamolemole me aroha

trans-unit.source: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: I runga i te Day ina e haere mai nga wairua totohe hoki ano, ka kia e nga wairua tino utua hoki i mea ai ki reira, a e kore e tukinotia ana e ratou.

trans-unit.source: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.
trans-unit.target: A he hakari Allah he tauira: he pa i te haumaru, me te haumaru, tona kai haere mai ki reira nui i roto i i nga wāhi, engari whakakahore reira nga ara o Allah.

trans-unit.source: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Na reira i tino haere mai ki a ratou i te anahera i roto ia ratou, heoi whakakahore ratou ki a ia;

trans-unit.source: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kai o te mea kua whakaratohia Allah mo koutou [e he] tika, me te pai.

trans-unit.source: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Kua anake riria ia ki a koutou kararehe mate, toto, te kikokiko o te poaka, me i oti e kua whakatapua ki te tahi atu i te Allah.

trans-unit.source: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e mea e pā ana ki te mea whakapuaki koutou arero o teka, "Ko te tika tenei, ka he tika tenei," ki te whakaaroa teka e pā ana ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: [He engari] te oaoaraa poto, a ka he whiu kino to ratou.

trans-unit.source: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: A ki te hunga e Hurai kua rāhuitia matou e i ana matou ki a koutou i te aroaro o.

trans-unit.source: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Na, pono koutou Ariki, ki te hunga e kua mahi he i roto i te pohehe, me te ka ripeneta i muri i a fakatonutonu ratou - pono, koutou Ariki, muri, he Fakamolemole, me te aroha.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, te rangatira [whānui], tapu ngohengohe ki Allah ko Aperahama, anga ki te pono, a kihai ia o te hunga e piri etahi ki Allah.

trans-unit.source: [He was] grateful for His favors. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: [Ko ia] mauruuru no Ta'na ara.

trans-unit.source: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoatu e matou pai ia i roto i tenei ao, a pono, i roto i te ake, ka waiho ia i roto i te hunga tika.

trans-unit.source: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakitea matou ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], ki te whai i te haapa'oraa o Aperahama, anga ki te pono;

trans-unit.source: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
trans-unit.target: I whakaritea anake te hapati mo te hunga e taa ê runga reira.

trans-unit.source: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: A ani ki te ara o to koutou Ariki me te whakaaro nui, me te ako pai, ka totohe ki a ratou i roto i te ara e ko te pai.

trans-unit.source: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te whiua koe [te hoariri, e whakapono], whiua ki te ōrite o taua ki i i aha koe.

trans-unit.source: And be patient, [O Muhammad], and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.
trans-unit.target: A ka kia manawanui, [e Muhammad], a kahore engari i roto i Allah he koutou manawanui.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko Allah ki te hunga e wehi ana ia ia, me te hunga e he kaimahi o te pai.

trans-unit.source: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Faateiteihia Ko ia te tangata e ka mau i tana i te po i al-Masjid al-Haram ki al-Masjid al-Aqsa, nei taiao kua manaakitia matou, ki te whakaatu ia ia o tatou tohu.

trans-unit.source: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoatu e matou a Mohi te karaipiture, a hanga ana e ia he arata'iraa mo nga tamariki o Iharaira kahore koutou e tango atu atu ahau rite Disposer o ngā take,

trans-unit.source: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.
trans-unit.target: E uri o te hunga kawea matou [i roto i te kaipuke] ki a Noa.

trans-unit.source: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kawea matou ki nga tamariki o Iharaira i roto i te karaipiture e, "e meinga rawa koe pirau i runga i te whenua e rua, a he pono ka tae koe [he tohu o] whakapehapeha nui.

trans-unit.source: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.
trans-unit.target: Na, no te haere mai te [wa o] kupu whakaari mo te tuatahi o ratou, ka tonoa matou ki a koutou pononga o tatou - te hunga o te hōia nui kaha, a Kua whakamatauria [ara] ratou ki te mau utuafare, a ko reira he kupu whakaari rite.

trans-unit.source: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoatu e matou hoki ki a koutou i te wikitoria hoki mo ratou.

trans-unit.source: [And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves." Then when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the temple in Jerusalem, as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.
trans-unit.target: [Na ka mea], "Ki te mahi koe i te pai, meatia e koe te pai mo koutou:. Ko te mea mahi kino koe, [meatia e koe te reira] ki a koutou"

trans-unit.source: [Then Allah said], "It is expected, [if you repent], that your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."
trans-unit.target: [Na ka mea a Allah], "E tika ana, [ki te koutou e ripeneta], e ka tohu i to koutou Ariki ki runga ki a koutou. Na ki te hoki koe [ki te hara], ka hoki mai matou [ki te whiu]. A kua hanga e matou te reinga, hoki

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, e ārahi ana tenei Qur'an ki te mea e tino tika ana, me te homai te rongo pai ki te whakapono e mahi mahi tika e ka whai ratou he nui te utu.

trans-unit.source: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: A e te hunga e kore e whakapono i roto i te ake - kua oti matou hoki ratou i te whiu mauiui.

trans-unit.source: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.
trans-unit.target: A tiaoro tangata mo te kino pera tiaoro ia mo te pai, me te tangata he hohoro tonu.

trans-unit.source: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga e matou te po, me te ra e rua tohu, a murua matou te tohu o te po, a hanga te tohu o te ra e kitea ai kia rapu koe pai i to koutou Ariki, a kia mohio te maha o nga tau, me te pūkete [o te wā].

trans-unit.source: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.
trans-unit.target: A [hoki] nga tangata katoa kua whakaritea e matou tona whakarau ki runga ki tona kaki, a ka whakaputa i matou mo ia i runga i te Day o raa te lekooti e farerei e horahia e ia tuwhera.

trans-unit.source: [It will be said], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."
trans-unit.target: [Ka mea te reira], "Lau koutou record. E rahi ana ko koe ki a koe i tenei Day rite kaikaute."

trans-unit.source: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata e te arahina te arahina anake mo [te painga o] tona wairua.

trans-unit.source: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka ana tatou ki te whakangaro i te pa, e whakahau matou ona houkura engari ratou kaki takahi ki reira;

trans-unit.source: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: A me pehea maha i huna matou i te whakatupuranga i muri Noa.

trans-unit.source: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata e hiahia te tonu - hohoro matou hoki ia i reira te mea e tonu kia tatou e hiahia matou.

trans-unit.source: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah].
trans-unit.target: Tena ko te tangata e hiahia te ake, e te puai i te kaha e tika ana ki reira i te mea kei ia he whakapono - he reira te hunga nei kaha te ake maioha [e Allah].

trans-unit.source: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.
trans-unit.target: Ki ia [kāwai] whakawhānui matou - ki enei a ki te hunga - i te mea homai noa a koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.
trans-unit.target: Titiro pehea Kua titiro atu matou [i roto i te whakarato] etahi o ratou i runga i ētahi atu.

trans-unit.source: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.
trans-unit.target: Kaua e hanga [rite rite] ki Allah tetahi atua, me [reira] riro rīria, ka whakarere.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tu'utu'uni tou Ariki kore koutou e koropiko ki a ia anake, a ki ngā mātua, maimoatanga pai.

trans-unit.source: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."
trans-unit.target: Na raro ki a ratou i te parirau o te haehaa i roto i te aroha, me te mea, "E toku Ariki, tohungia ki runga ki a ratou rite kawea e ratou ki ahau ake [ina ko ahau] iti."

trans-unit.source: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: he mohio rawa o te mea kei roto koutou to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
trans-unit.target: Na hoatu te whanaunga tona matau, a [ano] te rawakore me te haere, a e kore e noho toloveka'aki.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he teina o nga rewera te moumou, a ake kua Hatana ki tona Ariki hakawhetai.

trans-unit.source: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te koutou [me] tahuri atu i te mahi tohu rawakore tatari i to koutou Ariki e titau koe, ka korero ki a ratou i te kupu ngawari.

trans-unit.source: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e hanga tou ringa [rite] here ki tou kaki ranei whakawhānui reira tino a [reira] riro whakahengia me pēkerapu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, atu koutou Ariki kai hoki e pai ai, e whakawhāiti [te reira].

trans-unit.source: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e patua koutou tamariki i te wehi o te rawakore.

trans-unit.source: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakatata tika takoto.

trans-unit.source: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakamate i te wairua i riria mai nei Allah, ki te kahore e tika.

trans-unit.source: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakatata ki te taonga o te pani, ki te kahore i roto i te ara e ko te pai, tae noa ki tae ia paari.

trans-unit.source: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
trans-unit.target: A ka hoatu e mehua tonu ka whanganga koutou, a ka paunatia ki i te pauna tika.

trans-unit.source: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whai i te o nei kahore koutou e matau.

trans-unit.source: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e haere ki runga ki te whenua exultantly.

trans-unit.source: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.
trans-unit.target: Ko tonu tona kino, i te aroaro o to koutou Ariki, whakarihariha - e katoa.

trans-unit.source: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
trans-unit.target: Ko i te mea kua whakakitea tou Ariki ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], o te whakaaro nui.

trans-unit.source: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.
trans-unit.target: Na, kua whiriwhiria koutou e Ihowa koe mo [he] tama, ka tangohia i roto i te tamahine anahera?

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino whänuitanga matou [i te tirotiro] i roto i tenei Qur'an e kia fakamanatu ai te taata, engari e kore e whakanui i te reira i te iino anake i roto i te whakakonekone.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Ki te reira i ki a ia [te tahi atu] atua, pera me te mea ratou, katahi ratou [ia] e kua rapua ki te Rangatira o te torona he ara."

trans-unit.source: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.
trans-unit.target: Faateiteihia Ko ia, me runga ake ta ratou e mea na roto i te sublimity nui.

trans-unit.source: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Nga rangi e whitu, me te whenua, me te mea kei roto ia ratou e whakanui ia ia.

trans-unit.source: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te taki e koe te Qur'an, hoatu matou i waenganui ia koutou me te hunga e kore e whakapono i roto i te ake i te arai huna.

trans-unit.source: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.
trans-unit.target: A kua whakanohoia e matou i runga i to ratou hipoki ngakau, kei matau ratou i te reira, a i roto i to ratou turi taringa.

trans-unit.source: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: He mohio rawa o te pehea rongo ratou ki reira, ina rongo ratou ki a koutou, me [o] matou, ina he ratou i roto i te aparauraa tūmataiti, ina mea te hunga kino, "E kore koe whai engari te tangata pāngia e te makutu."

trans-unit.source: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
trans-unit.target: Titiro pehea ratou patu mo koutou whakataurite;

trans-unit.source: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, ", no te he tatou wheua, me matūriki rerere, ka [pono] faahou tatou ano te mea hanga hou?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Be you stones or iron
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Kia koe kohatu rino ranei

trans-unit.source: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -
trans-unit.target: Ranei e [tetahi] hanganga o taua i he nui i roto i to koutou u. "A ka mea ratou," Ko wai e whakahoki tatou? "Mea atu," ia te tangata e koe i kawe mai i te wā tuatahi. "Na ka ta'iriiri ratou o ratou mahunga ki a koutou, me te mea

trans-unit.source: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."
trans-unit.target: ka karanga i runga i te Day ia koutou, a ka pahono koe ki te whakamoemiti o ia me te whakaaro e kore koutou i noho [i roto i te ao] anake hoki te iti. "

trans-unit.source: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: A ka korero ki aku pononga ki te mea i te mea pai.

trans-unit.source: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.
trans-unit.target: he mohio rawa o koutou to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
trans-unit.target: A he mohio rawa o kei roto i te rangi, me te whenua tetahi tou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Whakatara hunga kua kī koe [rite atua] ia haunga, kahore hoki ratou e riro i te [kaha mo] tango o te he i a koe ranei [mo ona] whakawhiti [ki tetahi atu]."

trans-unit.source: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga nei te tiaoro nei ratou e rapu tikanga o te whai wāhi ki to ratou Ariki, [e tohe nei rite ki] nei o ratou e tata, a tumanako ratou mo tana mahi tohu, me te wehi tana whiu.

trans-unit.source: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.
trans-unit.target: Na kahore he pa engari e ka whakangaromia e matou i te reira i mua i te Day o raa whiua te reira ki te whiu nui ranei.

trans-unit.source: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.
trans-unit.target: Na kua haukotia tatou tetahi mea i te tuku tohu anake e whakakahore nga iwi o mua ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
trans-unit.target: A [mahara, e Muhammad], ka korerotia e matou a koutou, "Ko e mo'oni, kua karapotia te iwi koutou Ariki."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka mea matou ki nga koki, "koropiko ki Adamu," ka piko ratou, kahore hoki Iblees.

trans-unit.source: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."
trans-unit.target: mea [Iblees], "E kite koe i tenei tangata i whakahonoretia e koe ki runga ake i ahau? Ki te whakaroa ahau e koe tae noa ki te Day o raa, he pono ka whakangaromia e ahau ona uri, ki te kahore hoki he torutoru."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "Haere, hoki whai koe tetahi o ratou, he pono ka hei reinga te utu o koutou - te utu rahi.

trans-unit.source: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
trans-unit.target: A ka oho [ki senselessness] tangata koutou taea i roto ia ratou ki to koutou reo me te huaki ratou ki o koutou hoiho, me nga hoia waewae, me te riro i te hoa i roto i to ratou taonga, me a ratou tamariki, me fafau ratou. "Otiia e kore e Hatana fafau ratou anake pohehe.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, mo toku [whakapono] pononga reira he hoki koe kahore mana.

trans-unit.source: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ko to koutou Ariki e pei te kaipuke mo koutou i roto i te moana, e kia rapu koe o tona ringa.

trans-unit.source: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: A, ka pa ati koutou i te moana, e ngaro [katoa] te hunga mahara koe anake hoki ia.

trans-unit.source: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.
trans-unit.target: Na ka meatia e koe ite haumaru e [hei utu] kore e meinga e ia te wahi o te whenua ki te horomia koe unga ki a koe ranei o kohatu i te tupuhi?

trans-unit.source: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.
trans-unit.target: Ranei e ongo'i he manukanuka mo koutou e kore e tukua e ia a koutou whakahokia ki te moana i tetahi atu wa, me te unga ki a koutou i te tukauati o te hau, me te totohu koe mo te aha whakakahore koutou?

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino whakahonoretia matou nga tama a Arama, a kawea ana ratou e ki runga ki te whenua, me te moana, ka whakaratohia hoki ratou o nga mea pai, a pai ratou i runga i te nui o te mea i hanga e matou, me te manakohanga [tino].

trans-unit.source: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].
trans-unit.target: [Faahiti i, e Muhammad], te Day ka karanga matou ki waho nga iwi ki to ratou record [o mahi].

trans-unit.source: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
trans-unit.target: Na te tangata he matapo i roto i tenei [ora] ka matapo i roto i te ake me te ake kotiti i roto i te ara.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.
trans-unit.target: A pono, i pā ana ki ki te whakamatautau atu i taua i whakakitea matou ki a koutou i roto i te tikanga ki a koutou e ratou [hanga] whakaaroa e koe e pā ana ki Us te tahi mea atu;

trans-unit.source: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te kahore matou i kaha koutou, e whai tata hehema he iti ki a ratou a koutou.

trans-unit.source: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
trans-unit.target: Na [ki te i koe], e kua meinga matou pangia e koe rua [whiu i roto i] te ora, me te rua mate [i muri].

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.
trans-unit.target: A pono, i pā ana ki ki te pei koe i te whenua ki te pana i reira koe e ratou.

trans-unit.source: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.
trans-unit.target: [Ko tatou] whakapumautia ara mo te hunga i tonoa mai e matou a koutou o matou karere i mua i;

trans-unit.source: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
trans-unit.target: Whakapumautia inoi i te heke o te ra [i tona afaraa] tae noa ki te pouri o te po, me te [ano] te Qur'an o ata.

trans-unit.source: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.
trans-unit.target: A i [wahi o] te po, inoi ki reira rite atu [koropiko] mo koutou;

trans-unit.source: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea, "E toku Ariki, take ahau ki te tomo i te tomokanga tangi, me te ki puta te putanga tangi, me te homai ki ahau i koe he mana tautoko."

trans-unit.source: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea, "Kua tae mai te pono, a ka kua haere ana teka. Ko e mo'oni ko teka, [i te natura], ake herea ki te haere."

trans-unit.source: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
trans-unit.target: Na tonoa tatou iho o te Qur'an i te mea whakaora me te mahi tohu mo nga whakapono, engari e kore e whakanui i te reira i te hara anake i roto i te mate.

trans-unit.source: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka hoatu e matou manako ki runga ki te disbeliever, tahuri atu ia, a faaatea ia ia;

trans-unit.source: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "ia mahi kia rite ki tona tikanga, engari he mohio rawa o te tangata e te pai arahina i roto i te ara to koutou Ariki."

trans-unit.source: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."
trans-unit.target: A ka ui ratou ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], e pā ana ki te wairua.

trans-unit.source: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te pai matou, i taea e ina mahi atu matou ki taua i whakakitea matou ki a koutou.

trans-unit.source: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.
trans-unit.target: Te kore [Kua mahue te reira matou ki a koutou] rite te mahi tohu i to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ki te huitaata me te jinn huihuia i roto i te tikanga ki te whakaputa i te rite o tenei Qur'an, ratou i taea kore hua i te rite o reira, ara, ki te ratou ki tetahi ki tetahi kaiāwhina."

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino whänuitanga matou mo te iwi i roto i tenei Qur'an i nga [ahua] o tauira, engari te nuinga o te iwi kihai [tetahi] anake ti'aturi ore.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "E kore matou e whakapono ki a koe tae noa ki te wahi i koe tuwhera mo matou i te whenua i te puna.

trans-unit.source: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]
trans-unit.target: Ranei e [noa] to koutou he kari o te nikau te ahoaho roa me karepe, me meinga maringi awa mai i roto ia ratou i roto i te ope [me te tini]

trans-unit.source: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]
trans-unit.target: koe ranei kia hinga i te rangi ki runga ki a matou i roto i nga whatiwhatinga rite kua kī koe ranei kawea koutou Allah me nga anahera ki te aroaro o [ia tatou]

trans-unit.source: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
trans-unit.target: Ranei to koutou he whare o te koura ranei kake koe ki te rangi.

trans-unit.source: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"
trans-unit.target: Na te aha tatatia te iwi i te whakapono, no te haere mai te arata'iraa ki a ratou anake e mea ratou, "I tonoa Allah he karere tangata?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ki te reira i runga i te anahera whenua e haere kore wehi na, e kua tonoa e matou ki raro, ki a ratou i te rangi i te anahera [rite te] karere."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "E rahi ana ko Allah rite Ite waenganui ahau me koe. Oia mau te ake, mo ia ana pononga, matatau, me te kitenga."

trans-unit.source: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.
trans-unit.target: Na te tangata Allah ārahi ana - ko ia te [tika] arahina;

trans-unit.source: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"
trans-unit.target: E ko to ratou utu no te mea i whakapono ratou i roto i to tatou irava, ka mea, ", no te he tatou wheua, me matūriki rerere, ka tatou [pono] faahou [i roto i] te mea hanga hou?"

trans-unit.source: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e kite e Allah, nana nei i hanga nga rangi, me te whenua, he [te tangata] nehenehe ki te waihanga i te momo o ratou?

trans-unit.source: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu [ki a ratou], "Ki te nohoia e koe i te depositories o te aroha o toku Ariki, ka e kaiponuhia e koe i roto i o te wehi o te pūtea."

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Na i tino hoatu e matou a Mohi e iwa nga tohu kitea, na te ui i nga tamariki o Iharaira [e pā ana ki] ka haere ia ki a ratou, ka mea a Parao ki a ia, "Ko e mo'oni ahau whakaaro, e Mohi, e kua pāngia koe e te makutu."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."
trans-unit.target: [A Mohi] mea, "Kua mohio kua koe tetahi kua tonoa e iho enei [tohu] anake te Ariki o nga rangi, me te whenua ano taunakitanga, a pono ahau whakaaro, e Parao, e kua ngaro koe."

trans-unit.source: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
trans-unit.target: Na whakaaro ia ki te pei ia ratou i te whenua, engari toremi matou ia me te hunga ki a ia katoa.

trans-unit.source: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea matou i muri Parao ki nga tamariki o Iharaira, "noho i roto i te whenua, a i reira ka tae mai te kupu whakaari o te ake, ka kawe mai koe matou i roto i [kotahi] haaputuputuraa."

trans-unit.source: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
trans-unit.target: A ki te pono i tonoa e matou te Qur'an iho, a kua heke te reira ki te pono.

trans-unit.source: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
trans-unit.target: A [ko reira] te Qur'an e kua wehea e matou [e wā] e ai taki koe i te reira ki te iwi i runga i te wā auroa.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Tui i reira ranei e kore e whakapono ki e mo'oni, te hunga i homai te matauranga ki te aroaro o te reira -., Ka te karakia reira ki a ratou, hinga ana ratou ki runga ki o ratou mata i roto i te prostration,

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "whakanuia ko to tatou Ariki! Oia mau, kua rite te kupu whakaari o to tatou Ariki."

trans-unit.source: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.
trans-unit.target: A hinga ratou ki runga ki o ratou mata tangi, a whakanuia ana ratou e te Qur'an i tāpaetanga haehaa.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Karangatia ki runga ki Allah ranei karanga ki runga ki te aroha te nuinga Ahakoa karanga koe [ingoa] -. Ki a ia no te ingoa pai."

trans-unit.source: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea, "whakapaingia ki Allah, e kore nei i he tama, a kua kahore hoa i roto i [Ta'na mau] kawanatanga, me te kahore [hiahia o te] kaitiaki i roto i te ngoikore: a whakakororia ia ia ki te glorification [nui]."

trans-unit.source: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.
trans-unit.target: Ko [e tika] ki Allah, nana nei i tonoa iho ki runga ki tona pononga i te Buka a kahore i hanga reira tetahi ia aupu- whakamoemiti [katoa].

trans-unit.source: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward
trans-unit.target: [Kua meinga e ia te reira] tika, ki te whakatupato i te whiu nui i ia, me ki te hoatu rongo pai ki te whakapono e mahi mahi tika e ka whai ratou i te utu pai

trans-unit.source: In which they will remain forever
trans-unit.target: I roto i te e ka toe e ratou ake ake

trans-unit.source: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."
trans-unit.target: A ki te whakatupato hunga e mea, "tangohia Allah kua he tama."

trans-unit.source: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
trans-unit.target: Kahore ratou e mohio o reira, e kore ano i o ratou matua.

trans-unit.source: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.
trans-unit.target: Na pea e patua e koe koe i roto i te pouri ki runga ki a ratou, [e Muhammad], ki te ratou e kore e whakapono i roto i tenei karere, [me] i roto i te pouri.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.
trans-unit.target: He pono, Kua hanga e matou i te i runga i te ataahua whenua hoki reira e kia whakamatautau tatou ratou [rite ki] i o ratou he pai i roto i te mahi.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.
trans-unit.target: A pono, ka meinga e matou i runga i taua mea [ki] he whenua pakoko.

trans-unit.source: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?
trans-unit.target: Ranei i whakaaro koutou e nga hoa o te ana, me te tuhituhinga, i roto i to tatou tohu, he mea whakamiharo?

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."
trans-unit.target: [Faahiti i], no te whati nga tamariki ki te ana, ka mea, "to tatou Ariki, tukua mai ia tatou i koe aroha, me te faaineine no tatou i to tatou take arata'iraa tika."

trans-unit.source: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.
trans-unit.target: Na maka matou [i te uhi o te moe] i runga i o ratou taringa i roto i te ana mo te maha o nga tau.

trans-unit.source: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.
trans-unit.target: Na ka oho ake matou ratou e kia whakaatu tatou ko e o te wehenga rua tino pau i roto i te tātai aha [whānuitanga] ratou i noho i roto i te wa.

trans-unit.source: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
trans-unit.target: Ko tatou te hunga e pā ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], to ratou aamu i roto i te pono.

trans-unit.source: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e matou u ratou ngakau, no te tu ratou ki runga, ka mea, "to tatou Ariki ko te Ariki o nga rangi, me te whenua. Kahore rawa ka mahara matou ia tapiri mo tetahi atua. Tino kua e korero matou, ka, he te he nui.

trans-unit.source: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"
trans-unit.target: , O matou iwi, kua tangohia enei haunga ia atua.

trans-unit.source: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."
trans-unit.target: [Mea nga tamariki ki tetahi ki tetahi], "A, no kua mawehe atu koe i a ratou, me e e koropiko ratou atu atu Allah, hoki ano ia ki te ana. Ka horahia atu tou Ariki hoki koutou o tana mahi tohu, a ka faaineine no koutou i to koutou wāhi take

trans-unit.source: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.
trans-unit.target: A [i koe i reira], e kite koe i te ra, no te whakatika reira, anga atu i to ratou ana i runga i te tika, a ka whakaturia te reira, haere atu i a ratou i runga i te maui, ia i ratou [whakapanga] i roto i te wāhi tuwhera ona

trans-unit.source: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.
trans-unit.target: A e whakaaro koutou ara ratou, ia moe ratou.

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.
trans-unit.target: Na atoa, oho matou ratou kia ui ratou tetahi ki tetahi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ki te haere mai ratou ki te mohio o koutou, ka ratou te kohatu koutou hoki koutou ki to ratou karakia ranei.

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."
trans-unit.target: Na atoa, meinga matou ki a ratou kia kitea e e mohio ratou [te hunga i kitea e ratou] e te kupu whakaari o Allah he pono me e o te Hour kahore he feaa.

trans-unit.source: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou ki reira e toru, te wha o ratou te ratou kuri;

trans-unit.source: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"
trans-unit.target: A kore mea o tetahi, "Ko e mo'oni, ka meatia e ahau i taua apopo,"

trans-unit.source: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."
trans-unit.target: Te kore [ka tāpiri], "Ki te pai Allah."

trans-unit.source: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.
trans-unit.target: Na ka noho ratou i roto i to ratou ana mō te toru rau nga tau, me te nui e iwa.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "he mohio rawa o pehea te roa noho ratou Allah. Kua ia [mohio o] te [āhuatanga] kitea o te rangi, me te whenua. Kia pehea te kitenga i ko ia, me pehea rongo! E kore e whai ratou ia tapiri mo tetahi kaitiaki, a faaite ia

trans-unit.source: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.
trans-unit.target: A ka taki, [e Muhammad], te mea kua whakakitea ki a koutou o te Buka a koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.
trans-unit.target: Na kia mau manawanui koe [na roto i te te] ki te hunga e karanga ana ki runga ki to ratou Ariki i roto i te ata me te ahiahi, e rapu ana tona mata.

trans-unit.source: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: A ka mea, "Ko te pono i to koutou Ariki, na pai te tangata - kia whakapono ia: a ka pai te tangata e - kia whakateka ia."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga kua whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika - pono, matou e kore e tukua ki te ngaro i te utu o tetahi e i pai i roto i te mahi.

trans-unit.source: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: ka whai kari o noho mau tonu te hunga;

trans-unit.source: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.
trans-unit.target: Na hakari ki a ratou he tauira o nga tangata e rua: homai matou ki tetahi o ratou e rua kari o waina, a taha ratou matou ki nikau a whakanohoia waenganui ratou [mara o] hua.

trans-unit.source: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.
trans-unit.target: Ia o nga kari rua hua ona hua, me te kore i hinga poto ona i roto i te tetahi mea.

trans-unit.source: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."
trans-unit.target: Na i ia hua, na ka mea ia ki tona hoa ia korerorero ia ki a ia, "he nui atu i a koutou i roto i te taonga me te kaha i roto i [tokomaha o] tangata ko ahau."

trans-unit.source: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tomo ia tona kari, ia ia te hunga he ki a ia.

trans-unit.source: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e whakaaro ka puta i te Hour.

trans-unit.source: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?
trans-unit.target: ka mea tona hoa ki a ia, ia ia korerorero ia ki a ia, "Kua whakapono koe i roto ia te tangata e hanga e koe i te puehu, me te ka i te parāoa-te maturuturunga iho, me te ka proportioned koe [rite] he tangata?

trans-unit.source: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki ahau, ko ia Allah, e toku Ariki, me kore ahau e piri ki toku Ariki tetahi.

trans-unit.source: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,
trans-unit.target: A he aha ta koutou, ka tomo koutou to koutou kari, e kore e mea, 'He aha i pai Allah [kua puta];

trans-unit.source: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,
trans-unit.target: pea te reira e ka homai ki ahau toku Ariki [te tahi mea] pai atu koutou kari, a ka tukua atu ki runga ki taua mea he aitua i te rangi, a ka riro te reira i te maeneene, whenua efua,

trans-unit.source: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."
trans-unit.target: Ranei ka waiho i tona wai wherua [ki te whenua], na e kore e taea ki te rapu i te reira a koutou. "

trans-unit.source: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: Na ka i karapotia ana hua [i te whakangaromanga], na ka anga ia tahuri ki ona ringa e pā ana ki [i roto i te te miharo] i runga i te mea i pau ia ki runga taua mea, i kua hinga ki runga ki ona trellises, ka mea, "Aue, e hiahia ana ahau e kore ahau i whai pānga

trans-unit.source: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.
trans-unit.target: Na reira ko te hoki a ia e kore kamupene ki te āwhina ia atu i te Allah, e kore i taea e tiakina ia ia.

trans-unit.source: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.
trans-unit.target: He [tino] i te mana mo Allah, te pono.

trans-unit.source: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.
trans-unit.target: Na hakari ki a ratou te tauira o te ora o tenei ao, [tona oranga] rite ua e tono tatou i iho i te rangi, me te otaota o te whenua mingles ki reira, me [ka] riro te reira toenga maroke, marara e te hau.

trans-unit.source: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.
trans-unit.target: Taonga me ngā tamariki e [engari] ataahua o te ora ao.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
trans-unit.target: A [faaara o] te Day ina ka tango matou i nga maunga, a ka kite koutou rongonui te whenua, a ka kohikohia matou ratou, a kore e waiho ki muri i a ratou te tangata.

trans-unit.source: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."
trans-unit.target: A ka kawea e ratou ki te aroaro to koutou Ariki i roto i nga rarangi, [a ka mea ia], "Kua tino tae koe ki Kitautolu pera me hanga matou i te wa tuatahi koe. Na ka kī koutou e kore tatou e hanga mo koutou he mea whakarite."

trans-unit.source: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
trans-unit.target: A ka whakaturia te record [o mahi] [tuwhera], a ka kite koe i te kaimahi kino wehi o taua roto te reira, a ka mea ratou, "Aue, aue ki a matou! He aha te mea tenei pukapuka e rau tetahi mea iti, ki te rahi anake e

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka mea matou ki nga anahera, "koropiko ki Adamu," ka piko ratou, kahore hoki Iblees.

trans-unit.source: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.
trans-unit.target: kihai ahau i hanga whakaae ratou ki te hanga o te rangi, me te whenua ranei ki te hanga o ratou, a kihai i pai ahau i tango nga misguiders rite kaiāwhina.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.
trans-unit.target: A [faaara o] te Day ina ka mea ia, "Karangatia 'oku hoa' e kī koutou," a ka mahara ratou ratou, otiia e kore ratou e pahono ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: A ka kite nga kaimahi kino i te ahi, a ka kia etahi e he ana ratou ki te hinga ki reira.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino whänuitanga matou i roto i tenei Qur'an mo te iwi i nga [ahua o] tauira;

trans-unit.source: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.
trans-unit.target: Na kua kahore araia te iwi i te whakapono, no te haere mai te arata'iraa ki a ratou, me i tono murunga o ratou Ariki anake e reira [me] pono ki a ratou i te [taunga] tauira o nga iwi o mua ranei e te whiu kia haere mai [tika] ratou i te aroaro o.

trans-unit.source: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: A tukua tatou e kore te karere anake ano i atawahi o te rongo pai, me te warners.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.
trans-unit.target: A ko wai te mea nui ake kino atu i te kotahi te tangata fakamanatu te o nga irava o tona Ariki, engari tahuri atu i a ratou, a wareware ta kua totoro ona ringa?

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.
trans-unit.target: A ko to koutou Ariki te e fakamolemolé, ki tonu i te mahi tohu.

trans-unit.source: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.
trans-unit.target: Na aua pa - huna e matou ia ratou, ka ratou e tukinotia, a hanga matou mo te wa i whakaritea o ratou whakangaromanga.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka mea a Mohi ki tana pononga, "E kore e mutu ahau [haere] noa tae ahau te komititanga o nga moana e rua ranei tonu hoki te wā roa."

trans-unit.source: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.
trans-unit.target: Otira ka tae ratou ki te komititanga waenganui ratou, wareware ratou ratou ika, a tangohia ana e ia ona akoranga ki te moana, paheke atu.

trans-unit.source: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."
trans-unit.target: Na, ka oti ratou haere tua atu reira, [a Mohi] mea ki tona tamaiti, "Kawea matou i to tatou kai te ata. Tino kua matou i tukua i roto i tenei, to tatou haere, [nui] rohirohi."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "I kite koutou ina tatou haere ki te kamaka He pono, wareware ahau [reira] te ika ka kahore hanga wareware ahau i te reira anake Hatana -?.. e kia whakahua ahau i te reira Na ka tangohia e te reira ona akoranga ki te moana te maere".

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "Ko te mea i rapu tatou."

trans-unit.source: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kitea e ratou he pononga i roto i to tatou tangata ki nei i tohungia homai tatou i tatou, a kua whakaakona e ia i tatou i te [tetahi] matauranga.

trans-unit.source: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea a Mohi ki a ia, "Kia aru ahau ia koe ki runga ki [te huru] e whakaakona koe ki ahau i te mea kua koutou i whakaakona o te whakawa tangi?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko e mo'oni, ki ahau e kore e taea ki te whai manawanui koutou.

trans-unit.source: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"
trans-unit.target: A me pehea e taea whai koe te manawanui hoki te mea e kore koutou e karapoti i roto i te matauranga? "

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."
trans-unit.target: [A Mohi] mea, "Ka kite koe i ahau, ki te pai Allah, manawanui, a kore ahau e takahi koe i roto i [tetahi] tikanga."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Na, ki te aru koutou i ahau, e kore e ui ki ahau e pā ana ki tetahi mea noa meinga e ahau ki a koutou e pā ana ki te whakahua i te reira."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."
trans-unit.target: Na whakaturia ana e ratou ki waho, tae noa ki, no ka eke ratou ki runga ki te kaipuke, ka haehae tuwhera reira al-Khidh r.

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] mea, "E kore ianei ahau i mea ai ki ahau e kore e taea ki te whai manawanui koutou?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "Kaua e faahapa i ahau hoki te mea wareware ahau, a e kore e hipokina e ahau i roto i toku mea ki te uaua."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."
trans-unit.target: Na whakaturia ana e ratou ki waho, a tae noa, no te tutaki ratou he tamaiti, patua ia al-Khidh r.

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] mea, "Kahore ianei ahau i ki atu ki a koutou e ki ahau e kore e taea ki te whai manawanui koutou?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "Ki te kia ui ahau ki a koe e pā ana ki tetahi mea i muri i tenei, ka kore e puritia e ahau ano he hoa kua whiwhi. koe i ahau he kupu whakahoki."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."
trans-unit.target: Na whakaturia ana e ratou ki waho, a tae noa, no ka tae ratou ki te iwi o te pa, ka ui ratou ki ona iwi mo te kai, heoi kihai ratou ki te whakahere a ratou manuhiri.

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] mea, "Kei te mawehe tenei waenganui ahau me koe. Ka e ahau a koutou o te tikanga o taua e pā ana ki e kore i taea e koutou whai manawanui.

trans-unit.source: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.
trans-unit.target: Rite mo te kaipuke, no te reira ki te iwi rawakore mahi i te moana.

trans-unit.source: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.
trans-unit.target: A, ko te tamaiti, te hunga whakapono i ona matua, ka wehi tatou e e overburden ia ratou na roto i te poka ke, me te ti'aturi ore.

trans-unit.source: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.
trans-unit.target: Na te tikanga matou e kia fetongi to ratou Ariki hoki ratou tetahi pai atu ia i roto i te viivii, me te tata ki te mahi tohu.

trans-unit.source: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."
trans-unit.target: A, ko te taiepa, no te reira ki tamariki pani e rua i roto i te pa, a ka reira ko raro reira he taonga mo ratou, a ka kua to ratou papa i tika.

trans-unit.source: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."
trans-unit.target: A ka ui ratou ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], e pā ana ki Dhul-Qarnayn.

trans-unit.source: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.
trans-unit.target: He pono whakapumautia matou ia i runga i te whenua, a ka hoatu e matou a ia ki te katoa i te huarahi.

trans-unit.source: So he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Na whai ana ia he ara

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."
trans-unit.target: Noa, ka tae ia ki te tautuhinga o te ra, ka kitea e ia te reira [me te mea] whakanoho i roto i te puna o te paru pouri, a ka kitea e ia whakatata reira he iwi.

trans-unit.source: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ka rite hoki kotahi te tangata hara, ka whiua tatou ki a ia. Na ka hoki ia ki tona Ariki, a ka whiua e ia a ia ki te whiu e wehingia ana.

trans-unit.source: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki tetahi e whakapono ana, ka mahi tika, ka whai ia i te utu o Pararaiha, a ka korero matou ki a ia i to tatou whakahau ki humarie. "

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Na ka whai ia i te ara

trans-unit.source: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
trans-unit.target: Noa, ka haere ia ki te putanga mai o te ra, ka kitea e ia maranga i te reira i runga i te iwi e kore hoki nei i hanga matou ki reira i tetahi rakau.

trans-unit.source: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu.

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Na ka whai ia i te ara

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.
trans-unit.target: Noa, ka tae ia [he haere] waenganui o nga maunga e rua, ka kitea e ia a ratou te taha o te iwi nei i taea e whakauaua matau [tona] korero.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "E Dhul-Qarnayn, pono Koka raua ko Makoka he whakangau [nui] i roto i te whenua. Na kia tautapa matou mo koutou he moni e hanga ai e koe i waenganui ia tatou, a ratou he arai?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko roto i nei kua whakapumautia toku Ariki he pai [atu ta koutou whakahere], engari āwhina ahau ki te kaha ahau: ka meinga e ahau ki waenganui ia koutou, me a ratou he katua.

trans-unit.source: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."
trans-unit.target: Kawea mai ki ahau pepa o rino "- noa, no ka oti ia ia [ratou] i waenganui i nga taiepa maunga e rua, ka mea ia," Whakatangihia [ki kaka], "tae noa ki no ka hanga e ia te reira [rite] ahi, ka mea ia," Kawea ahau

trans-unit.source: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.
trans-unit.target: Na i taea ki te haere i runga i taua mea Koka raua ko Makoka, e kore ratou e taea [ki pānga] i roto i reira i tetahi kătahi.

trans-unit.source: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."
trans-unit.target: mea [Dhul-Qarnayn], "Ko te mahi tohu i toku Ariki tenei:. ko ka tae mai te kupu whakaari a toku Ariki, ka meinga e ia te reira taumata, a ake ko te kupu whakaari a toku Ariki pono"

trans-unit.source: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.
trans-unit.target: A ka waiho e matou te hunga e ra huamo i runga i tahi i te tahi, a [ka] ka whakatangihia te Horn, a ka huihuia e matou ia ratou i roto i [kotahi] whakaminenga.

trans-unit.source: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -
trans-unit.target: A ka tapae matou te reinga e Day ki nga iino, i runga i te whakaatu -

trans-unit.source: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga nei kanohi kua i roto i te taupoki [tangohia] i toku mahara, a kihai i ahei ai te whakarongo ratou.

trans-unit.source: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.
trans-unit.target: Na e te hunga e whakateka whakaaro e taea te tango e ratou aku pononga hei utu mo o ahau ano hoa?

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Me ia tatou [whakapono] whakamōhio koutou o nga mole rahi rite ki [ratou] mahi?

trans-unit.source: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."
trans-unit.target: [Ko ratou] te hunga kua ngaro i roto i te ora te ao nei kaha, ia ratou e whakaaro e mahi pai ana ratou i roto i te mahi. "

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga e whakateka i nga irava o to ratou Ariki, a i roto i [to ratou] whakaminenga a ia, na kua waiho ratou mahi horihori;

trans-unit.source: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Ko utu ratou - te reinga - no te mea whakakahore ratou me [no te mea] ka mau ratou aku tohu me aku karere i roto i te manuki.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, te hunga kua whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika - ka whai ratou i nga Gardens o Pararaiha rite te whare tira,

trans-unit.source: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.
trans-unit.target: Ai noho ratou e amuri noa'tu.

trans-unit.source: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ki te i mangumangu hoki [tuhituhi] nga kupu a toku Ariki, e kia pau te moana te moana i mua i nga kupu a toku Ariki pau i, ara, ki te kawea mai e matou i te rite o te reira ano te tāpiritanga."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: . Mea atu, "Ko ahau te tangata anake rite koe, kua whakakitea e koutou atua ko te kotahi te Atua ki nei Na te tangata e tumanako mo te hui ki tona Ariki - kia mahi ia te mahi tika, me te kore e piri i roto i te haamoriraa o tona Ariki tetahi.

trans-unit.source: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.
trans-unit.target: KAPA, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.

trans-unit.source: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah
trans-unit.target: [Ko tenei] he whakahua o te mahi tohu a to koutou Ariki ki tana pononga Hakaraia

trans-unit.source: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.
trans-unit.target: A, no te huaina e ia ki tona Ariki i te inoi tūmataiti.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "pono ​​toku Ariki, kua ngoikore oku wheua, me te ki tonu toku matenga, kua ki ma, a kore kua ahau i roto i toku inoi ki koe, e toku Ariki, pouri.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
trans-unit.target: A pono, wehi ahau nga riiwhi i muri i ahau, a ka i toku wahine kua pakoko, kia homai ki ahau i koe he kainga

trans-unit.source: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
trans-unit.target: Ko wai e riro i ahau, me i te hapu o Hakopa whiwhi.

trans-unit.source: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
trans-unit.target: [Ka korerotia e ia], "e te Hakaraia, pono hoatu matou ki a koutou te rongo pai o te tamaiti ko tona ingoa e Hoani. Kihai matou i whakaritea ki tetahi i mua i [tenei] ingoa."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, ", me pehea ka whai ahau he tamaiti ina kua toku Ariki, kua taku wahine pakoko, me kua tae ahau tino koroheketia?"

trans-unit.source: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "
trans-unit.target: mea [He anahera], "te kupu [ka waiho]: '. Ko faingofua mo ahau, hoki i hanga e ahau a koutou i mua, ia kahore koe' ai ta to koutou Ariki,

trans-unit.source: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."
trans-unit.target: mea [Hakaraia], "E toku Ariki, kia hoki ahau hei tohu."

trans-unit.source: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Na ka haere ia ki waho ki tona iwi i te ruma inoi, a ka tawhiri ki a ratou ki te whakanui [Allah] i roto i te ata me te ahiahi.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "E Hoani, tangohia te karaipiture ki faaotiraa."

trans-unit.source: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
