Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Nga whakapono ko te hunga e whakapono ana i roto i Allah me ana anahera, a, ka he ratou [hui] ki a ia mo te mea o te pānga noa, e kore e haere noa i ui ratou tona whakaaetanga anake.

trans-unit.source: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Kaua e hanga [koutou] karanga o te anahera i roto i koutou rite te karanga o tetahi o koutou ki tetahi.

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Te feaa ore, ki Allah no te mea kei roto i te rangi, me te whenua.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -
trans-unit.target: Ka hari te tangata e tonoa iho te Paearu ki runga ki tona pononga kia ia ki te ao i te Warner -

trans-unit.source: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.
trans-unit.target: Ia no ki nei te kawanatanga o nga rangi, me te whenua, me te tangata e kore i riro i te tama, me te kore i i te hoa i roto i te kawanatanga, me te kua hanga ia mea, a takoto ana e ia ki te faaotiraa [pū].

trans-unit.source: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
trans-unit.target: Otiia kua tango ratou haunga atua ia ia e hanga tetahi, ia e hanga ratou, a kahore riro tetahi kino painga ranei mo ratou, a e kore riro [ki te mana meinga] mate ranei te ora raa ranei.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakateka mea, "E kore te tenei i [Qur'an] kore ai he teka ia whakaaro, me tetahi atu iwi āwhina ia i roto i te reira."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "Legends o nga iwi o mua, kua oti te tuhituhi ki raro nei ia, a kua mangai ratou ki a ia te ata me te ahiahi."

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Kua whakakitea te reira e ia te tangata e matau ana [katoa] ngaro i roto i nga rangi, me te whenua. Mo'oni, he tonu ia Fakamolemole, me te aroha."

trans-unit.source: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "He aha te mea tenei karere e kai te kai, me te haere ana i roto i nga kainga hokohoko? He aha e kore i reira i tonoa iho ki a ia tetahi anahera na e waiho e ia ki a ia he Warner?

trans-unit.source: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Ranei [aha e kore te] i te taonga aroaro ki a ia [i te rangi], ranei e whai ia [e kore] i te kari i ai kai ia? "A mea nga faihala," E kore koe whai engari te tangata pāngia e te makutu. "

trans-unit.source: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
trans-unit.target: Titiro pehea ratou patu mo koutou whakataurite;

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.
trans-unit.target: Ka hari te tangata e, ki te pai ia, taea kua hanga hoki koutou [te tahi mea] pai atu i taua - kari i raro e rere awa - a taea hanga mo koutou whare kingi.

trans-unit.source: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Otira kua whakakahore ratou te Hour, a kua rite tatou mo te hunga e whakakahore i te Hour he Blaze.

trans-unit.source: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
trans-unit.target: A, no te kite ratou i te po auahi i te wahi tawhiti, ka rongo ratou tona riri, me te hamama.

trans-unit.source: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e maka ratou ki te wahi kuiti reira here i roto i mekameka, ka karanga ratou i roto i reira no te whakangaromanga.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."
trans-unit.target: [Ka korerotia ki ratou], "Kaua e tangi tenei Day mō te kotahi te whakangaromanga, engari tangi mo nui whakangaromanga."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ko e pai te Ô o mure korero nei ki te tangata tika ranei? Ka waiho te reira mo ratou hei utu, me te ūnga.

trans-unit.source: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.
trans-unit.target: Hoki ratou i reira ko te mea e ratou hiahia, [ia] noho e amuri noa'tu.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka whakaminea ratou te ia Day me e e koropiko ana ratou haunga Allah, a ka mea, "I mamingatia koutou enei, aku pononga, i ratou [ratou] kotiti i te ara ranei?"

trans-unit.source: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "ake ia koe! kihai i reira hoki ki a tatou te tango koe anake tetahi hoa. Na ka whakaratohia e koe whakamarie mo ratou, me o ratou matua tae noa wareware ratou i te karere, a ka he iwi i pakaru."

trans-unit.source: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore ratou koe, [iino], i roto i ta mea koutou, a kahore koutou e taea e karohia [whiu] ranei [kitea] awhina.

trans-unit.source: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i tukua e matou ki a koutou i mua, [e Muhammad], i tetahi o nga karere anake i kai ratou kai, ka haere i roto i te hokohoko.

trans-unit.source: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.
trans-unit.target: A mea te hunga e kore e nei i tatari i te hui ki Us, "He aha e kore i tonoa iho anahera ki a matou, ranei [aha] e tatou [kore] kite i to tatou Ariki?"

trans-unit.source: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."
trans-unit.target: Te ra kite ratou i nga anahera - e kore te rongo pai ka reira kia taua ra mo nga kaimahi, me [nga anahera] e mea, "haukotia me uaua."

trans-unit.source: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
trans-unit.target: A ka tirohia e matou nga mea i mea ai ratou o mahi, ka meinga ratou kia rite ki te puehu marara.

trans-unit.source: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.
trans-unit.target: Nga hoa o Pararaiha, e Day, he [i roto i] te wahi okiokinga pai whakataunga me te pai.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] te Day ina ka wahia te rangi tuwhera ki [puta] kapua, a ka kia tonoa iho nga anahera i roto i te heketanga ngā.

trans-unit.source: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.
trans-unit.target: mana pono, e Day, he hoki te aroha Rawa.

trans-unit.source: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.
trans-unit.target: A te Day ka ngau i te hara i runga i ona ringa [i roto i te pōuri] e mea ia, "Aue, e hiahia ana ahau i tango ahau ki te anahera i te ara.

trans-unit.source: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
trans-unit.target: Aue, Aue, ki ahau!

trans-unit.source: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."
trans-unit.target: arahina atu ana e ia ki ahau i te mahara ki muri i haere mai te reira ki ahau.

trans-unit.source: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea te anahera kua, "e toku Ariki, pono kua tangohia taku iwi tenei Qur'an rite [he mea] mahue."

trans-unit.source: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.
trans-unit.target: Na ko te kupu tenei i hanga e matou mo nga poropiti he hoariri i roto i nga kaimahi kino.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakateka mea, "He aha e kore i te Qur'an whakakitea ki a ia nga mea katoa i kotahi?"

trans-unit.source: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ratou e haere mai ki a koutou ki te tautohe ki te kahore e kawea mai matou ki a koutou i te pono, me te whakamārama pai.

trans-unit.source: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.
trans-unit.target: Nga mea e huihui i runga i o ratou kanohi ki a te reinga - te hunga ko te kino i roto i te tūnga, me te whakamutunga kotiti ke i roto i [to ratou] ara.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.
trans-unit.target: Na i tino hoatu e matou a Mohi te karaipiture, ka whakaritea ki a ia tona teina, a Arona hei kaiāwhina.

trans-unit.source: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea matou, "Haere e rua o koutou ki te iwi nei i whakakahore tatou tohu."

trans-unit.source: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na te iwi o Noa - ka ratou whakakahore nga karere, toremi matou ratou, a meinga e matou ia ratou no te taata i te tohu.

trans-unit.source: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
trans-unit.target: A [huna matou] 'tō ko Thamud me nga hoa o te poka, me te maha whakatupuranga i waenganui ia ratou.

trans-unit.source: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.
trans-unit.target: A mo ia aroaro matou tauira [rite faaararaa], a whakangaromia ia matou ki [katoa] whakangaromanga.

trans-unit.source: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
trans-unit.target: A kua ratou tae ki runga ki te pa i ninii ki te ua o te kino.

trans-unit.source: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?
trans-unit.target: A, no ratou kite koe, [e Muhammad], e tangohia e ratou a koutou e kore anake i roto i te manuki, [mea], "Ko te tangata i tonoa nei e Allah ano he karere tenei?

trans-unit.source: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.
trans-unit.target: Ia tata e kua takihala'i tatou i to tatou atua i kore matou i u i roto i [koropiko o] ratou. "Ko e haere ratou ki te mohio, ina kite ratou i te whiu, ko wai te mea pito kotiti i roto i [tona] ara.

trans-unit.source: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
trans-unit.target: Kua kite koutou i te tangata nei e rite ki tona atua ki tona hiahia ake?

trans-unit.source: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
trans-unit.target: e koutou whakaaro ranei e te nuinga o ratou e rongo ranei korerorero?

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
trans-unit.target: kore i koe whakaaro koutou Ariki - pehea ia atu te atarangi, a ki te pai ia, taea kua meinga e ia pahoho reira?

trans-unit.source: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mau tatou i te reira i roto i te ringa hoki te ringa poto.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te tangata e kua hanga i te po mo koutou ano kakahu, me te moe [he tikanga mo] okiokinga, kua hanga te ra he aranga.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water
trans-unit.target: A ko reira te tangata e tuku i te hau kia rite ki te rongo pai i te aroaro o tana mahi tohu, a tukua atu matou iho i te rangi te wai parakore

trans-unit.source: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.
trans-unit.target: Kia kawea matou ki te ora reira te whenua mate, me te hoatu i te reira rite inu ki te hunga i hanga matou o maha kararehe me nga tangata.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Na kua tino tohaina e matou i te reira i roto ia ratou e kia fakamanatu ai ratou, engari te nuinga o te iwi e pai anake ti'aturi ore.

trans-unit.source: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
trans-unit.target: A, ki te i pai matou, i taea kua tonoa matou ki nga pa he Warner.

trans-unit.source: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.
trans-unit.target: Na e kore e whakarongo ki nga iino, a tohe ki a ratou ki te Qur'an he whai nui.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te tangata e kua tukua [wā kotahi] nga moana e rua, kotahi hou, me te reka, me te kotahi tote, me te kawa, a ka whakaturia e ia ki waenganui ia ratou i te arai, me te arai arai.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te tangata e kua hanga i te wai te tangata, me te hanga iwi, me te faaipoiporaa ia [he whanaunga e].

trans-unit.source: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
trans-unit.target: Ko koropiko ratou, kaua ki te Allah e kore nei e hua ratou ranei kino ratou, a ko ake te disbeliever, ki tona Ariki, he kaiāwhina [ki a Hatana].

trans-unit.source: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i matou tonoa koutou, [e Muhammad], kahore ano he kaikawe o te rongo pai, me te Warner.

trans-unit.source: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "E kore ahau e ui o koutou hoki reira tetahi utu -. Anake e pai te tangata kia tango i te ara ki tona Ariki"

trans-unit.source: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -
trans-unit.target: Na e whakawhirinaki ana ki runga ki te Ever-Living e kore e mate, ka whakanui [Allah] ki tona te whakamoemiti.

trans-unit.source: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.
trans-unit.target: Ia te tangata e hanga i nga rangi, me te whenua, me te mea kei waenganui ia ratou i roto i te ono nga ra, me te ka whakapumautia ia ki runga ake i te torona - te nuinga o aroha, na ui e pā ana ki a ia tetahi pai ana.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "koropiko ki te aroha Rawa," e mea ratou, "Na te aha ko te aroha Rawa? Kia koropiko tatou ki taua e te tono koe ki a matou?"

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.
trans-unit.target: Ka hari te tangata e kua whakanohoia i roto i nga whetu nui rangi me whakanohoia reira he [tahunga] rama, me te marama luminous.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te tangata e hanga, kua te po, me te ra i roto i te tauatanga mō te tangata e hiahia ki te mahara e hiahia mauruuru ranei.

trans-unit.source: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,
trans-unit.target: Na nga tangata o te aroha Rawa ko te hunga e haere ki runga ki te whenua ngāwari, a ka te wāhitau kuware ratou [pakeke], e mea ana ratou [kupu o] te rangimarie,

trans-unit.source: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e noho [wahi o] te po ki to ratou Ariki piko, me te tu ana [i roto i te pure]

trans-unit.source: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e mea nei, "to tatou Ariki, te paruru i a matou i te whiu o te reinga Oia mau, kei te piri tonu tona whiu.;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko reira kino ano he whakataunga me te noho. "

trans-unit.source: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
trans-unit.target: A [Ko ratou] te hunga e, ka pau ratou, rave i te reira e kore rawa torutoru ranei engari e tonu, i waenganui i, [tika] āhua

trans-unit.source: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
trans-unit.target: A te hunga e kore e nei whakahuatia ki a Allah tetahi atua ranei whakamate te wairua i riria mai nei Allah [ki kia patua], ki te kahore e tika, a kahore e mahia e tika takoto.

trans-unit.source: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -
trans-unit.target: Whakanuia hoki ia ko te whiu i runga i te Day o raa, a ka ia noho reira whakama -

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore hoki te hunga e ripeneta, whakapono me te mahi mahi tika.

trans-unit.source: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.
trans-unit.target: Na ia te tangata e tatarahapa, e pono e tahuri te tika ki Allah ki [manakohia] ripeneta.

trans-unit.source: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
trans-unit.target: A [Ko ratou] te hunga e kore e whakaatu ki te teka, a ka haere tata korero kino ratou, haere ana ratou i te tura.

trans-unit.source: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
trans-unit.target: A ka turi me te matapo te hunga e, ka fakamanatu o nga irava o to ratou Ariki, e kore e taka ki runga ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e mea nei, "to tatou Ariki, tukua mai ia tatou i roto i to tatou wahine me whakamarie uri ki to tatou kanohi, me te hanga e matou he tauira mo te tangata tika."

trans-unit.source: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.
trans-unit.target: ka te hunga e whakawhiwhia te Chamber hoki ta ratou whakamanawanui, a ka kia riro ratou ki reira ki te oha me [kupu o] te rangimarie.

trans-unit.source: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.
trans-unit.target: Noho e amuri noa'tu reira.

trans-unit.source: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "He aha i pai toku Ariki tiaki mo koutou, ki te kahore hoki koutou inoi?"

trans-unit.source: Ta, Seen, Meem.
trans-unit.target: Ta, kite, Meem.

trans-unit.source: These are the verses of the clear Book.
trans-unit.target: Ko nga irava o te mārama e Tohi enei.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
trans-unit.target: Mahalo, [e Muhammad], e whakamate koutou koe ki te pouri e kore ratou e waiho whakapono.

trans-unit.source: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.
trans-unit.target: Ki te pai matou, i taea e tukua iho matou ki a ratou i te rangi he tohu mo e e noho ratou kaki whakaiti.

trans-unit.source: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tae mai kore heheuraa ki a ratou fo'ou i te aroha te nuinga anake e tahuri atu i te reira ratou.

trans-unit.source: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Hoki kua ratou whakakahore, engari i reira ka haere mai te rongo o taua ratou i whakamahia ki te manuki ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
trans-unit.target: kihai ratou i titiro ki te whenua - te nui kua whakaputaina matou reira i nga ahua pai?

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] ka karangatia e koutou Ariki a Mohi, [mea], "Haere ki te iwi he -

trans-unit.source: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"
trans-unit.target: Te iwi o Parao.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E toku Ariki, pono wehi ahau e ka whakakahore i ahau e ratou

trans-unit.source: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
trans-unit.target: A e ka whakakikī toku uma, a e kore e matatau toku arero, pera unga hoki Arona.

trans-unit.source: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
trans-unit.target: Na to ratou ki runga ki ahau i te [kerēme e tika ki] hara, kia wehi ahau e ka whakamatea ahau e ratou. "

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
trans-unit.target: mea [Allah], "No. Haere rua o koutou ki to tatou tohu: pono, kei matou ki a koutou, e whakarongo ana.

trans-unit.source: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Haere ki a Parao, ka mea, 'Ko nga karere o te Ariki o nga ao tatou,

trans-unit.source: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
trans-unit.target: [Ki fekau'i mea], "Tonoa ki a matou nga tamariki o Iharaira." ' "

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao], "kihai ianei matou whakaarahia koe i roto ia matou ano te tamaiti, a ka noho koe i roto ia matou no te tau o to outou oraraa?

trans-unit.source: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."
trans-unit.target: A [Na] i koe tou mahi i meatia e koutou, a ko koutou o te ew hakawhetai. "

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.
trans-unit.target: [A Mohi] mea, "i ahau i te reira, na, i ahau o te hunga kotiti ke.

trans-unit.source: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
trans-unit.target: Na rere ahau i a koutou, ina wehi ahau a koutou.

trans-unit.source: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
trans-unit.target: Na ko tenei he manako o e whakamahara koe i ahau -? E kua pononga e koe nga tamariki a Iharaira "

trans-unit.source: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
trans-unit.target: Ka mea a Parao, "Na te aha ko te Ariki o nga ao?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "te Ariki o te rangi, me te whenua, me e waenganui ratou, ki te mea kia waiho koe tuipau."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao] ki te hunga a tawhio noa ia, "E kore koe e rongo?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "tou Ariki me te Ariki o koutou matua tuatahi."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao], "Ko e mo'oni, he haurangi koutou 'karere' i nei i tonoa ki a koutou."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "te Ariki o te rawhiti, me te hauauru, me e waenganui ratou, ki te i koe ki te korerorero."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao], "Ki te tangohia e koe he atua te tahi atu atu i ahau, ina, ka waiho koutou e ahau i roto i te hunga herehere."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "Ahakoa ki te kawea mai e ahau a koutou whakakitea tohu?"

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao], "Na kawe reira, ki te kia waiho koe o te pono."

trans-unit.source: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.
trans-unit.target: Na [Mohi] maka tona tokotoko, a whakarere ko reira he whakakitea nakahi.

trans-unit.source: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
trans-unit.target: A ka kumea atu ana e ia tona ringa;

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao] ki te hunga tairanga a tawhio noa ia ia, "Ko e mo'oni, ko te kaititiro ako tenei.

trans-unit.source: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
trans-unit.target: Te hinaaro ia ki te pei koe i tou whenua i tona makutu, na te aha e tohutohu koe? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Hikitia [te mea o] ia ko tona teina, me te unga i roto i nga he kaikohikohi pa

trans-unit.source: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
trans-unit.target: Ko wai e kawe koe i nga ako, makutu mohio ".

trans-unit.source: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.
trans-unit.target: Na ka huihui nga tohunga mo te whakarite o te ra pai-mohiotia.

trans-unit.source: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea te reira ki te iwi, "E huihui koutou

trans-unit.source: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
trans-unit.target: E tatou te whai ai nga tohunga, ki te he e ratou te matua? "

trans-unit.source: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
trans-unit.target: A, no te taenga o nga tohunga, ka mea ratou ki a Parao, "He reira pono hoki tatou i te utu te mea e tatou i te matua?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ae, a pono, ka ka kia koe o te hunga e tata ana [ki ahau]."

trans-unit.source: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
trans-unit.target: ka mea a Mohi ki a ratou, "Maka mea katoa e maka a koutou."

trans-unit.source: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
trans-unit.target: Na maka ana e ratou o ratou taura me ratou tokotoko, ka mea, "Na te kaha o Parao, pono ko reira tatou te hunga e matua."

trans-unit.source: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
trans-unit.target: Na ka maka e Mohi tona tokotoko, a i pau kotahi reira ta ratou huraina.

trans-unit.source: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Na hinga iho nga tohunga i roto i te prostration [ki Allah].

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Kua whakapono matou i roto i te Ariki o nga ao,

trans-unit.source: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
trans-unit.target: Te Ariki o Mohi raua ko Arona. "

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Parao], "whakapono koe a Mohi i te aroaro o hoatu e ahau whakaaetanga a koutou. Ko e mo'oni, ko ia rangatira koutou nei i whakaako i makutu koutou, engari e haere koe ki te mohio. pono, ka hatepea atu e ahau o koutou ringa, me o koutou waewae ki runga ki taha ritenga, a ahau

trans-unit.source: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "E kore te kino. Ko e mo'oni, ki to tatou Ariki, ka hoki mai matou.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, titau tatou e, e muru to tatou Ariki, ia tatou o tatou hara, no te mea i tatou i te tuatahi o nga whakapono ".

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
trans-unit.target: Na ka faauruhia matou ki a Mohi, "Haere i te po ki aku pononga; pono, ka whaia koe."

trans-unit.source: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Na ka tono tangata a Parao i roto i nga he kaikohikohi pa

trans-unit.source: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
trans-unit.target: [Na ka mea], "Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e engari he ropu iti,

trans-unit.source: And indeed, they are enraging us,
trans-unit.target: A pono, kei te enraging ratou a matou,

trans-unit.source: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "
trans-unit.target: A pono, ko tatou te hapori tupato ... "

trans-unit.source: So We removed them from gardens and springs
trans-unit.target: Na nekehia matou ratou i kari, me puna

trans-unit.source: And treasures and honorable station -
trans-unit.target: Na taonga me te teihana whakahonoretia -

trans-unit.source: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu.

trans-unit.source: So they pursued them at sunrise.
trans-unit.target: Na whaia ana e ratou a ratou i te putanga.

trans-unit.source: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
trans-unit.target: A, no te kitenga o nga kamupene e rua tetahi ki tetahi, nga hoa o Mohi ka mea, "Ko e mo'oni, ko tatou ki te ra i rokohanga!"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
trans-unit.target: mea [a Mohi], "Kahore e mo'oni, ki ahau ko toku Ariki:! ka ārahi ia i ahau."

trans-unit.source: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
trans-unit.target: Na ka faauruhia matou ki a Mohi, "Patua a ki tou tokotoko te moana," ka manganga, a ko ia wahi, ano he maunga, meake nui.

trans-unit.source: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kake haere matou ena nga kaiwhai.

trans-unit.source: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaorangia matou a Mohi me te hunga ki a ia, tahi katoa.

trans-unit.source: Then We drowned the others.
trans-unit.target: Na ka toremi matou nga ētahi atu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
trans-unit.target: Na taki te rongo o Aperahama ki a ratou,

trans-unit.source: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea ia ki tona papa, me tona iwi, "He aha e koropiko koe?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "koropiko matou whakapakoko, me te noho ki a ratou kanga."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E rongo ratou ki a koutou, ina inoi atu koe?

trans-unit.source: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
trans-unit.target: Ranei e whai hua ratou koutou, ranei te mahi kino ratou? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko kitea e matou i to tatou matua, mahi penei."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Na e kite koe i te mea ta koutou i koropiko,

trans-unit.source: You and your ancient forefathers?
trans-unit.target: Koe me koutou matua onamata?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he hoariri ki ahau e ratou, ki te kahore te Ariki o nga ao,

trans-unit.source: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai i hanga ahau, a ia [ko reira nei] ārahi ana i ahau.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
trans-unit.target: A ko reira ia te tangata e kai i ahau, me homai inu ahau.

trans-unit.source: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
trans-unit.target: A, no ka ahau mate ahau, he reira ia te tangata e fakamo'ui ahau

trans-unit.source: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
trans-unit.target: A ko wai e meinga ki ahau mate a ka kawe mai ki ahau ki te ora

trans-unit.source: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
trans-unit.target: A ko wai titau ahau e ka whakarerea noatia iho e ia ki ahau toku hara ki runga ki te Day o utua ".

trans-unit.source: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
trans-unit.target: [Na ka mea ia], "E toku Ariki, homai ki ahau te mana, me te uru atu ahau ki te hunga tika.

trans-unit.source: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.
trans-unit.target: A ka homai ki ahau he ingoa o te honore i roto i nga whakatupuranga i muri mai.

trans-unit.source: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
trans-unit.target: A tuu i ahau i roto i nga riro o te kari o te Pleasure.

trans-unit.source: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
trans-unit.target: A ka whakarerea noatia toku papa.

trans-unit.source: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakaititia ahau i runga i te Day ratou e [katoa] faahou -

trans-unit.source: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
trans-unit.target: Te Day, no te kore i reira e whai hua [tetahi] taonga ranei tamariki

trans-unit.source: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."
trans-unit.target: Ko tetahi e haere mai ana ki a Allah ki te ngakau tangi anake. "

trans-unit.source: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
trans-unit.target: A ka Pararaiha kia kawea mai tata [e Day] ki te hunga tika.

trans-unit.source: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
trans-unit.target: A ka kawea mai ki waho po auahi mo nga deviators,

trans-unit.source: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
trans-unit.target: A ka mea te reira ki a ratou, "Kei hea te hunga e whakamahia ana e koe ki te koropiko

trans-unit.source: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"
trans-unit.target: Ētahi atu Allah?

trans-unit.source: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators
trans-unit.target: Na ka turakina ratou ki po auahi, ratou ko nga deviators

trans-unit.source: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
trans-unit.target: Na nga hoia o Iblees, tahi katoa.

trans-unit.source: They will say while they dispute therein,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, ia ratou e tautohetohe ki reira,

trans-unit.source: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error
trans-unit.target: "Na Allah, i matou pono i roto i te hapa whakakitea

trans-unit.source: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A, no te matou aifaito koe ki te Ariki o nga ao.

trans-unit.source: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Na ka è kahore tetahi tatou anake nga kaimahi kino.

trans-unit.source: So now we have no intercessors
trans-unit.target: Na inaianei to tatou kahore kaiwhakaako

trans-unit.source: And not a devoted friend.
trans-unit.target: A e kore tetahi hoa kanga.

trans-unit.source: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "
trans-unit.target: Na, ki te anake i tatou i te hoki [ki te ao] a taea kia o te whakapono ... "

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: The people of Noah denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: whakakahore te iwi o Noa nga karere

trans-unit.source: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea o ratou teina Noa ki a ratou, "E kore koe e wehi Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau ki a koutou i te karere pono.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e ui ki a koutou mo reira tetahi utu.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me."
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Kia whakapono tatou koutou i e aru koutou i te [piha haapiiraa o te iwi] i raro?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Na te aha ko toku matauranga o ta ratou whakamahia ki te mahi?

trans-unit.source: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
trans-unit.target: Ko to ratou pūkete anake ki runga ki toku Ariki, ki te [taea] koutou kite.

trans-unit.source: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
trans-unit.target: A ko ahau e kore e kotahi ki te pei atu i te whakapono.

trans-unit.source: I am only a clear warner."
trans-unit.target: Ko ahau anake te mārama Warner. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ki te kore koutou e waiho, e Noa, e pono hei koutou o te hunga e aki ki te kohatu."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "pono ​​toku Ariki, kua whakakahore ahau taku iwi.

trans-unit.source: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
trans-unit.target: Katahi whakawa i waenganui i ahau, a ratou ki te whakawa whakatakotoria, me te whakaora i ahau, me te hunga ki ahau o te whakapono. "

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
trans-unit.target: Na whakaorangia matou ia me te hunga ki a ia i roto i te kaipuke te pikaunga.

trans-unit.source: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
trans-unit.target: Na ka toremi matou muri nga mea e toe ana.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: 'Aad denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: 'Whakakahore tō te karere

trans-unit.source: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea o ratou teina HUD ki a ratou, "E kore koe e wehi Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau ki a koutou i te karere pono.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e ui ki a koutou mo reira tetahi utu.

trans-unit.source: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,
trans-unit.target: E hanga e koe i runga i nga tairanga he tohu, whakangahau koutou,

trans-unit.source: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?
trans-unit.target: A ka tango hoki koutou whare me pa taiepa kia noho koutou e amuri?

trans-unit.source: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka patu koe, patu koe rite nanakia.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
trans-unit.target: Na ka wehi ia te tangata e whakaratohia e koe ki taua e matau ana koutou,

trans-unit.source: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
trans-unit.target: Whakaratohia e koe ki te karaihe kararehe, me ngā tamariki

trans-unit.source: And gardens and springs.
trans-unit.target: Na he kari, ka puna.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, wehi ahau mo koutou i te whiu o te ra whakamataku ".

trans-unit.source: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko reira te taua katoa ki a matou ranei tohutohu koe ranei e kore o nga kaitohutohu.

trans-unit.source: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
trans-unit.target: e kore he ko tenei te ritenga o nga iwi o mua,

trans-unit.source: And we are not to be punished."
trans-unit.target: A e kore e ki kia whiua tatou. "

trans-unit.source: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore ratou ki a ia, na huna matou ratou.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: Thamud denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: whakakahore Thamud nga karere

trans-unit.source: When their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea o ratou teina Salih ki a ratou, "E kore koe e wehi Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau ki a koutou i te karere pono.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e ui ki a koutou mo reira tetahi utu.

trans-unit.source: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
trans-unit.target: Ka mahue koutou i roto i te mea he konei, haumaru [i te mate],

trans-unit.source: Within gardens and springs
trans-unit.target: I roto i ngā māra me puna

trans-unit.source: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
trans-unit.target: Na mara o kai me nikau ki te hua loto?

trans-unit.source: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
trans-unit.target: Na te whakairo e koe i roto i nga maunga, mau fare, te mohio.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakarongo ki te tikanga o nga poka ke,

trans-unit.source: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
trans-unit.target: Ko wai meinga pirau i te whenua, me te kore e whakatikatika. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko koe anake o te hunga pāngia e te makutu.

trans-unit.source: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Ko koe ko te tangata rite tatou, kia kawea mai he tohu, ki te kia koe o te pono ".

trans-unit.source: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko te kupu tenei he ia-kamera. hoki ko ia he [wa o] inu, a hoki kei a koutou he [wa o] inu, [ia] i runga i te ra e mohiotia.

trans-unit.source: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
trans-unit.target: A e kore e pa ki a ia ki te kino, kei kia mau koe i te whiu o te ra whakamataku. "

trans-unit.source: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
trans-unit.target: Otiia whakangongea ratou ia, a na ka puta ke.

trans-unit.source: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hopukia ratou i te whiu.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: The people of Lot denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: whakakahore te iwi o Rota nga karere

trans-unit.source: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea o ratou teina a Rota ki a ratou, "E kore koe e wehi Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau ki a koutou i te karere pono.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e ui ki a koutou mo reira tetahi utu.

trans-unit.source: Do you approach males among the worlds
trans-unit.target: E whakatata koutou tane i roto i te ao

trans-unit.source: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
trans-unit.target: A ka waiho kua hanga he aha koutou Ariki hoki koutou rite hoa?

trans-unit.source: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ki te kore koutou e waiho, e Rota, ka ai koutou o te hunga panaia."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau, ki tou mahi, o te hunga e whakarihariha [te reira].

trans-unit.source: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
trans-unit.target: Toku Ariki, whakaorangia ahau, me toku hapu i [te hopearaa o] ta ratou mahi. "

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, all,
trans-unit.target: Na whakaorangia matou ia ko tona hapu, katoa,

trans-unit.source: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
trans-unit.target: Te kore te wahine tawhito i roto i te hunga e noho ki muri.

trans-unit.source: Then We destroyed the others.
trans-unit.target: Na ka huna e matou te etahi.

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
trans-unit.target: Na ka uaina matou ki runga ki a ratou i te ua [o kohatu], a ko te ua o te hunga i fakatokanga te kino.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers
trans-unit.target: whakakahore nga hoa o te ngahere nga karere

trans-unit.source: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea Shu'ayb ki a ratou, "E kore koe e wehi Allah?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ahau ki a koutou i te karere pono.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah and obey me.
trans-unit.target: Na wehi Allah me whakarongo ahau.

trans-unit.source: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore ahau e ui ki a koutou mo reira tetahi utu.

trans-unit.source: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
trans-unit.target: Homai makona, me te kore e kia o te hunga e meinga mate.

trans-unit.source: And weigh with an even balance.
trans-unit.target: A ka paunatia ki i te pauna tika.

trans-unit.source: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e faaere te iwi o to ratou tika, me te kore e mahia e tūkino i runga i te whenua, horahanga pirau.

trans-unit.source: And fear He who created you and the former creation."
trans-unit.target: Na ka wehi ia te tangata e hanga e koe, me te hanga o mua. "

trans-unit.source: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko koe anake o te hunga pāngia e te makutu.

trans-unit.source: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.
trans-unit.target: Ko koe ko te tangata rite tatou, a pono, whakaaro matou ko koe i roto i nga teka.

trans-unit.source: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Na meinga ki te hinga ki runga ki a matou whatiwhatinga o te rangi, ki te kia koe o te pono. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Ko te mohio te nuinga o ta koutou mahi toku Ariki."

trans-unit.source: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore ratou ki a ia, na ka mau ratou ki te whiu o te ra o te kapua mangu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te tohu, engari te nuinga o ratou i kore ki te hei whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: A pono, to koutou Ariki - ko ia te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te aroha.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A pono, ko te Qur'an te whakakitenga mai o te Ariki o nga ao.

trans-unit.source: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down
trans-unit.target: kawea te Wairua Pono kua reira iho

trans-unit.source: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -
trans-unit.target: Ki runga ki o koutou ngakau, [e Muhammad] - kia koe o nga warners -

trans-unit.source: In a clear Arabic language.
trans-unit.target: I roto i te mārama te reo Arabic.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
trans-unit.target: A pono, te reira te [whakahuatia] i roto i te mau papa'iraa mo'a o iwi mua.

trans-unit.source: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
trans-unit.target: A e kore kua reira i te tohu ki a ratou e te mohio te reira e nga karaipi o nga tamariki o Iharaira?

trans-unit.source: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners
trans-unit.target: A ara, ki te i whakakitea reira matou ki tetahi i roto i nga tangata ke

trans-unit.source: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.
trans-unit.target: A i karakia ia te reira ki a ratou [maitai], e [tonu] kihai i ratou whakapono i roto i reira.

trans-unit.source: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu i whakaurua matou ti'aturi ore ki te ngakau o nga kaimahi kino.

trans-unit.source: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e whakapono i roto i te reira kia kite ra ano i te whiu fakamamahi.

trans-unit.source: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
trans-unit.target: A ka haere mai te reira ki a ratou kitea rawatia ake, ia ratou e kite [te reira] e kore.

trans-unit.source: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ratou, "Kia reprieved tatou?"

trans-unit.source: So for Our punishment are they impatient?
trans-unit.target: Na mo te whiu tatou he manawanui ratou?

trans-unit.source: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
trans-unit.target: Na kua whakaaro koutou ki te hoatu e matou a ratou oaoaraa mō tau

trans-unit.source: And then there came to them that which they were promised?
trans-unit.target: Na ka haere mai ki a ratou i korero ai ratou?

trans-unit.source: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
trans-unit.target: kihai i pai kia awhina ratou i te oaoaraa ki i i whakaratohia e ratou.

trans-unit.source: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
trans-unit.target: A kihai i whakangaromia matou tetahi pa anake taua i te reira warners

trans-unit.source: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki te whakamaumahara;

trans-unit.source: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i nga rewera kawea te heheuraa iho.

trans-unit.source: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
trans-unit.target: e kore te tīkina te reira mo ratou, e kore e taea e ratou.

trans-unit.source: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni ratou, i [ona] whakarongo, e tangohia.

trans-unit.source: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
trans-unit.target: Heoi kaua hoki e whakahuatia ki a Allah tetahi atua, me [kupu] kia roto te whiua.

trans-unit.source: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.
trans-unit.target: A ka faaara, [e Muhammad], koutou whanaunga tata.

trans-unit.source: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.
trans-unit.target: Na raro koutou parirau ki te hunga e whai koutou o nga whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
trans-unit.target: A ki te takahi ratou koe, ka mea, "Ko e mo'oni, ahau tētehi ahau i te mea e mahi koe."

trans-unit.source: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
trans-unit.target: Na e whakawhirinaki ana ki runga ki te whakanuia te i roto i te Kaha, te aroha,

trans-unit.source: Who sees you when you arise
trans-unit.target: Ko wai e kite ana ia koe ina whakatika koe

trans-unit.source: And your movement among those who prostrate.
trans-unit.target: Na to koutou kaupapa i roto i te hunga e koropiko.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko ia te rongo, te matau.

trans-unit.source: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
trans-unit.target: Ka e koe e ahau ki runga ki nei heke i te rewera?

trans-unit.source: They descend upon every sinful liar.
trans-unit.target: heke ana ratou i runga i nga teka hara.

trans-unit.source: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.
trans-unit.target: haere ratou i runga i te mea kua rongo, a te nuinga o ratou he teka.

trans-unit.source: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
trans-unit.target: Na nga kaitito - [anake] whai nga deviators ratou;

trans-unit.source: Do you not see that in every valley they roam
trans-unit.target: e kore koutou e kite i taua i roto i nga awaawa ata ratou

trans-unit.source: And that they say what they do not do? -
trans-unit.target: A e mea ratou ki ta kore ratou e mahi i?

trans-unit.source: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Te kore te hunga [kaitito] e whakapono, me te mahi mahi tika, me te mahara ki Allah maha, ka tiakina [nga Mahometa] i muri i tukinotia ana e ratou.

trans-unit.source: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book
trans-unit.target: Ta, kite.

trans-unit.source: As guidance and good tidings for the believers
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki te arata'iraa a te rongo pai mo te whakapono

trans-unit.source: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].
trans-unit.target: Ko wai whakapumautia inoi, me te hoatu zakah, a he etahi [i roto i te whakapono] ratou o te ake.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, no te hunga e kore e whakapono i roto i te ake, kua meinga e matou reka ki a ratou o ratou mahi, na kopikopiko ratou matapo.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hunga hoki nei ki reira e te kino o te whiu, ko roto i te ake ko ratou nga mole rahi.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: A pono, [e Muhammad], riro koe i te Qur'an i tetahi whakaaro nui ko matau.

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."
trans-unit.target: [Faahiti i] ka mea a Mohi ki tona hapu, "Ko e mo'oni, kua mohio ahau he ahi. Ka kawea mai e ahau ki a koutou i reira mōhiohio ka kawea koe he rama mura e kia whakamahana koutou ia koutou ranei."

trans-unit.source: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Otira ka haere mai ia ki a reira, i huaina ia, "Ka hari te Ko te tangata i te ahi, me he tangata a tawhio noa te reira. Na ka whakanuia ko Allah, te Ariki o nga ao.

trans-unit.source: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: E Mohi, pono ko reira ahau -. Allah, te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te Potó "

trans-unit.source: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.
trans-unit.target: Na [ka korerotia e ia], "Maka iho koutou tokotoko."

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Te kore, ia te tangata e hara, ka whakakapi pai i muri i te kino - pono, ahau Fakamolemole me aroha ahau.

trans-unit.source: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: A ka hoatu koutou ringa ki te whakatuwheratanga o to koutou kakahu [i te uma];

trans-unit.source: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Otira, no te reira tae mai ki a ratou to tatou tohu kitea, ka mea ratou, "Ko te makutu kitea tenei."

trans-unit.source: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Whakorekore ana ratou ki a ratou, ia papu to ratou [roto] ano ona, i roto i te tia ore, me te whakahirahira hoki.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
trans-unit.target: Na i tino homai matou ki a Rawiri raua ko Horomona te matauranga, a ka mea ratou, "Whakamoemititia [he tika] ki Allah, e kua manakohia nei tatou i runga i tokomaha o ana pononga whakapono."

trans-unit.source: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."
trans-unit.target: Na ka riro a Horomona Rawiri.

trans-unit.source: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.
trans-unit.target: Na ka huihuia hoki a Horomona i tana hoia o te jinn me te tangata, me nga manu, a ko ratou [tapuwae] i roto i te rarangi.

trans-unit.source: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."
trans-unit.target: Noa, ka haere mai ratou ki runga ki te raorao o nga popokorua, ka mea he popokorua, "E te popokorua, tomo koutou nohoanga e kore koutou e mongamonga e Horomona me tona hoia i kore ratou e kite."

trans-unit.source: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."
trans-unit.target: ataata Na [Horomona], takaro i tona kupu, a ka mea, "E toku Ariki, taea ahau ki te kia mauruuru no tou manako e kua homai e koe ki runga ki ahau, me i runga i oku metua, me ki te mahi i te tika o e whakaaetia koe. Na ka whakaae ahau e tou

trans-unit.source: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?
trans-unit.target: Na ka mau ia ki te haereraa o te manu, ka mea, "He aha e kore e kite i ahau i te hupou - ranei ko ia i roto i te e ngaro?

trans-unit.source: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."
trans-unit.target: he pono ka whiua e ahau a ia ki te whiu nui ranei patua ia kahore ia hopoi ahau whakamanatanga mārama. "

trans-unit.source: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.
trans-unit.target: Otiia kihai i noho te hupou roa, ka mea, "Kua karapotia ahau [i roto i te matauranga] e nei kihai i karapotia koe, a kua tae mai ahau ki a koutou i Hepa ki etahi korero.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, kitea e ahau [reira] te wahine kingi ratou, a ka kua ia kua homai o nga mea katoa, a ka kua ia he torona nui.

trans-unit.source: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,
trans-unit.target: kitea e ahau ia ia, me ona iwi koropiko ki te ra hei utu mo o Allah, ka meinga a Hatana kua ratou mahi reka ki a ratou, ka mutu ratou i [tana] ara, na e kore e ratou ārahi,

trans-unit.source: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -
trans-unit.target: [A] na ratou e kore e koropiko ki Allah, e hopoi mai mai te mea huna i roto i te rangi, me te whenua, me te mohio he aha te huna koe me aha whakapuaki koutou -

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."
trans-unit.target: Allah - kahore he atua ia anake, e te Ariki o te torona nui ".

trans-unit.source: [Solomon] said, "We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.
trans-unit.target: mea [a Horomona], "Ka kite matou ranei koe pono ranei i o nga teka.

trans-unit.source: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."
trans-unit.target: Tangohia tenei pukapuka o te aku, a whakaorangia ana e ia ki a ratou.

trans-unit.source: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E te hunga tairanga, pono, ki oti ahau kua hoatu te pukapuka pai.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko reira i Horomona, a pono, na ô te reira: 'I roto i te ingoa o Allah, te Me te aroha, te Rawa aroha,

trans-unit.source: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "
trans-unit.target: Kia kaua e whakapehapeha ki ahau engari haere mai ki ahau i roto i te tāpaetanga [rite Mahometa]. '

trans-unit.source: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "hunga e tairanga, tohutohu ahau i roto i toku take. kihai ahau i pai kia whakatau i te mea noa kaititiro koutou [mo] ahau."

trans-unit.source: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "Ko matou nga tangata o te kaha, me te o kaha hōia nui, engari ko te whakahau ko koutou, kia kite i te aha e whakahau koutou."

trans-unit.source: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "He pono kingi - ka tomo ratou i te pa, ururua ratou a reira, ka hoatu te kororia o ona iwi whakaiti A tenei mahi mahi ratou..

trans-unit.source: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."
trans-unit.target: Ko pono, ka tonoa e ahau ki a ratou he mea homai noa, me te kite ki te aha [whakautu] ka hoki nga karere. "

trans-unit.source: So when they came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.
trans-unit.target: Na, no ka tae ratou ki a Horomona, ka mea ia, "E whakarato koe ki ahau ki te taonga? Ko te aha i homai Allah kua ki ahau, pai atu i te mea kua homai e ia a koutou. Râ, he reira koutou te hunga e hari ana i roto i tau whakahere.

trans-unit.source: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased."
trans-unit.target: Hoki ki a ratou, no te pono, ka haere mai matou ki a ratou ki te hoia e ka waiho ratou kaha ki te farerei, a he pono ka pei ia ratou e matou reira i roto i te whakaitinga, a ka kia whakaititia ratou. "

trans-unit.source: [Solomon] said, "O assembly [of jinn], which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
trans-unit.target: mea [a Horomona], "e te huihui [o jinn], e o koutou e kawe ahau tona torona i mua i haere mai ratou ki ahau i roto i te tāpaetanga?"

trans-unit.source: A powerful one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."
trans-unit.target: ka mea te tangata kaha i roto i te jinn, "ka kawea te reira e ahau ki a koutou i mua i whakatika koe i tou wahi, a pono, ko ahau hoki tenei [mahi] kaha, me te pono."

trans-unit.source: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."
trans-unit.target: Ka mea tetahi i mohio i te karaipiture, "ka kawea te reira e ahau ki a koutou i te aroaro o koutou hoki mawhiti ki a koe."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who is not guided."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "ke hoki ia ia torona: e kite matou e ranei arata'ihia ia [ki te pono] e kia o te hunga e kore te nei ārahi ranei."

trans-unit.source: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?" She said, "[It is] as though it was it." [Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Na, no te taenga ia, ka mea te reira [ki a ia], "Ko to koutou torona rite tenei?"

trans-unit.source: And that which she was worshipping other than Allah had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: A i te mea i koropiko ia atu i te Allah i mutu ai tona [i tāpaetanga ki a ia].

trans-unit.source: She was told, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: ka korerotia e ia, "E tomo te whare."

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], "Worship Allah," and at once they were two parties conflicting.
trans-unit.target: Na ka i tino tono tangata e matou ki a Thamud ratou teina Salih, [mea], "Lotu Allah," me i kotahi ratou rōpū e rua taupatupatu.

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, why are you impatient for evil instead of good? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E taku iwi, he aha he koe pouri mo te kino hei utu mo o te pai? He aha e kore e koe e rapu te faaoreraa hara o Allah kia whiwhi koutou tohu?"

trans-unit.source: They said, "We consider you a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with Allah. Rather, you are a people being tested."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "whakaaro matou ki a koutou he tohu aituā, koutou ko te hunga ki a koe."

trans-unit.source: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].
trans-unit.target: Na reira i roto i te upoko utuafare pa iwa meinga pirau i te whenua, me te kore e whakatikatika [ona take].

trans-unit.source: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.' "
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "E mau ki te oati tahi e Allah e ka whakamatea e matou ia i te po, ia ko tona hapu. Katahi ka mea matou ki tona whakahaere, 'E kore matou i whakaae te whakangaromanga o tona hapu, a pono, he pono matou.'

trans-unit.source: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaritea e ratou he mahere, ka whakaritea matou te mahere, i te kore ratou e mohio.

trans-unit.source: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.
trans-unit.target: Na ka titiro te pehea ko te putanga o to ratou mahere - e huna e matou ia ratou, me o ratou iwi, katoa.

trans-unit.source: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.
trans-unit.target: Na ko o ratou whare te hunga, mokemoke mo o te he i mahia e ratou.

trans-unit.source: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.
trans-unit.target: Na whakaorangia matou te hunga e whakapono, ka whakamahia ki te wehi Allah.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?
trans-unit.target: A [whakahua] Rota, ka mea ia ki tona iwi, "E mahi ana koutou i te moepuku ia e kite ia koe?

trans-unit.source: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."
trans-unit.target: E koe pono whakatata tangata ki hiahia hei utu o te wahine?

trans-unit.source: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, "Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."
trans-unit.target: Ko te whakahoki o tona iwi kihai i kore ai e mea ratou, "motuhia te hapu o Rota i to koutou pa. Oia mau, he iwi e pupuri ratou ma ratou."

trans-unit.source: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.
trans-unit.target: Na whakaorangia matou ia ko tona hapu, ki te kahore hoki tana wahine;

trans-unit.source: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
trans-unit.target: Na ka uaina matou ki runga ki a ratou i te ua [o kohatu], a ko te ua o te hunga i fakatokanga te kino.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Praise be to Allah, and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what they associate with Him?"
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Kia whakapaingia ki Allah, me te rangimarie ki runga ki ana pononga i whiriwhiria nei e ia. Ko Allah pai ta ratou piri ki a ia ranei?"

trans-unit.source: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].
trans-unit.target: [More ïa], [e kore pai] Ko ia te tangata e hanga i nga rangi, me te whenua, a ka tono tangata ki raro, mo te ua ki a koutou i i te rangi, meinga ki te tupu reira kari o ataahua koa i taea e kore [te kore] i tupu e koe nga rakau o reira?

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: He ia [e kore pai] nei i hanga te whenua he whenua pūmau, me te whakanohoia i roto i te reira awa, ka meinga hoki reira mau whakaturia maunga, ka whakanohoia i waenganui i nga moana e rua hei arai atu?

trans-unit.source: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember.
