trans-unit.target: Na waiho ratou ki te kōrero kau a he whakangahau, tae noa ki te whakatau e ratou to ratou Day e kua fafauhia ratou -

trans-unit.source: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
trans-unit.target: Te Day ka puta ratou i nga urupa tere, me te mea ratou, ki te whakapakoko whakaturia, haapeepeeraa.

trans-unit.source: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
trans-unit.target: whakaiti ratou kanohi, ka hipokina ratou whakaitinga.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ka tono tangata e matou Noa ki tona iwi, [mea], "me kauwhau i tou iwi i te aroaro o reira mai ki a ratou i te whiu mauiui."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E taku iwi, pono ko ahau ki a koutou i te mārama Warner,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.
trans-unit.target: [Mea], 'koropiko Allah, wehi ia ia, me te whakarongo ki ahau.

trans-unit.source: Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "
trans-unit.target: ka whakarerea noatia iho koe Allah o koutou hara, me te whakaroa koe mo te wā i whakaritea.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "E toku Ariki, pono ahau karangatia taku iwi [ki te pono] po, me te ra.

trans-unit.source: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.
trans-unit.target: Otiia nui toku fakaafe ratou kahore anake i roto i te rere.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
trans-unit.target: A pono, wa katoa i karangatia e ahau ia ratou e kia muru ratou koe, hoatu e ratou a ratou maihao i roto i o ratou taringa, hipokina ratou ki o ratou kakahu, tohe tonu, a ko whakakake ki whakapehapeha [nui].

trans-unit.source: Then I invited them publicly.
trans-unit.target: Na ka karangatia e ahau ratou nuitia.

trans-unit.source: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
trans-unit.target: Na ka kauwhautia e ahau ki a ratou, me [hoki] whakawhirinaki ki a ratou puku

trans-unit.source: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea, 'A ani i te faaoreraa hara o to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
trans-unit.target: Ka unga ia [ua i] te rangi ki runga ki a koutou i roto i [tonu] ua

trans-unit.source: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
trans-unit.target: A ka hoatu ake i a koutou i roto i te taonga me te tamariki, me te whakarato hoki koutou kari, me te whakarato hoki koutou awa.

trans-unit.source: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur
trans-unit.target: He aha te mea [te mea] ki a koutou e kore koutou e huanga ki Allah hanahana [e tika]

trans-unit.source: While He has created you in stages?
trans-unit.target: Ahakoa kua hanga e ia a koutou i roto i ngā wāhanga?

trans-unit.source: Do you not consider how Allah has created seven heavens in layers
trans-unit.target: e kore koutou e whakaaro hanga pehea kua Allah whitu rangi i roto i te papa

trans-unit.source: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e te marama i roto i te [kitea] marama, ka hanga te ra he rama mura?

trans-unit.source: And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
trans-unit.target: Na kua meinga Allah ki a koe tupu i te tupu [ahu whakamua] te whenua.

trans-unit.source: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoki ia ki a koutou ki reira, ka tango koe [tetahi] tangohanga.

trans-unit.source: And Allah has made for you the earth an expanse
trans-unit.target: Na kua hanga Allah mo koutou te whenua he kikorangi

trans-unit.source: That you may follow therein roads of passage.' "
trans-unit.target: Kia whai koe rori ki reira o te irava. '

trans-unit.source: Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
trans-unit.target: ka mea a Noa, "E toku Ariki, pono kua talangata'a ratou i ahau, a aru ana ia ia nei te taonga, me te kore e whakanui i a ia tamariki anake i roto i te mate.

trans-unit.source: And they conspired an immense conspiracy.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakatupuria e ratou he he e whakatakotoria nui.

trans-unit.source: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea, 'Kaua rawa e waiho koutou atua, a kore waiho Wadd ranei Suwa' ranei Yaghuth ko Ya'uq ko Nasr.

trans-unit.source: And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
trans-unit.target: A kua kua tokomaha takihala'i ratou.

trans-unit.source: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers.
trans-unit.target: No te mea o ratou hara ratou paremo ka hoatu ki roto ki te ahi, a kihai ratou i kitea hoki ratou haunga Allah [tetahi] kaiawhina.

trans-unit.source: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea a Noa, "E toku Ariki, e kore e waiho i runga i te whenua i roto i nga iino he tangata hei noho.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ki te waiho e koe a ratou, ka whakapohehetia e ratou au pononga, a e kore e whanau anake [katoa] tetahi kino, me te [whakapumautia] disbeliever.

trans-unit.source: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."
trans-unit.target: Toku Ariki, whakarerea noatia iho ahau, me aku mātua, me te tangata e tomo ki toku whare te whakapono me nga tangata whakapono me nga wahine whakapono.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "Kua riro te reira whakakitea ki ahau e whakarongo, ka mea, 'He pono, kua rongo matou he mīharo Qur'an te rōpū o te jinn.

trans-unit.source: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
trans-unit.target: ārahi ana te reira ki te akoranga e tika ana, a kua whakapono matou i roto i te reira.

trans-unit.source: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
trans-unit.target: A [haapii te reira] i whakanuia ko te nobleness o to tatou Ariki;

trans-unit.source: And that our foolish one has been saying about Allah an excessive transgression.
trans-unit.target: A e kua to tatou tetahi wairangi kua mea e pā ana ki Allah he te he nui.

trans-unit.source: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allah a lie.
trans-unit.target: Na i whakaaro matou e kore e te taata, me te jinn korero e pā ana ki Allah he teka.

trans-unit.source: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.
trans-unit.target: Na i reira nga tangata i te te tangata e rapu whakawhirinaki i roto i nga tangata i te jinn, pera ratou [anake] nui ratou i roto i te pikaunga.

trans-unit.source: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allah would never send anyone [as a messenger].
trans-unit.target: A i whakaaro ratou, rite whakaaro koutou, kia kore Allah e tonoa tetahi [rite te karere].

trans-unit.source: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
trans-unit.target: Na kua rapua e matou [ki te tae] i te rangi, engari i kitea whakakiia ana ki te kaitiaki kaha, me te tahu mura.

trans-unit.source: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakamahia matou ki te noho ki reira i roto i ngā tūranga mō te rongo, engari te tangata e rongo ana inaianei ka kite i te mura mura whanga i hoki ki a ia.

trans-unit.source: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
trans-unit.target: A kahore matou e mohio [Na] ahakoa te tikanga kino mo te hunga i runga i te whenua ranei, ahakoa e hiahia ana ratou Ariki hoki ratou i te akoranga e tika ana.

trans-unit.source: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.
trans-unit.target: Na ko te tangata tika i roto i a matou, a ka i roto ia tatou he [etahi] kore pera;

trans-unit.source: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allah upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
trans-unit.target: Na kua meinga matou etahi e kore e meinga e matou kore ki Allah ki runga ki te whenua, e kore ano matou e nehenehe e mawhiti ia ia i te rere.

trans-unit.source: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.
trans-unit.target: A, no te rongonga o matou i te arata'iraa, i whakapono matou i roto i te reira.

trans-unit.source: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allah], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
trans-unit.target: A i roto ia tatou he Mahometa [i roto i te tāpaetanga ki Allah], a ko te hunga he i roto ia tatou.

trans-unit.source: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
trans-unit.target: Ko rite mo te hunga he, ka waiho ratou, mo te reinga, wahie. '

trans-unit.source: And [Allah revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision
trans-unit.target: A [whakakitea Allah] e te mea i noho ratou tonu i runga i te ara, e kua hoatu e matou nui kai ratou

trans-unit.source: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na kia whakamatautau tatou ratou i reira.

trans-unit.source: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.
trans-unit.target: A [whakakitea e ia] e te masjids he mo Allah, kia kaua hoki e whakahuatia ki a Allah tetahi.

trans-unit.source: And that when the Servant of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."
trans-unit.target: A, e, no te tu te pononga o Allah ake te inoi ia, tata waiho ratou e pā ana ki a ia he puranga pēpēhia. "

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, [e Muhammad], "e ahau mahara ra anake toku Ariki, a kore e whakahoa ki a ia tetahi."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ko e mo'oni, e kore ahau e tango hoki koutou [te mana o] kino aronga matau ranei."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allah anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ko e mo'oni, e kore e reira tiaki ahau i Allah tetahi [ki kia takahi ahau], e kore e kitea e ahau i roto i te tahi atu atu i a ia i te piringa.

trans-unit.source: But [I have for you] only notification from Allah, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
trans-unit.target: Ko [to ahau mo koutou] whakamōhiotanga anake i Allah, me ana karere "A te tangata whakapono ki Allah me tana Messenger - na pono, kei hoki ia te ahi o te reinga:. Ka noho ratou ki reira a ake ake.

trans-unit.source: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
trans-unit.target: [Tonu nga iino] noa, ina kite ratou i te e korero ratou, katahi ka mohio ratou ko wai te mea ngoikore i roto i kaiāwhina me te iti iho i roto i te maha.

trans-unit.source: Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "E kore ahau e mohio ki te mea te mea e korero ai koutou he tata ki te e homai toku Ariki hoki reira he [roa] wā ranei."

trans-unit.source: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
trans-unit.target: [Ko ia] e mohio o te ngaro, a ka kore e whakaatu ia tona [matauranga o te] kitea ki tetahi

trans-unit.source: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore nei kua whakaaetia ia o karere, a pono, tukua ana e ia ki te aroaro o ia karere, me te muri ia mataitai

trans-unit.source: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
trans-unit.target: Kia mohio ia kua tuku e ratou nga karere a ratou Ariki;

trans-unit.source: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],
trans-unit.target: E koe e takaia ia [i roto i te kakahu],

trans-unit.source: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
trans-unit.target: Whakatika [ki te inoi] te po, ki te kahore hoki he iti -

trans-unit.source: Half of it - or subtract from it a little
trans-unit.target: Hawhe o reira - ranei tango i reira he iti

trans-unit.source: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.
trans-unit.target: tāpiri ranei ki reira, a ka taki i te Qur'an ki taki whanganga.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ka maka matou ki runga ki a koutou i te kupu taimaha.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko atu whai hua mō te whakaae [o te ngakau, me te arero] me te pai ake hoki nga kupu te haora o te po.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, roa hoki koutou i te ra te mahi.

trans-unit.source: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
trans-unit.target: Na kia mahara ki te ingoa o to koutou Ariki me aro nui koe ki a ia ki te itoito [oti].

trans-unit.source: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.
trans-unit.target: [Ko ia] te Ariki o te Te Tai Rāwhiti me te Te Hau-ā-uru;

trans-unit.source: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
trans-unit.target: Na kia manawanui ki runga ta ratou e mea, ka karo ratou ki te pare atawhai.

trans-unit.source: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
trans-unit.target: A ka waiho ahau ki [te mea o] te deniers, te hunga o te humarie [i roto i te ora], ka tukua ratou e koa ki he iti.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ki tatou [mo ratou] he mekameka, me te tahu ahi

trans-unit.source: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -
trans-unit.target: Me te kai e awhi nei me he whiu mauiui -

trans-unit.source: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
trans-unit.target: I runga i te Day ka convulse te whenua, me nga maunga, a ka riro nga maunga i te puranga o te onepu ringihia iho.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Kua tonoa e matou ki a koutou i te anahera hei kaiwhakaatu ki a koutou pera me tono tangata e matou ki a Parao i te karere.

trans-unit.source: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
trans-unit.target: Otiia tutu a Parao te karere, na ka hopu matou ia ia ki te ärai kau.

trans-unit.source: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white- haired?
trans-unit.target: Na ka pehea koe e taea e wehi, ki te kahore koe, he Day e ka meinga nga tamariki white- rouru?

trans-unit.source: The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled.
trans-unit.target: ka whati te rangi motu reira;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, Ko te faahaamana'oraa tenei, na te tangata pai kia tango i te ara ki tona Ariki.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muhammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allah determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allah and others fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, matau koutou Ariki, [e Muhammad], e tu koutou [i roto i te pure] tata e rua hautoru o te po ranei te hawhe o reira te toru o taua mea ranei, a [na te mahi] te rōpū o te hunga ki a koe.

trans-unit.source: O you who covers himself [with a garment],
trans-unit.target: E koe te tangata e hipoki ia [ki te kakahu],

trans-unit.source: Arise and warn
trans-unit.target: Whakatika, ka whakatupato

trans-unit.source: And your Lord glorify
trans-unit.target: A ka whakakororiatia tou Ariki

trans-unit.source: And your clothing purify
trans-unit.target: A pure i to outou kakahu

trans-unit.source: And uncleanliness avoid
trans-unit.target: Me te faka'ehi'ehi mei viivii

trans-unit.source: And do not confer favor to acquire more
trans-unit.target: A e kore e horo'a manakohia ki te whiwhi atu

trans-unit.source: But for your Lord be patient.
trans-unit.target: Ko e manawanui hoki koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And when the trumpet is blown,
trans-unit.target: A, no te te whakatangihia te tetere,

trans-unit.source: That Day will be a difficult day
trans-unit.target: ka waiho taua Day he ra uaua

trans-unit.source: For the disbelievers - not easy.
trans-unit.target: Hoki nga iino - e kore e ngāwari.

trans-unit.source: Leave Me with the one I created alone
trans-unit.target: Waiho ahau ki te tangata i hanga e ahau anake

trans-unit.source: And to whom I granted extensive wealth
trans-unit.target: Na ka homai e ahau ki nei whānui taonga

trans-unit.source: And children present [with him]
trans-unit.target: A ka tapaea tamariki [ki a ia]

trans-unit.source: And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
trans-unit.target: A ka horahia e [katoa] ia i mua, uhi [tona ora].

trans-unit.source: Then he desires that I should add more.
trans-unit.target: Katahi hiahia ia kia ahau tāpiri atu.

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: I will cover him with arduous torment.
trans-unit.target: Ka hipokina e ahau ia ki fakamamahi uaua.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, he thought and deliberated.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, whakaaro ia, ka whakaaro ia.

trans-unit.source: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
trans-unit.target: Na kia whakangaromia ia [mo] pehea whakaaro ia ia.

trans-unit.source: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
trans-unit.target: Na kia whakangaromia ia [mo] pehea whakaaro ia ia.

trans-unit.source: Then he considered [again];
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaaro [ano] ia;

trans-unit.source: Then he frowned and scowled;
trans-unit.target: Na ka frowned ia a whakapoururu;

trans-unit.source: Then he turned back and was arrogant
trans-unit.target: Na hoki tahuri ia, ka ko whakakake

trans-unit.source: And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea, "E kore te mea tenei i engari pee magic [i etahi].

trans-unit.source: This is not but the word of a human being."
trans-unit.target: e kore ko te kupu o te tangata ko tenei. "

trans-unit.source: I will drive him into Saqar.
trans-unit.target: Ka peia ia e ahau ki Saqar.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea kia mohio koe he aha te mea Saqar?

trans-unit.source: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
trans-unit.target: taea te reira i tetahi mea noho a rau kahore [unburned],

trans-unit.source: Blackening the skins.
trans-unit.target: Blackening nga ipu.

trans-unit.source: Over it are nineteen [angels].
trans-unit.target: Neke atu i te e te reira ma iwa [anahera].

trans-unit.source: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is hypocrisy and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allah leave astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And mention of the Fire is not but a reminder to humanity.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i hanga e matou nga kaitiaki o te ahi anake anahera.

trans-unit.source: No! By the moon
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And [by] the night when it departs
trans-unit.target: A [i] te po, ina haere atu ana

trans-unit.source: And [by] the morning when it brightens,
trans-unit.target: A [e] te ata ina marama reira,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Fire is of the greatest [afflictions]
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, Ko te ahi o te nui [mate]

trans-unit.source: As a warning to humanity -
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki te whakatūpato ki te tangata -

trans-unit.source: To whoever wills among you to proceed or stay behind.
trans-unit.target: Ki te pai tetahi i roto ia koutou ki te haere tonu noho ki muri ranei.

trans-unit.source: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained
trans-unit.target: Nga wairua, kua roaa te reira no te aha, e te mau

trans-unit.source: Except the companions of the right,
trans-unit.target: I kahore nga hoa o te tika,

trans-unit.source: [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
trans-unit.target: [Ko wai e waiho] i roto i nga kari, ui tahi i te tahi

trans-unit.source: About the criminals,
trans-unit.target: Mō te kaimahi kino,

trans-unit.source: [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
trans-unit.target: [A ui ratou], "He aha maka koe ki Saqar?"

trans-unit.source: They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
trans-unit.target: ka mea ratou, "E kore matou o te hunga e inoi,

trans-unit.source: Nor did we used to feed the poor.
trans-unit.target: Kihai matou i whakamahia ki te whangai i te hunga rawakore.

trans-unit.source: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakamahia matou ki te tomo ki nga korero teka noa ki te hunga e rave [i roto i te reira],

trans-unit.source: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakamahia matou ki te whakakahore i te Day o utua

trans-unit.source: Until there came to us the certainty."
trans-unit.target: Tae noa i reira ka haere mai ki a matou te tino. "

trans-unit.source: So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
trans-unit.target: Na e kore i reira e faufaahia ratou i te inoi o [tetahi] kaiwhakaako.

trans-unit.source: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
trans-unit.target: Na he aha te mea [te mea] ki a ratou e te hunga ratou, i te faahaamana'oraa, tahuri atu

trans-unit.source: As if they were alarmed donkeys
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki kaihe ki te koera ratou

trans-unit.source: Fleeing from a lion?
trans-unit.target: Rere ana i te raiona?

trans-unit.source: Rather, every person among them desires that he would be given scriptures spread about.
trans-unit.target: Engari, nga tangata i roto ia ratou hiahia e e kia hoatu e ia mau papa'iraa mo'a horapa e pā ana ki.

trans-unit.source: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Then whoever wills will remember it.
trans-unit.target: Na pai tetahi e mahara reira.

trans-unit.source: And they will not remember except that Allah wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e mahara ratou anake e pai Allah.

trans-unit.source: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
trans-unit.target: oati ahau i te Day o raa

trans-unit.source: And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].
trans-unit.target: A oati ahau e te wairua tawai [ki te tino o te aranga].

trans-unit.source: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
trans-unit.target: E whakaaro te tangata e kore matou e huihuia ana wheua?

trans-unit.source: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
trans-unit.target: Ae.

trans-unit.source: But man desires to continue in sin.
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata e hiahia ki te mau tonu i roto i te hara.

trans-unit.source: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
trans-unit.target: ui ia, "A, no te ko te Day o raa?"

trans-unit.source: So when vision is dazzled
trans-unit.target: Na ka atarua kitenga te

trans-unit.source: And the moon darkens
trans-unit.target: Na whakapouri te marama

trans-unit.source: And the sun and the moon are joined,
trans-unit.target: Na kei te piri te ra me te marama,

trans-unit.source: Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
trans-unit.target: ka mea te tangata ki runga ki taua Day, "Kei hea te [wahi o] mawhiti?"

trans-unit.source: No! There is no refuge.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
trans-unit.target: Ki to koutou Ariki, e Day, ko te [wahi o] vai.

trans-unit.source: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead and kept back.
trans-unit.target: Ka te tangata kia mōhio ai Day o te mea ka tonoa mua ia, ka puritia hoki.

trans-unit.source: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,
trans-unit.target: Engari, te tangata, ki a ia ano, ka riro he kaiwhakaatu,

trans-unit.source: Even if he presents his excuses.
trans-unit.target: Ahakoa, ki te whakaatu ana ia i ona ngatahi.

trans-unit.source: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: kore neke koutou arero ki reira, [e Muhammad], ki te hohoro ki taki o te Qur'an.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ki runga ki a tatou ko tona kohinga [i roto i tou ngakau] me [ki kia taea] ona taki.

trans-unit.source: So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
trans-unit.target: Na, no te Kua taki matou i te reira [i roto i Kapariera], ka whai i ona taki.

trans-unit.source: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
trans-unit.target: Na ka ki a tatou ko tona whakamārama [ki a koutou].

trans-unit.source: No! But you love the immediate
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And leave the Hereafter.
trans-unit.target: Na waiho te ake.

trans-unit.source: [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
trans-unit.target: [Etahi] kanohi, e Day, ka whakamaramatia,

trans-unit.source: Looking at their Lord.
trans-unit.target: Titiro i to ratou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
trans-unit.target: A [etahi] kanohi, e Day, ka kia contorted,

trans-unit.source: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
trans-unit.target: Hua noa e reira kia meatia ki a ratou [te tahi mea] tipuria e.

trans-unit.source: No! When the soul has reached the collar bones
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
trans-unit.target: A kua mea te reira, "Ko wai e whakaora [ia]?"

trans-unit.source: And the dying one is certain that it is the [time of] separation
trans-unit.target: Na te tangata mate he etahi e te mea te [wa o] wehenga

trans-unit.source: And the leg is wound about the leg,
trans-unit.target: Na ka maru ia te huha te e pā ana ki te waewae,

trans-unit.source: To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.
trans-unit.target: Ki to koutou Ariki, e Day, ka hei te tira.

trans-unit.source: And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i whakapono ki te disbeliever, e kore i inoi ia.

trans-unit.source: But [instead], he denied and turned away.
trans-unit.target: Ko [hei utu], ka whakakahore ia, ka tahuri atu.

trans-unit.source: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
trans-unit.target: Na ka haere ia ki tona iwi, swaggering [i roto i te whakapehapeha].

trans-unit.source: Woe to you, and woe!
trans-unit.target: Aue, te mate ki a koutou, me te aue!

trans-unit.source: Then woe to you, and woe!
trans-unit.target: Na Aue ki a koutou, me te aue!

trans-unit.source: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
trans-unit.target: E whakaaro te tangata e ia e kia mahue mahue?

trans-unit.source: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
trans-unit.target: e kore ia i te parāoa purapura moenga i tukuna?

trans-unit.source: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allah] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
trans-unit.target: Na ka ko ia he katinga piri, a [Allah] hanga [tona ahua] ka proportioned [ia]

trans-unit.source: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga o ia rua hoa, te toa me te uha.

trans-unit.source: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
trans-unit.target: He kore e [Kaihanga] nehenehe ki te hoatu ora ki te hunga mate?

trans-unit.source: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
trans-unit.target: I reira [e kore] haere mai i runga i te tangata i te wā o te wā, no te kahore ia he mea [ara] whakahuatia?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, hanga matou te tangata i te ranunga parāoa-maturuturunga iho kia tamata matou ia;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, arahi matou ia ki te ara, kia ia mauruuru e ia ew hakawhetai ranei.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Kua oti matou mo nga mekameka iino me here, me te mura.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, te tangata tika e inu i te kapu [o te waina] tona ranunga he o Kafur,

trans-unit.source: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allah will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
trans-unit.target: He puna o e te [tika] pononga a Allah e inu;

trans-unit.source: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
trans-unit.target: Ratou [ko te hunga e] fakahoko [ratou] taurangi, me te wehi i te Day tona kino, ka kia whānui.

trans-unit.source: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
trans-unit.target: A hoatu ana e ratou te kai i roto i te noa'tu o te aroha mo reira ki te rawakore, te pani, me te whakaraua,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], "We feed you only for the countenance of Allah. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
trans-unit.target: [Mea], "whangai matou ki a koutou anake mo te mata o Allah. Hiahia matou kahore i koutou utu mauruuru ranei.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, wehi matou he Day i to tatou Ariki, uaua, me te ahoaho o. "

trans-unit.source: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
trans-unit.target: Na ka tiaki ratou Allah i te kino o taua Day, me te hoatu ki a ratou maama me te oaoa

trans-unit.source: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
trans-unit.target: A ka utua ratou mo ta ratou whakamanawanui [ki] he kari [i roto i te Paradaiso] me te hiraka [kakahu].

trans-unit.source: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
trans-unit.target: [Ka ratou] noho ki reira i runga i nga whariki whakapaipai.

trans-unit.source: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
trans-unit.target: A tata i runga ratou ko ona tupapaku, me ona [hua] ki kia tangohia e kia tuku iho i roto i te hanganga ture.

trans-unit.source: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
trans-unit.target: A ka ki reira kia huri i roto ia ratou oko o te hiriwa me te kapu ka kua [hanga] mārama [rite karaihe],

trans-unit.source: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
trans-unit.target: Mārama mōhiti [meinga] i hiriwa o e kua whakaritea e ratou te mehua.

trans-unit.source: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
trans-unit.target: A ka hoatu e ratou kia ki te inu i te kapu [o te waina] tona ranunga he o te kanekane

trans-unit.source: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.
trans-unit.target: [I] te puna i roto i te Parataito, ko Salsabeel.

trans-unit.source: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
trans-unit.target: He ka porotītiti i roto ia ratou i hanga tonu mau tamaroa taitamariki.

trans-unit.source: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka titiro koe i reira [i roto i te Parataito], ka kite koe ahuareka, me te nui kingitanga.

trans-unit.source: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
trans-unit.target: Ki runga ki nga tangata, ka hei kakahu matomato o te hiraka pai, me te brocade.

trans-unit.source: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
trans-unit.target: [A ka mea te reira], "Ko e mo'oni, ko tenei hoki koutou he utu, a kua tou kaha i mauruuru."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko reira matou te hunga kua tonoa ki raro ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], riirii te Qur'an.

trans-unit.source: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
trans-unit.target: Na kia manawanui hoki te whakatau a to koutou Ariki, a kore e whakarongo ki i roto ia ratou he tangata hara ranei ew hakawhetai [disbeliever].

trans-unit.source: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
trans-unit.target: Na whakahuatia te ingoa o to koutou Ariki [roto i te pure] ata me te ahiahi

trans-unit.source: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.
trans-unit.target: A i te iho po ki a ia, ka whakanui ia ia he [wahi o te] roa te po.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, [iino] aroha enei te tonu, me te waiho i muri ratou i te urupa Day.

trans-unit.source: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
trans-unit.target: Kua hanga e matou ia ratou, ka whakakaha ratou puka, a ka matou ka, nehenehe tatou e taui i to ratou ahua ki te whakarereke [oti].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, Ko te faahaamana'oraa tenei, kia kia tango i te ara ki tona Ariki ia pai nei.

trans-unit.source: And you do not will except that Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e e kore ai koutou e pai Allah.

trans-unit.source: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Okú ia pai nei ia ki tana mahi tohu;

trans-unit.source: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
trans-unit.target: E te hunga [hau] tonoa atu i roto i te patapata

trans-unit.source: And the winds that blow violently
trans-unit.target: Na whakatangihia nga hau e murua

trans-unit.source: And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
trans-unit.target: A [e] te hau e roha [kapua]

trans-unit.source: And those [angels] who bring criterion
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga [anahera] e kawe mai paearu

trans-unit.source: And those [angels] who deliver a message
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga [anahera] e whakaora i te karere

trans-unit.source: As justification or warning,
trans-unit.target: Rite tika whakatūpato ranei,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he aha e korero koutou he ki te puta.

trans-unit.source: So when the stars are obliterated
trans-unit.target: Na ka e horoi i nga whetu

trans-unit.source: And when the heaven is opened
trans-unit.target: A, no ka tuwhera te rangi te

trans-unit.source: And when the mountains are blown away
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e whakatangihia atu nga maunga

trans-unit.source: And when the messengers' time has come...
trans-unit.target: A, ka tae mai te wa i te karere '...

trans-unit.source: For what Day was it postponed?
trans-unit.target: He aha Day i hiki te reira?

trans-unit.source: For the Day of Judgement.
trans-unit.target: Hoki te Day o whakawa.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea te Day o whakawa?

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
trans-unit.target: kihai ianei matou whakangaro i nga iwi o mua?

trans-unit.source: Then We will follow them with the later ones.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whai matou ratou ki nga mea i muri mai.

trans-unit.source: Thus do We deal with the criminals.
trans-unit.target: Ko te kupu e tatou mahi ki nga kaimahi kino.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
trans-unit.target: kihai ianei matou te hanga koe i te wai uru?

trans-unit.source: And We placed it in a firm lodging
trans-unit.target: A whakanohoia matou i te reira i roto i te whare tira u

trans-unit.source: For a known extent.
trans-unit.target: Hoki te whānuitanga mohiotia.

trans-unit.source: And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
trans-unit.target: Na ka takoto matou [i te reira], a pai [e tatou] ki te whakatau.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: Have We not made the earth a container
trans-unit.target: e kore i tatou i hanga te whenua he ipu

trans-unit.source: Of the living and the dead?
trans-unit.target: O te ora, me te hunga mate?

trans-unit.source: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakanohoia e matou ki reira tiketike, mau whakaturia maunga, kua hoatu ki te inu i te wai reka koe.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
trans-unit.target: [Ka korerotia ki ratou], "Puta ki taua i whakamahia e koe ki te whakakahore.

trans-unit.source: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns
trans-unit.target: Puta ki te atarangi [o te paowa] he toru tīwae

trans-unit.source: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
trans-unit.target: [Ko ia] kahore atarangi matao, me te kore e te faaere ia ki te mura. "

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ka taia te reira korakora [rite nui] ano he pa,

trans-unit.source: As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki te mea ratou kowhai [mangu] kamera.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: This is a Day they will not speak,
trans-unit.target: Ko te Day kore ratou e korero tenei,

trans-unit.source: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
trans-unit.target: E kore ka tukua te reira mo ki a ratou te hanga i te kupu whakahoki.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
trans-unit.target: Ko te Day o whakawa tenei;

trans-unit.source: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
trans-unit.target: Na, ki te whai koe i te mahere, ka whakamahere ki ahau.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka waiho i te tika i roto i atarangi me puna

trans-unit.source: And fruits from whatever they desire,
trans-unit.target: A hua e hiahia ana ratou i nga mea katoa,

trans-unit.source: [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: [He korerotia], "E kai, e inu i roto i te utu mo te mea i whakamahia e koe ki te mahi i."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, tatou te kupu utu nga kaimahi o te pai.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
trans-unit.target: [E iino], kai me te pārekareka ki koutou he iti;

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te mea te reira ki a ratou, "Kia piko [i roto i te pure]," e kore ratou e koropiko.

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers.

trans-unit.source: Then in what statement after the Qur'an will they believe?
trans-unit.target: Na i roto i te aha tauākī i muri i te Qur'an ratou e whakapono?

trans-unit.source: About what are they asking one another?
trans-unit.target: Mō te mea e tono ana ratou tetahi ki tetahi?

trans-unit.source: About the great news -
trans-unit.target: Mō te rongo nui -

trans-unit.source: That over which they are in disagreement.
trans-unit.target: Ko runga i e te hunga ratou i roto i te tautohe.

trans-unit.source: No! They are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Then, no! They are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Na, kahore!

trans-unit.source: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
trans-unit.target: e kore i tatou i hanga te whenua he wahi noho?

trans-unit.source: And the mountains as stakes?
trans-unit.target: Na nga maunga ano tĭtĭ?

trans-unit.source: And We created you in pairs
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e matou ki a koutou i roto i takirua

trans-unit.source: And made your sleep [a means for] rest
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga tou moe [he tikanga mo] okiokinga

trans-unit.source: And made the night as clothing
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga te po ano kakahu

trans-unit.source: And made the day for livelihood
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga te ra mo te oranga

trans-unit.source: And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
trans-unit.target: Na ka hangaia i runga koe e whitu kaha [rangi]

trans-unit.source: And made [therein] a burning lamp
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga [reira] te rama e

trans-unit.source: And sent down, from the rain clouds, pouring water
trans-unit.target: Na ka tonoa iho, i te kapua ua, wai ringihia

trans-unit.source: That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation
trans-unit.target: Kia puta mai i matou reira witi me te otaota

trans-unit.source: And gardens of entwined growth.
trans-unit.target: Na kari o tupu Kapi tonu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, te Day o whakawa ko te wa i whakaritea -

trans-unit.source: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes
trans-unit.target: whakatangihia te Day te Horn te a ka haere mai koe mai i roto i te hui i

trans-unit.source: And the heaven is opened and will become gateways
trans-unit.target: Na ka tuwhera te rangi, me te ka riro kuwaha

trans-unit.source: And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.
trans-unit.target: Na ko tangohia nga maunga, a ka waiho [engari] te mumura.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, te reinga i takoto kua whanga i roto i

trans-unit.source: For the transgressors, a place of return,
trans-unit.target: Mo nga poka ke, he wahi o te hoki mai,

trans-unit.source: In which they will remain for ages [unending].
trans-unit.target: I roto i te e ka noho ratou mo ake [tonu].

trans-unit.source: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e pangia e reira [tetahi] rata ranei inu

trans-unit.source: Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -
trans-unit.target: Te kore wai, me te [poke] purulence scalding -

trans-unit.source: An appropriate recompense.
trans-unit.target: He utu e tika ana.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they were not expecting an account
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, e kore i te tatari ratou i te pūkete

trans-unit.source: And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore tatou irava ki te whakakāhoretanga [i here].

trans-unit.source: But all things We have enumerated in writing.
trans-unit.target: Ko nga mea katoa i faahiti tatou i roto i te tuhituhi.

trans-unit.source: "So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."
trans-unit.target: "Na te reka o [te utu], a kore e whakanui i matou ki a koutou anake i roto i te mamae."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, for the righteous is attainment -
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, no te te tika ko te whiwhinga -

trans-unit.source: Gardens and grapevines
trans-unit.target: Gardens me waina

trans-unit.source: And full-breasted [companions] of equal age
trans-unit.target: A ki tonu i-breasted [hoa] o rite tau

trans-unit.source: And a full cup.
trans-unit.target: Na te kapu tonu.

trans-unit.source: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -
trans-unit.target: No kupu kino ka rongo ratou ki reira tetahi teka ranei -

trans-unit.source: [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,
trans-unit.target: [Ka rite] utu i to koutou Ariki, [he ohaoha] homai [hanga e tika ana i] pūkete,

trans-unit.source: [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.
trans-unit.target: [I] te Ariki o nga rangi, me te whenua, me te mea kei waenganui ia ratou, te aroha Rawa.

trans-unit.source: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.
trans-unit.target: Te Day e ka tu i te Wairua, me te anahera i roto i te rarangi, e kore ratou e korero te kahore hoki tetahi e te tukua e te nuinga o aroha, a ka mea ia te mea he tika.

trans-unit.source: That is the True Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.
trans-unit.target: E ko te Day mau;

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have warned you of a near punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Kua fakatokanga matou ki a koutou o te whiu e tata ana i runga i te Day ina ka mau te tangata te mea i totoro ona ringa, a ka mea te disbeliever, "Aue, e hiahia ana ahau i ahau puehu!"

trans-unit.source: By those [angels] who extract with violence
trans-unit.target: E te hunga [anahera] e unu ki te tutu

trans-unit.source: And [by] those who remove with ease
trans-unit.target: A [e te] te hunga e tango ki humarie

trans-unit.source: And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming
trans-unit.target: A [e te] te hunga e ngoki ana [me te mea] kauhoe

trans-unit.source: And those who race each other in a race
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakataetae tahi i te tahi i roto i te iwi

trans-unit.source: And those who arrange [each] matter,
trans-unit.target: Na te hunga e whakarite [ia] mea,

trans-unit.source: On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
trans-unit.target: I runga i te Day te hau [o te Horn] e convulse [hanga],

trans-unit.source: There will follow it the subsequent [one].
trans-unit.target: He ka whai reira te [tetahi] muri.

trans-unit.source: Hearts, that Day, will tremble,
trans-unit.target: Ngakau, e Day, ka wiri,

trans-unit.source: Their eyes humbled.
trans-unit.target: whakaiti ratou kanohi.

trans-unit.source: They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
trans-unit.target: Ratou e [wawetia] mea, "E matou kia hoki ki [to tatou] āhua [o te ora] mua?

trans-unit.source: Even if we should be decayed bones?
trans-unit.target: Ahakoa, ki te kia tatou wheua pirau?

trans-unit.source: They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."
trans-unit.target: mea ratou, "E, ka, e kia he hoki ngaro."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it will be but one shout,
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka waiho ko tetahi hamama,

trans-unit.source: And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
trans-unit.target: Na ka pa whakarere ka waiho ratou [mataara] ki runga ki te mata o te whenua.

trans-unit.source: Has there reached you the story of Moses? -
trans-unit.target: Kua reira tae koutou te aamu o Mohi?

trans-unit.source: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
trans-unit.target: A, no te ka karanga tona Ariki ki a ia i roto i te raorao mo'a o Tuwa,

trans-unit.source: "Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
trans-unit.target: "Haere ki a Parao. Oia mau, i takahi i.

trans-unit.source: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
trans-unit.target: A ka mea ki a ia, '[e pai ki] pure koe E koe

trans-unit.source: And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
trans-unit.target: Na kia ārahi ahau koutou ki to koutou Ariki kia e wehi koe [ia]? ' "

trans-unit.source: And he showed him the greatest sign,
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakitea e ia ki a ia te tohu nui,

trans-unit.source: But Pharaoh denied and disobeyed.
trans-unit.target: Otira ka whakakahore a Parao, a talangata'a.

trans-unit.source: Then he turned his back, striving.
trans-unit.target: Na ka tahuri ia tona tuara, e tohe nei.

trans-unit.source: And he gathered [his people] and called out
trans-unit.target: Na ka huihuia e ia [tona iwi], ka huaina i roto i

trans-unit.source: And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea, "Ko ahau to koutou ariki faateiteihia tino."

trans-unit.source: So Allah seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].
trans-unit.target: Na mau Allah ia i roto i te whiu hi'oraa maitai no te whakamutunga, me te [poka ke] tuatahi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a warning for whoever would fear [Allah].
trans-unit.target: Oia mau i roto i taua ko te whakatūpato hoki te tangata e wehi [Allah].

trans-unit.source: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? Allah constructed it.
trans-unit.target: Ko koe te hanga uaua ake ranei ko te rangi?

trans-unit.source: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
trans-unit.target: whakaarahia e ia tona tuanui, a proportioned reira.

trans-unit.source: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.
trans-unit.target: Na ka pouri ia ona po, ka tangohia tona tiahotanga.

trans-unit.source: And after that He spread the earth.
trans-unit.target: A, muri iho i horahia e ia te whenua.

trans-unit.source: He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
trans-unit.target: tango ia i reira tona wai, me ona wahi kai,

trans-unit.source: And the mountains He set firmly
trans-unit.target: Na nga maunga whakaturia mau ia

trans-unit.source: As provision for you and your grazing livestock.
trans-unit.target: Ka rite ki whakaratonga mo koutou, me a koutou kararehe karaihe.

trans-unit.source: But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity -
trans-unit.target: Otira, no te reira mai te aitua teimaha rahi -

trans-unit.source: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
trans-unit.target: Te Day ka e mahara te tangata e hoki i whawhai ana ia,

trans-unit.source: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
trans-unit.target: A ka kitea po auahi no te [katoa] te hunga e kite -

trans-unit.source: So as for he who transgressed
trans-unit.target: Na rite hoki ia te tangata he

trans-unit.source: And preferred the life of the world,
trans-unit.target: Na pai te ora o te ao,

trans-unit.source: Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.
trans-unit.target: Na pono, ka hei po auahi [tona] piringa.

trans-unit.source: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki ia i wehi i te tūranga o tana Ariki, a haukotia te wairua i te tokonga ake [tika],

trans-unit.source: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
trans-unit.target: Na pono, ka hei Pararaiha [tona] piringa.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?
trans-unit.target: ui ana ratou koutou, [e Muhammad], e pā ana ki te Hour: ka ko tona taenga?

trans-unit.source: In what [position] are you that you should mention it?
trans-unit.target: I roto i ta [tūranga] ko koe e kia whakahua ia koutou i te reira?

trans-unit.source: To your Lord is its finality.
trans-unit.target: Ki to koutou Ariki, ko tona poro.

trans-unit.source: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
trans-unit.target: Ko te Warner anake mo te hunga e wehi ana i te reira e koe.

trans-unit.source: It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
trans-unit.target: ka riro te reira, i runga i te Day ratou e kite i reira, me te mea ratou kihai i noho [i roto i te ao] anake hoki te ahiahi he ata ona ranei.

trans-unit.source: The Prophet frowned and turned away
trans-unit.target: frowned te Peropheta e tahuri atu

trans-unit.source: Because there came to him the blind man, [interrupting].
trans-unit.target: No te mea i reira ka haere mai ki a ia te tangata matapo, [tape'ai].

trans-unit.source: But what would make you perceive, [O Muhammad], that perhaps he might be purified
trans-unit.target: Ko te aha e hanga kite koutou, [e Muhammad], e pea ia ai kia purea

trans-unit.source: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
trans-unit.target: Ranei kia fakamanatu a e hua i te mahara ki a ia?

trans-unit.source: As for he who thinks himself without need,
trans-unit.target: Rite hoki ia te tangata e whakaaro ia kahore he hiahia,

trans-unit.source: To him you give attention.
trans-unit.target: hoatu koe whakarongo ki a ia.

trans-unit.source: And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.
trans-unit.target: A kahore ki a koutou [he whakahenga tetahi] ki te kore e te pure ia.

trans-unit.source: But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki ia te tangata e haere mai ki a koutou e tohe [mo te matauranga]

trans-unit.source: While he fears [Allah],
trans-unit.target: I wehi ia [Allah],

trans-unit.source: From him you are distracted.
trans-unit.target: Mai i ia e raruraru koe.

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, these verses are a reminder;
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: So whoever wills may remember it.
trans-unit.target: Na pai te tangata e mahara i te reira.

trans-unit.source: [It is recorded] in honored sheets,
trans-unit.target: [Kei te tuhituhi te reira i] i roto i ngā rau whakahonoretia,

trans-unit.source: Exalted and purified,
trans-unit.target: Whakanuia a e purea ana,

trans-unit.source: [Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
trans-unit.target: [Kawea i] i te ringa o te karere-anahera,

trans-unit.source: Noble and dutiful.
trans-unit.target: Noble me haunga.

trans-unit.source: Cursed is man; how disbelieving is he.
trans-unit.target: Kanga te tangata;

trans-unit.source: From what substance did He create him?
trans-unit.target: Mai te aha taonga i hanga e ia ki a ia?

trans-unit.source: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;
trans-unit.target: Mai i te parāoa-te maturuturunga iho i hanga e ia ki a ia, a mo te a ia;

trans-unit.source: Then He eased the way for him;
trans-unit.target: Katahi ia mama te ara hoki ki a ia;

trans-unit.source: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.
trans-unit.target: Na ka meinga e ia tana mate, me te whakarato i te urupa mo ia.

trans-unit.source: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
trans-unit.target: Na ka pai ia, e fokotu'u ia ia.

trans-unit.source: No! Man has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Then let mankind look at his food -
trans-unit.target: Na kia titiro te taata i tona kai -

trans-unit.source: How We poured down water in torrents,
trans-unit.target: Kia pehea te ringihia e matou ki raro wai i roto i waipuke,

trans-unit.source: Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
trans-unit.target: Na ka wahia e matou whakatuwhera te whenua, wāwāhi [te reira ki te tupu],

trans-unit.source: And caused to grow within it grain
trans-unit.target: Na ka meinga ki te tupu i roto i te witi reira

trans-unit.source: And grapes and herbage
trans-unit.target: Na karepe me otaota

trans-unit.source: And olive and palm trees
trans-unit.target: Me te oriwa me te nikau

trans-unit.source: And gardens of dense shrubbery
trans-unit.target: Na kari o rākau mātotoru

trans-unit.source: And fruit and grass -
trans-unit.target: Me te hua me te tarutaru -

trans-unit.source: [As] enjoyment for you and your grazing livestock.
trans-unit.target: [Ka rite] oaoaraa mo koutou, me a koutou kararehe karaihe.

trans-unit.source: But when there comes the Deafening Blast
trans-unit.target: Otira, no te reira mai te hau auē

trans-unit.source: On the Day a man will flee from his brother
trans-unit.target: I runga i te Day ka rere te tangata i tona teina

trans-unit.source: And his mother and his father
trans-unit.target: Na tona whaea me tona papa

trans-unit.source: And his wife and his children,
trans-unit.target: Na tana wahine, me ana tamariki,

trans-unit.source: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.
trans-unit.target: Mo nga tangata, e Day, ka waiho hei mea rawaka hoki ia.

trans-unit.source: [Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
trans-unit.target: [Etahi] kanohi, e Day, ka kia kanapa -

trans-unit.source: Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
trans-unit.target: Kata, koa i rongo pai.

trans-unit.source: And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
trans-unit.target: A ka whai [atu] kanohi, e Day, ki runga ki a ratou puehu.

trans-unit.source: Blackness will cover them.
trans-unit.target: ka hipokina ratou kerekere.

trans-unit.source: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko nga iino, te hunga kino.

trans-unit.source: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
trans-unit.target: A, no te te takai i te ra ake [i roto i te pouri]

trans-unit.source: And when the stars fall, dispersing,
trans-unit.target: A, no ka taka nga whetu, Horo atu,

trans-unit.source: And when the mountains are removed
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e tangohia nga maunga

trans-unit.source: And when full-term she-camels are neglected
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e mahue wā-tonu ia-kamera

trans-unit.source: And when the wild beasts are gathered
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e huihui nga kararehe mohoao

trans-unit.source: And when the seas are filled with flame
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e ki tonu nga moana te mura

trans-unit.source: And when the souls are paired
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e takirua nga wairua

trans-unit.source: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
trans-unit.target: A, no ka ui te kotiro [nei ko] tanumia ora te

trans-unit.source: For what sin she was killed
trans-unit.target: He aha hoki te hara i patua ia

trans-unit.source: And when the pages are made public
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e hanga nga whārangi tūmatanui

trans-unit.source: And when the sky is stripped away
trans-unit.target: A, no ka huia atu te rangi te

trans-unit.source: And when Hellfire is set ablaze
trans-unit.target: A, ka te whakatakotoria e toro po auahi

trans-unit.source: And when Paradise is brought near,
trans-unit.target: A, no ka Pararaiha tata kawea te,

trans-unit.source: A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].
trans-unit.target: He wairua ka [katahi] mohio he aha kua kawea mai te reira [ki reira].

trans-unit.source: So I swear by the retreating stars -
trans-unit.target: Na oati ahau e nga whetu whati -

trans-unit.source: Those that run [their courses] and disappear -
trans-unit.target: Te hunga e rere [ratou akoranga] ka ngaro -

trans-unit.source: And by the night as it closes in
trans-unit.target: A i te po ano kati te reira i roto i

trans-unit.source: And by the dawn when it breathes
trans-unit.target: A i te ata, ka whai manawa reira

trans-unit.source: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger
trans-unit.target: [Ko] pono, te Qur'an ko te kupu [i kawea atu e] te karere pai

trans-unit.source: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
trans-unit.target: [Ko wai te] nohoia o te mana, me te ki te Rangatira o te torona, te mau [i roto i te tūranga],

trans-unit.source: Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
trans-unit.target: I rongo i reira [i roto i te rangi], me te pono.

trans-unit.source: And your companion is not [at all] mad.
trans-unit.target: A ko kore [i katoa] haurangi tou hoa.

trans-unit.source: And he has already seen Gabriel in the clear horizon.
trans-unit.target: Na kua kite kē ia Kapariera i te pae mārama.

trans-unit.source: And Muhammad is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.
trans-unit.target: A kahore he Muhammad te withholder o [te matauranga o] te kitea.

trans-unit.source: And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
trans-unit.target: A kahore he te kupu a te rewera, peia [i te rangi] te Qur'an.

trans-unit.source: So where are you going?
trans-unit.target: Na e haere ana koe ki hea?

trans-unit.source: It is not except a reminder to the worlds
trans-unit.target: e kore te kore ai te reira i te whakamahara ki te ao

trans-unit.source: For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
trans-unit.target: Hoki pai tetahi i roto ia koutou ki te tango i te akoranga e tika ana.

trans-unit.source: And you do not will except that Allah wills - Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e e kore ai koutou e pai Allah - te Ariki o nga ao.

trans-unit.source: When the sky breaks apart
trans-unit.target: A, no te wawahi te rangi motu

trans-unit.source: And when the stars fall, scattering,
trans-unit.target: A, no ka taka nga whetu, apuhau,

trans-unit.source: And when the seas are erupted
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e te pahųtanga o nga moana

trans-unit.source: And when the [contents of] graves are scattered,
trans-unit.target: A, no ka e marara noa te [tirotiro o] urupa,

trans-unit.source: A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.
trans-unit.target: He wairua ka [katahi] mohio he aha kua hoatu te reira mai, ka puritia hoki.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
trans-unit.target: E te huitaata, he aha kua tinihanga koe mo tou Ariki, te te aroha,

trans-unit.source: Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?
trans-unit.target: Ko wai i hanga koe, proportioned koe, a ka whärite koe?

trans-unit.source: In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.
trans-unit.target: I roto i nga mea katoa puka pai ia kua huihui ia koutou.

trans-unit.source: No! But you deny the Recompense.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,
trans-unit.target: A pono, [whakaritea] mo he kaitiaki koe,

trans-unit.source: Noble and recording;
trans-unit.target: Noble me te tuhi;

trans-unit.source: They know whatever you do.
trans-unit.target: e matau ana ratou mea katoa te mahi koe.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka hei te tangata tika i roto i te pai ai,

trans-unit.source: And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: A pono, ka hei te hunga kino i roto i po auahi.

trans-unit.source: They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
trans-unit.target: Ka ratou [tomo ki] tahu reira i runga i te Day o e utua,

trans-unit.source: And never therefrom will they be absent.
trans-unit.target: A e kore reira ka ngaro ratou.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea te Day o utua?

trans-unit.source: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
trans-unit.target: Na, he aha ka taea e kia mohio koe he aha te mea te Day o utua?

trans-unit.source: It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allah.
trans-unit.target: Ko te reira i te Day, no te kore e riro i te wairua mo tetahi wairua [ki te mana mahi] he mea;

trans-unit.source: Woe to those who give less [than due],
trans-unit.target: Aue te mate mo te hunga e hoatu iti [i te tika],

trans-unit.source: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai, ka tangohia e ratou i te mehua i te iwi, tangohia i roto i te ki tonu i.

trans-unit.source: But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
trans-unit.target: Otiia, ki te hoatu e ratou i te mehua pauna ki a ratou ranei, meinga ratou mate.

trans-unit.source: Do they not think that they will be resurrected
trans-unit.target: e kore ratou e whakaaro ai e toetu'u ratou

trans-unit.source: For a tremendous Day -
trans-unit.target: Hoki te ra nui -

trans-unit.source: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
trans-unit.target: Te Day ka e tu te tangata ki te aroaro o te Ariki o nga ao?

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea sijjeen?

trans-unit.source: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed.
trans-unit.target: Ko te tuhituhi rēhita [tuhia i roto i to ratou ūnga].

trans-unit.source: Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
trans-unit.target: Aue, e Day, ki nga deniers,

trans-unit.source: Who deny the Day of Recompense.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai whakakahore i te Day o utua.

trans-unit.source: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
trans-unit.target: A kahore whakakahore reira anake nga tangata hara hara.

trans-unit.source: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: A, no te e karakia tatou irava ki a ia, e ai ta ia, "Legends o nga iwi o mua."

trans-unit.source: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Na pono, ka ratou [tomo a] tahu i roto i te po auahi.

trans-unit.source: Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea te reira [ki a ratou], "Ko te mea tenei i whakamahia koe ki te whakakahore."

trans-unit.source: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyun.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is 'illiyyun?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea kia mohio koutou te mea kei te 'illiyyun?

trans-unit.source: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed
trans-unit.target: Te reira i te [ratou ūnga tuhia i roto i te] tuhituhi te pukapuka

trans-unit.source: Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: ite nei e te hunga kawea tata [ki Allah].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka hei te tika i roto i te pai ai

trans-unit.source: On adorned couches, observing.
trans-unit.target: I te whariki whakapaipai, te mātakitaki.

trans-unit.source: You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
trans-unit.target: ka mohio koe i roto i o ratou mata ki te kanapatanga o te pai ai.

trans-unit.source: They will be given to drink [pure] wine [which was] sealed.
trans-unit.target: ka hoatu kia ratou ki te inu [parakore] waina [i] hiri.

trans-unit.source: The last of it is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
trans-unit.target: Te whakamutunga o te reira he musk.

trans-unit.source: And its mixture is of Tasneem,
trans-unit.target: Na ko tona ranunga o Tasneem,

trans-unit.source: A spring from which those near [to Allah] drink.
trans-unit.target: He puna i nei te hunga e tata ana [ki Allah] inu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, whakamahia te hunga e tukua hara ki te kata i te hunga e whakapono.

trans-unit.source: And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka haere ratou i a ratou, e taui ratou kamo pūhohe.

trans-unit.source: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
trans-unit.target: A, no ka hoki mai ratou ki o ratou iwi, e hoki mai ratou maminga.

trans-unit.source: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
trans-unit.target: A, i to ratou kitenga ia ratou, e mea ratou, "Ko e mo'oni, te hunga e pono ngaro."

trans-unit.source: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.
trans-unit.target: Otiia kihai i tonoa e ratou hei kaitiaki mo ratou.

trans-unit.source: So Today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
trans-unit.target: Na teie mahana te hunga e whakapono e kata i te iino,

trans-unit.source: On adorned couches, observing.
trans-unit.target: I te whariki whakapaipai, te mātakitaki.

trans-unit.source: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: Kua nga iino [kore] i utu [tenei Day] hoki ta ratou whakamahia ki te mahi?

trans-unit.source: When the sky has split [open]
trans-unit.target: A, no te kua wahia te rangi [whakatuwhera]

trans-unit.source: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
trans-unit.target: Na kua pahono ki tona Ariki, a titauhia [ki rave i te reira]

trans-unit.source: And when the earth has been extended
trans-unit.target: A, ka kua oti atu te whenua

trans-unit.source: And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it]
trans-unit.target: Na kua akiritia atu e roto te reira, ka tukuange [te reira]

trans-unit.source: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -
trans-unit.target: Na kua pahono ki tona Ariki, a titauhia [ki rave i te reira] -

trans-unit.source: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet it.
trans-unit.target: E te taata, pono e mahi koe ki tou Ariki ki te oma [nui] a ka tutaki i te reira.

trans-unit.source: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
trans-unit.target: Na ka rite ki hoki ia kua homai nei tona lekooti i tona ringa matau,

trans-unit.source: He will be judged with an easy account
trans-unit.target: ka whakawakia ia ki te pūkete ngāwari

trans-unit.source: And return to his people in happiness.
trans-unit.target: A ka hoki atu ki tona iwi i roto i te oaoa.

trans-unit.source: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki ia kua homai nei tona record muri tona tuara,

trans-unit.source: He will cry out for destruction
trans-unit.target: ka karanga ia i roto i mo te whakangaro

trans-unit.source: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
trans-unit.target: A [tomo ki] tahu i roto i te Blaze.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, i ia i roto i tona iwi i roto i te oaoa [kotahi];

trans-unit.source: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, i whakaaro ia e kore ia e hoki mai [ki Allah].

trans-unit.source: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever of him, Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Ko ae!

trans-unit.source: So I swear by the twilight glow
trans-unit.target: Na oati ahau i te tīrama ahiahi

trans-unit.source: And [by] the night and what it envelops
trans-unit.target: A [i] te po, me te aha haati te reira

trans-unit.source: And [by] the moon when it becomes full
trans-unit.target: A [e] te marama, ka riro te reira ki tonu

trans-unit.source: [That] you will surely experience state after state.
trans-unit.target: [E] e pono ite koe kāwanatanga i muri kāwanatanga.

trans-unit.source: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,
trans-unit.target: Na he aha te mea [te mea] ki a ratou [e] kore ratou e whakapono,

trans-unit.source: And when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah]?
trans-unit.target: A, no te te karakia te Qur'an ki a ratou, e kore ratou e koropiko [ki Allah]?

trans-unit.source: But those who have disbelieved deny,
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga e kua whakapono whakakahore,

trans-unit.source: And Allah is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
trans-unit.target: A he mohio rawa o ta pupuri ratou i roto ia ratou Allah.

trans-unit.source: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,
trans-unit.target: Na hoatu ratou rongo o te whiu mauiui,

trans-unit.source: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore hoki te hunga e whakapono ana, ka mahi mahi tika.

trans-unit.source: By the sky containing great stars
trans-unit.target: E te rangi kei roto whetu nui

trans-unit.source: And [by] the promised Day
trans-unit.target: A [e] te Day fafauhia

trans-unit.source: And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
trans-unit.target: A [e] te ite i te kaiwhakaatu, a he aha,

trans-unit.source: Cursed were the companions of the trench
trans-unit.target: Kanga ko nga hoa o te waikeri

trans-unit.source: [Containing] the fire full of fuel,
trans-unit.target: [Kei roto] te ahi ki tonu i te wahie,

trans-unit.source: When they were sitting near it
trans-unit.target: A, no ka noho tata reira ratou

trans-unit.source: And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses.
trans-unit.target: Na ratou, ki te mea i ratou mahi ki nga teina, he kaiwhakaatu.

trans-unit.source: And they resented them not except because they believed in Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,
trans-unit.target: A kihai au ore ratou ia ratou anake no ratou i whakapono i Allah, te whakanuia i roto i te Kaha, te whakamoemiti,

trans-unit.source: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allah, over all things, is Witness.
trans-unit.target: Ki nei no te kawanatanga o nga rangi, me te whenua.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have tortured the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka whai i te whiu o te reinga te hunga e kua whakamamaetia nga tangata whakapono me nga wahine whakapono, a kihai i ka puta ke, a ka te whiu o te Weranga Fire to ratou.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka whai te hunga kua whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika māra raro e rere awa.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the vengeance of your Lord is severe.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he nui te utu o to koutou Ariki.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko reira ia te tangata e mei [hanga] me tāruaruatanga.

trans-unit.source: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
trans-unit.target: Na ko ia te e fakamolemolé, te aroha,

trans-unit.source: Honorable Owner of the Throne,
trans-unit.target: Whakahonoretia Rangatira o te torona,

trans-unit.source: Effecter of what He intends.
trans-unit.target: Effecter o te mea e hiahia ana ia.

trans-unit.source: Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -
trans-unit.target: Kua reira tae koutou te aamu o te hoia -

trans-unit.source: [Those of] Pharaoh and Thamud?
trans-unit.target: [Te hunga o] Parao me Thamud?

trans-unit.source: But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,
trans-unit.target: Ko ratou te hunga whakateka kei roto i te whakakāhoretanga [tamau],

trans-unit.source: While Allah encompasses them from behind.
trans-unit.target: Ahakoa karapoti ratou Allah i muri.

trans-unit.source: But this is an honored Qur'an
trans-unit.target: Ko ko he kororia Qur'an tenei

trans-unit.source: [Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.
trans-unit.target: [Tohi'i] i roto i te Slate Preserved.

trans-unit.source: By the sky and the night comer -
trans-unit.target: Na roto i te rangi, me te tauhou po -

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the night comer?
