trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea i te tauhou po?

trans-unit.source: It is the piercing star -
trans-unit.target: Ko te reira i te whetu werohanga -

trans-unit.source: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
trans-unit.target: Kahore he wairua engari e te mea i runga i te reira i te paruru.

trans-unit.source: So let man observe from what he was created.
trans-unit.target: Na kia te tangata mau i te mea i hanga e ia.

trans-unit.source: He was created from a fluid, ejected,
trans-unit.target: I hanga e ia i te inu, tuha,

trans-unit.source: Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
trans-unit.target: Puta i waenganui i te tapahanga me te rara.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Allah, ki te hoki mai ia [ki te ora], he nehenehe.

trans-unit.source: The Day when secrets will be put on trial,
trans-unit.target: Te Day ka ina kia hoatu ngaro i runga i te tamataraa,

trans-unit.source: Then man will have no power or any helper.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whai tangata kahore mana tetahi kaiawhina ranei.

trans-unit.source: By the sky which returns [rain]
trans-unit.target: E te rangi e hoki [ua]

trans-unit.source: And [by] the earth which cracks open,
trans-unit.target: A [e] te whenua i tuwhera kapiti,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, te Qur'an ko te tauākī whakatakotoria,

trans-unit.source: And it is not amusement.
trans-unit.target: A ehara i te mea faaoaoaraa.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they are planning a plan,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, kei te whakamahere ratou he mahere,

trans-unit.source: But I am planning a plan.
trans-unit.target: Ko ahau te whakamahere ahau he mahere.

trans-unit.source: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.
trans-unit.target: Na tukua te wā mo te iino.

trans-unit.source: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
trans-unit.target: Whakanuia te ingoa o to koutou Ariki, te Runga Rawa,

trans-unit.source: Who created and proportioned
trans-unit.target: Ko wai i hanga, me te proportioned

trans-unit.source: And who destined and [then] guided
trans-unit.target: A ko wai faataahia me [ka] tataki

trans-unit.source: And who brings out the pasture
trans-unit.target: A e whakaputa i te wahi kai

trans-unit.source: And [then] makes it black stubble.
trans-unit.target: A [Na] hanga te reira kakau witi pango.

trans-unit.source: We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,
trans-unit.target: Ka hanga e matou te taki koe, [e Muhammad], a kore koutou e wareware ki,

trans-unit.source: Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore he aha e Allah pai.

trans-unit.source: And We will ease you toward ease.
trans-unit.target: A ka whai mamatanga matou ki a koutou ki humarie.

trans-unit.source: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;
trans-unit.target: Na whakamahara, ki te kia hua te whakamaumahara;

trans-unit.source: He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Ia te tangata e wehi ana [Allah] ka e fakamanatu.

trans-unit.source: But the wretched one will avoid it -
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata waikorohuhu e karo reira -

trans-unit.source: [He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,
trans-unit.target: [Ia] ko wai e [tomo a] tahu i roto i te ahi rahi,

trans-unit.source: Neither dying therein nor living.
trans-unit.target: E kore mate ki reira e kore ora.

trans-unit.source: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
trans-unit.target: Kua tino i muri ia te tangata e tahia ia

trans-unit.source: And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
trans-unit.target: Na faahiti te ingoa o tona Ariki, me inoi.

trans-unit.source: But you prefer the worldly life,
trans-unit.target: Ko koutou hiahia te ora te ao,

trans-unit.source: While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
trans-unit.target: Ahakoa te ake he pai, me te ake pumau tonu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, Ko roto i te mau papa'iraa mo'a o mua tenei,

trans-unit.source: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
trans-unit.target: Te mau papa'iraa a Aperahama, me te a Mohi.

trans-unit.source: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
trans-unit.target: Kua reira tae koutou te pūrongo o te [hui] rutaki?

trans-unit.source: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
trans-unit.target: [Etahi] kanohi, e Day, ka whakaititia,

trans-unit.source: Working [hard] and exhausted.
trans-unit.target: Mahi [pakeke] me ruha.

trans-unit.source: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
trans-unit.target: Ka ratou [tomo ki] tahu i roto i te ahi puai wera.

trans-unit.source: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
trans-unit.target: ka hoatu ratou inu i te puna koropupu ana.

trans-unit.source: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
trans-unit.target: Hoki ratou i reira e kore kai i te paitini, te tipu tataramoa anake

trans-unit.source: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
trans-unit.target: E kore e atawhai ranei tauhi'anga ki te kai.

trans-unit.source: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
trans-unit.target: [Ētahi] anga, e Day, ka whakaatu i pai ai.

trans-unit.source: With their effort [they are] satisfied
trans-unit.target: Me to ratou kaha [he ratou] makona

trans-unit.source: In an elevated garden,
trans-unit.target: I roto i te kari teitei,

trans-unit.source: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.
trans-unit.target: Ai e rongo ratou kahore kupu kāore.

trans-unit.source: Within it is a flowing spring.
trans-unit.target: I roto i te reira ko te puna rere.

trans-unit.source: Within it are couches raised high
trans-unit.target: I roto i E whakaarahia tiketike reira nga whariki

trans-unit.source: And cups put in place
trans-unit.target: A hoatu kapu i roto i te wahi

trans-unit.source: And cushions lined up
trans-unit.target: Na kapi ana urunga

trans-unit.source: And carpets spread around.
trans-unit.target: Na ka horahia a tawhio noa whariki.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
trans-unit.target: Na e kore e ratou titiro i nga kamera - pehea e hanga e ratou?

trans-unit.source: And at the sky - how it is raised?
trans-unit.target: A i te rangi - me pehea e whakaarahia?

trans-unit.source: And at the mountains - how they are erected?
trans-unit.target: A i nga maunga - pehea e whakaturia ratou?

trans-unit.source: And at the earth - how it is spread out?
trans-unit.target: Na i te whenua - me pehea te horapa i roto i?

trans-unit.source: So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.
trans-unit.target: Na whakamahara, [e Muhammad];

trans-unit.source: You are not over them a controller.
trans-unit.target: E kore e koe i runga i a ratou i te pūmana.

trans-unit.source: However, he who turns away and disbelieves -
trans-unit.target: Heoi, ia te tangata e tahuri atu, me te whakapono -

trans-unit.source: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whiua ia e Allah ki te whiu nui.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, to Us is their return.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ki Us he hoki ratou.

trans-unit.source: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
trans-unit.target: Na pono, ki a tatou ko to ratou pūkete.

trans-unit.source: By the dawn
trans-unit.target: E te ata

trans-unit.source: And [by] ten nights
trans-unit.target: A [e] tekau nga po

trans-unit.source: And [by] the even [number] and the odd
trans-unit.target: A [e] te ara [tau] me te rerekē

trans-unit.source: And [by] the night when it passes,
trans-unit.target: A [i] te po, ina haere te reira,

trans-unit.source: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
trans-unit.target: He reira [e kore] i roto i [katoa] e te oati [ranea] mo tetahi o perception?

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -
trans-unit.target: kore i koe whakaaro pehea ta koutou Ariki ki 'tō -

trans-unit.source: [With] Iram - who had lofty pillars,
trans-unit.target: [Ki te] Irama - nei i pou tiketike,

trans-unit.source: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
trans-unit.target: Nga momo o nei i kore i hanga i roto i te whenua?

trans-unit.source: And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
trans-unit.target: A [ki] Thamud, nana nei whakairo i nga toka i roto i te raorao?

trans-unit.source: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -
trans-unit.target: A [ki] a Parao, rangatira o nga tĭtĭ?

trans-unit.source: [All of] whom oppressed within the lands
trans-unit.target: [Katoa o] tukinotia nei i roto i nga whenua

trans-unit.source: And increased therein the corruption.
trans-unit.target: Na ka nui haere ki reira te pirau.

trans-unit.source: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
trans-unit.target: Na ringihia to koutou Ariki ki runga ki a ratou i te whiu o te whiu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is in observation.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ko to koutou Ariki i roto i te kitea.

trans-unit.source: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."
trans-unit.target: A, ko te tangata, ina tamata tona Ariki ki a ia, a [te kupu] he ohaoha ki a ia, ka pai ki a ia, e ai ta ia, "Kua kororia ahau toku Ariki."

trans-unit.source: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
trans-unit.target: Otira ka tamata ia ia, me te whakawhāiti tona kai, e ai ta ia, "Kua whakama ahau toku Ariki."

trans-unit.source: No! But you do not honor the orphan
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
trans-unit.target: A e kore koe e faaitoito i tetahi i tetahi ki te whangai i te hunga rawakore.

trans-unit.source: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
trans-unit.target: Na pau koe kainga tupu, kai [te reira] rawa,

trans-unit.source: And you love wealth with immense love.
trans-unit.target: Na te aroha koutou taonga ki te aroha nui.

trans-unit.source: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed -
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,
trans-unit.target: Na kua tae mai to koutou Ariki me nga anahera, te ana'iraa ki runga ki te ana'iraa,

trans-unit.source: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but what good to him will be the remembrance?
trans-unit.target: Na ka kawea mai [i roto i te tirohanga], e Day, ko te reinga - e Day, ka mahara te tangata, engari he aha te pai ki a ia, ka waiho i te mahara?

trans-unit.source: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."
trans-unit.target: ka mea ia, "Aue, e hiahia ana ahau i tonoa e ahau i mua [etahi pai] mo toku ora."

trans-unit.source: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
trans-unit.target: Na i runga i taua Day, kahore e whiua [rite nui] rite tona whiu,

trans-unit.source: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
trans-unit.target: A ka kahore here [rite rawatia] rite tona here [o nga kaimahi i te kino].

trans-unit.source: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
trans-unit.target: [Ki ka mea te reira te tika], "e whakamarie wairua,

trans-unit.source: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
trans-unit.target: Hoki ki tou Ariki, pai-pai, me te ahuareka [ki a ia],

trans-unit.source: And enter among My [righteous] servants
trans-unit.target: A ka tomo aku pononga [tika] i roto i

trans-unit.source: And enter My Paradise."
trans-unit.target: A ka tomo toku Pararaiha. "

trans-unit.source: I swear by this city, Makkah -
trans-unit.target: oati ahau e tenei pa, Makkah -

trans-unit.source: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
trans-unit.target: Na koutou, [e Muhammad], he noa o te here i roto i tenei pa, -

trans-unit.source: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
trans-unit.target: A [e] te papa me i whanau nei [o ia],

trans-unit.source: We have certainly created man into hardship.
trans-unit.target: Kua tino hanga matou te tangata ki mamae.

trans-unit.source: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
trans-unit.target: E whakaaro ia e kore e tetahi hinga ia?

trans-unit.source: He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
trans-unit.target: ta ia, "Kua pau ahau taonga nui i roto i."

trans-unit.source: Does he think that no one has seen him?
trans-unit.target: E whakaaro ia e kua kite kahore he tangata ia ia?

trans-unit.source: Have We not made for him two eyes?
trans-unit.target: e kore kua matou hanga hoki ia kanohi e rua?

trans-unit.source: And a tongue and two lips?
trans-unit.target: Na ka te arero, me te rua ngutu?

trans-unit.source: And have shown him the two ways?
trans-unit.target: A kua whakakitea ki a ia nga ara e rua?

trans-unit.source: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
trans-unit.target: Otiia kihai ia i kua pakaru i roto i te haere uaua.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te [whawhati i roto i] te haere fifi?

trans-unit.source: It is the freeing of a slave
trans-unit.target: Ko te reira i te whakaoranga o te pononga

trans-unit.source: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
trans-unit.target: e kai ana ranei i runga i te ra o te matekai nui

trans-unit.source: An orphan of near relationship
trans-unit.target: He pani o te hononga tata

trans-unit.source: Or a needy person in misery
trans-unit.target: Ranei he tangata rawakore i roto i te ngakau pouri,

trans-unit.source: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
trans-unit.target: Na reira te i roto i te hunga e whakapono, ka tohutohu tetahi i tetahi ki te manawanui me te tohutohu tetahi i tetahi ki te aroha.

trans-unit.source: Those are the companions of the right.
trans-unit.target: Te hunga ko te hoa o te tika.

trans-unit.source: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.
trans-unit.target: Ko ratou te hunga whakapono i roto i to tatou tohu - te hunga ko nga hoa o te maui.

trans-unit.source: Over them will be fire closed in.
trans-unit.target: Neke atu i te ratou ka tutakina ahi i roto i.

trans-unit.source: By the sun and its brightness
trans-unit.target: Na roto i te ra, me tona tiahotanga

trans-unit.source: And [by] the moon when it follows it
trans-unit.target: A [e] te marama, ka whai te reira i te reira

trans-unit.source: And [by] the day when it displays it
trans-unit.target: A [e] te ra ina whakaatu reira te reira

trans-unit.source: And [by] the night when it covers it
trans-unit.target: A [i] te po, ina e hipokina te reira

trans-unit.source: And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
trans-unit.target: A [e] te rangi, me te ia te tangata e hanga ana e ia

trans-unit.source: And [by] the earth and He who spread it
trans-unit.target: A [e] te whenua, me te tangata e horapa

trans-unit.source: And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it
trans-unit.target: A [e] te wairua, me te ia te tangata e proportioned reira

trans-unit.source: And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
trans-unit.target: A faauruhia reira [ki te matauranga o te] tona kino, me ona tika,

trans-unit.source: He has succeeded who purifies it,
trans-unit.target: Kua muri ia te tangata e tahia te reira,

trans-unit.source: And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
trans-unit.target: Na kua taka ia te tangata e instills reira [ki te pirau].

trans-unit.source: Thamud denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
trans-unit.target: whakakahore Thamud [ratou peropheta] i te take o to ratou poka ke,

trans-unit.source: When the most wretched of them was sent forth.
trans-unit.target: A, no te te pouri tino o ratou i tonoa atu.

trans-unit.source: And the messenger of Allah [Salih] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allah or [prevent her from] her drink."
trans-unit.target: Na ka mea te anahera o Allah [Salih] ki a ratou, "[Kaua e kino] te ia-kamera o Allah ranei [ārai ia i] tona ringihanga."

trans-unit.source: But they denied him and hamstrung her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
trans-unit.target: Otira ka whakakahore ratou ki a ia, ka whakangongea ia.

trans-unit.source: And He does not fear the consequence thereof.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e wehi ia ona te hopearaa.

trans-unit.source: By the night when it covers
trans-unit.target: I te te po, ina e hipokina

trans-unit.source: And [by] the day when it appears
trans-unit.target: A [e] te ra ina puta reira

trans-unit.source: And [by] He who created the male and female,
trans-unit.target: A [e] ia nei i hanga te tane, he wahine,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he kanorau outou mau tautooraa.

trans-unit.source: As for he who gives and fears Allah
trans-unit.target: Rite hoki ia nana nei i homai, me te wehi Allah

trans-unit.source: And believes in the best [reward],
trans-unit.target: Na whakapono ana i roto i te pai [utu],

trans-unit.source: We will ease him toward ease.
trans-unit.target: ka whai mamatanga matou ia ki humarie.

trans-unit.source: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
trans-unit.target: Ko rite hoki ia te tangata e kaiponu me whakaaro ia free o te hiahia

trans-unit.source: And denies the best [reward],
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakakahore te [utu] pai,

trans-unit.source: We will ease him toward difficulty.
trans-unit.target: ka whai mamatanga matou ia ki te uaua.

trans-unit.source: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?
trans-unit.target: A he aha e tona taonga aua ia, ina hinga ia?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, [tūru] ki runga ki Us he arata'iraa.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
trans-unit.target: A pono, ki a tatou no te ake me te [ora] tuatahi.

trans-unit.source: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
trans-unit.target: Na kua whakatupato koe e ahau o te ahi e ngiha nei.

trans-unit.source: None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.
trans-unit.target: ka kore tetahi [tomo ki] tahu reira anake te tangata tino rawakore.

trans-unit.source: Who had denied and turned away.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai i whakakahore, ka tahuri atu.

trans-unit.source: But the righteous one will avoid it -
trans-unit.target: Ko te tangata tika e karo reira -

trans-unit.source: [He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself
trans-unit.target: [Ia] te tangata e homai [i] tona taonga ki te pure ia

trans-unit.source: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded
trans-unit.target: A e kore e [hoatu] mo te tangata e kua [mahi ia] te manako ki te kia utu

trans-unit.source: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.
trans-unit.target: Ko rapu anake te mata o tona Ariki, te Runga Rawa.

trans-unit.source: And he is going to be satisfied.
trans-unit.target: Na kei te haere ia ki te kia makona.

trans-unit.source: By the morning brightness
trans-unit.target: E te wherikotanga ata

trans-unit.source: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,
trans-unit.target: A [i] te po, ina e hipokina ki te pouri,

trans-unit.source: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].
trans-unit.target: e kore i to koutou Ariki tangohia poroporoaki o koutou, [e Muhammad], e kore ano kua whakarihariha ia [koe].

trans-unit.source: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
trans-unit.target: A he pai hoki koutou i to te [ora] tuatahi te ake.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
trans-unit.target: Na kei te haere koutou Ariki ki hoatu ki a koe, a ka makona koe.

trans-unit.source: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
trans-unit.target: e kore ia i kitea e koe i te pani, me te hoatu [koe] rerenga?

trans-unit.source: And He found you lost and guided [you],
trans-unit.target: Na ka kitea e ia ngaro koutou, ka arahina [koutou],

trans-unit.source: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
trans-unit.target: Na ka kitea e ia a koutou rawakore, ka hanga [koe] whaiaro-ranea.

trans-unit.source: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
trans-unit.target: Na rite mo te pani, e kore e tukinotia [ia].

trans-unit.source: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].
trans-unit.target: A, ko te kai-pitihana, e kore e pei [ia].

trans-unit.source: But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
trans-unit.target: Ko te manako o to koutou Ariki, pūrongo [te reira].

trans-unit.source: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?
trans-unit.target: kihai ianei matou whakawhänui hoki koutou, [e Muhammad], tou uma?

trans-unit.source: And We removed from you your burden
trans-unit.target: Na ka turia e matou i a koutou to koutou pikaunga

trans-unit.source: Which had weighed upon your back
trans-unit.target: I paunatia ki runga ki to koutou tuara

trans-unit.source: And raised high for you your repute.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakaarahia tiketike mo koutou tou ingoa.

trans-unit.source: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
trans-unit.target: No te pono, ki te mamae [ka] mamatanga.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ki te mamae [ka] mamatanga.

trans-unit.source: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
trans-unit.target: Na ka mutu e koe [koutou mau ohipa], ka tu ake [no te haamoriraa].

trans-unit.source: And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
trans-unit.target: A ki to koutou Ariki hoki e whakatika [koutou] hiahia.

trans-unit.source: By the fig and the olive
trans-unit.target: Na roto i te piki me te oriwa

trans-unit.source: And [by] Mount Sinai
trans-unit.target: A [e] Maunga Hinai

trans-unit.source: And [by] this secure city [Makkah],
trans-unit.target: A [e] i tenei pa haumaru [Makkah],

trans-unit.source: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;
trans-unit.target: Kua tino hanga matou i te tangata i roto i te pai o te roa;

trans-unit.source: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,
trans-unit.target: Na ka hoki mai matou ki a ia ki te takere ra o te iti,

trans-unit.source: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore hoki te hunga e whakapono ana, ka mahi mahi tika, ka whai hoki ratou i te utu ore.

trans-unit.source: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha ano ai koe ki te whakakahore i te utua?

trans-unit.source: Is not Allah the most just of judges?
trans-unit.target: He kore Allah te tika te nuinga o nga kaiwhakawa?

trans-unit.source: Recite in the name of your Lord who created -
trans-unit.target: Taki i te ingoa o to koutou Ariki nei i hanga -

trans-unit.source: Created man from a clinging substance.
trans-unit.target: Hanga te tangata i te taonga pupuri.

trans-unit.source: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
trans-unit.target: Te taki, a ka ko to koutou Ariki te te aroha tino -

trans-unit.source: Who taught by the pen -
trans-unit.target: Wai whakaako i te pene -

trans-unit.source: Taught man that which he knew not.
trans-unit.target: tangata whakaakona e e kore ia i mohio.

trans-unit.source: No! [But] indeed, man transgresses
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Because he sees himself self-sufficient.
trans-unit.target: No te mea kite ia ia whaiaro-ranea.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ki to koutou Ariki ko te hoki.

trans-unit.source: Have you seen the one who forbids
trans-unit.target: Kua kite koutou i te tangata nei e kore e

trans-unit.source: A servant when he prays?
trans-unit.target: He pononga ina inoi ia?

trans-unit.source: Have you seen if he is upon guidance
trans-unit.target: Kua kite koe, ki te he ia ki runga ki te arata'iraa

trans-unit.source: Or enjoins righteousness?
trans-unit.target: whakahau ia ranei tika?

trans-unit.source: Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
trans-unit.target: Kua kite koutou, ki te whakakahore ia, ka tahuri atu -

trans-unit.source: Does he not know that Allah sees?
trans-unit.target: kahore e mohio ia e kite Allah?

trans-unit.source: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock -
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: A lying, sinning forelock.
trans-unit.target: He teka, hara rae.

trans-unit.source: Then let him call his associates;
trans-unit.target: Na kia karanga ia ona hoa;

trans-unit.source: We will call the angels of Hell.
trans-unit.target: Ka karanga e maua nga anahera o te reinga.

trans-unit.source: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We sent the Qur'an down during the Night of Decree.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ka tonoa e matou te Qur'an iho i te Po o ta.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea te Po o ta?

trans-unit.source: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
trans-unit.target: Ko te pai atu i te mano marama te Po o ta.

trans-unit.source: The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.
trans-unit.target: heke nga anahera, me te Wairua reira i whakaaetanga o ratou Ariki mo nga mea.

trans-unit.source: Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.
trans-unit.target: Rangimarie Ko reira tae noa ki te putanga o te ata.

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence -
trans-unit.target: Te hunga i whakapono i roto i nga iwi o te karaipiture me nga polytheists kihai i ki kia wehe [i misbelief] tae noa reira ka haere mai ki a ratou taunakitanga mārama -

trans-unit.source: A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures
trans-unit.target: He anahera i Allah, taki papa'iraa mo'a tuku

trans-unit.source: Within which are correct writings.
trans-unit.target: I roto i nei he mau papa'iraa tika.

trans-unit.source: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided until after there had come to them clear evidence.
trans-unit.target: E kore ano i i haere mai te hunga i homai te karaipiture hei wehea noa i muri i reira ki a ratou taunakitanga mārama.

trans-unit.source: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.
trans-unit.target: A kihai i whakahaua ratou anake ki te koropiko Allah, [te] mau ki a ia i roto i te haapa'oraa, anga ki te pono, me te ki whakapumautia inoi, me te ki hoatu zakah.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
trans-unit.target: Oia mau, ka waiho ratou e whakapono i roto i nga iwi o te karaipiture me nga polytheists i te ahi o te reinga, e noho e amuri noa'tu reira.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ratou te hunga i whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika - te hunga ko te pai o nga mea.

trans-unit.source: Their reward with Allah will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
trans-unit.target: Ratou utu ki a Allah ka kari o noho mau tonu i raro i rere awa, ka noho ai ratou ake ake, he pai ki a ratou, me ratou ki a ia Allah.

trans-unit.source: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
trans-unit.target: A, no te ngaueue te whenua te me tona ru [whakamutunga]

trans-unit.source: And the earth discharges its burdens
trans-unit.target: Na hauruke te whenua ona kawenga

trans-unit.source: And man says, "What is [wrong] with it?" -
trans-unit.target: Na ka ta te tangata, "He aha te mea [he] ki reira?"

trans-unit.source: That Day, it will report its news
trans-unit.target: Taua Day, ka pūrongo te reira tona rongo

trans-unit.source: Because your Lord has commanded it.
trans-unit.target: No te mea i whakahau koutou Ariki kua reira.

trans-unit.source: That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
trans-unit.target: Taua Day, ka haere te iwi wehea [ki ngā kāwai] ki te kia whakakitea [te hua o] ratou mahi.

trans-unit.source: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it,
trans-unit.target: Na ko te tangata e o te ngota taimaha o te pai, ka kite i te reira,

trans-unit.source: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
trans-unit.target: Na te tangata e a te ngota taimaha o te kino, ka kite i te reira.

trans-unit.source: By the racers, panting,
trans-unit.target: E nga racers, kihakiha,

trans-unit.source: And the producers of sparks [when] striking
trans-unit.target: Na nga kaihanga o muramura [ka] patu

trans-unit.source: And the chargers at dawn,
trans-unit.target: Na nga peihana i ata,

trans-unit.source: Stirring up thereby [clouds of] dust,
trans-unit.target: Whakaoho ake reira [kapua o] puehu,

trans-unit.source: Arriving thereby in the center collectively,
trans-unit.target: Tae reira i roto i te pokapū ngātahi,

trans-unit.source: Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni te taata, ki tona Ariki, he ew hakawhetai.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, he is to that a witness.
trans-unit.target: A pono, ko ia ki taua he kaiwhakaatu.

trans-unit.source: And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.
trans-unit.target: A pono ko ia, i roto i te aroha o te taonga, kaha.

trans-unit.source: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
trans-unit.target: Otiia e kore ia e mohio ki taua ka e marara nga tirotiro o nga urupa

trans-unit.source: And that within the breasts is obtained,
trans-unit.target: Na kua whiwhi e i roto i te u,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, to ratou Ariki ki a ratou, e Day, he [tino] maheni.

trans-unit.source: The Striking Calamity -
trans-unit.target: Te aitua a Tūrongo -

trans-unit.source: What is the Striking Calamity?
trans-unit.target: He aha te mea te aitua a Tūrongo?

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea te aitua a Tūrongo?

trans-unit.source: It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,
trans-unit.target: Ko te reira i te Day ina ka iwi rite pūrēhua, marara,

trans-unit.source: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
trans-unit.target: A ka riro nga maunga, ano he huruhuru hipi, fluffed ake.

trans-unit.source: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
trans-unit.target: Na ka rite hoki tetahi e taimaha [ki mahi pai] nei unahi,

trans-unit.source: He will be in a pleasant life.
trans-unit.target: ka waiho ia i roto i te ora ahuareka.

trans-unit.source: But as for one whose scales are light,
trans-unit.target: Ko tetahi e marama nei unahi,

trans-unit.source: His refuge will be an abyss.
trans-unit.target: ka waiho tona rerenga i te poka torere.

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what that is?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha e ko?

trans-unit.source: It is a Fire, intensely hot.
trans-unit.target: Ko te ahi, puai wera.

trans-unit.source: Competition in [worldly] increase diverts you
trans-unit.target: Whakataetae i roto i te hua [ao] diverts koutou

trans-unit.source: Until you visit the graveyards.
trans-unit.target: Tae noa koutou tirotiro i te graveyards.

trans-unit.source: No! You are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: Then no! You are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Na kahore!

trans-unit.source: No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: You will surely see the Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: he pono ka kite koe i te po auahi.

trans-unit.source: Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
trans-unit.target: Na he pono ka kite koe i te reira ki te kanohi o te tino.

trans-unit.source: Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Na he pono ka ui koe e Day e pā ana ki ahuareka.

trans-unit.source: By time,
trans-unit.target: I te wa,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, mankind is in loss,
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, he te taata i roto i te mate,

trans-unit.source: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
trans-unit.target: Ki te kahore hoki te hunga e kua whakapono, ka mahi mahi tika, me te tohutohu tahi i te tahi ki te pono, me te tohutohu ia atu ki te manawanui.

trans-unit.source: Woe to every scorner and mocker
trans-unit.target: Aue ki nga tangata whakahi, me te tangata whakahi

trans-unit.source: Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai kohikohi taonga me te [tonu] e kiia te reira.

trans-unit.source: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
trans-unit.target: whakaaro ia e ka meinga e tona taonga tahuti ore ia.

trans-unit.source: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
trans-unit.target: Kahore!

trans-unit.source: And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
trans-unit.target: Na te aha e taea hanga e mohio ana koe he aha te mea i te kaiwawahi?

trans-unit.source: It is the fire of Allah, [eternally] fueled,
trans-unit.target: Ko te reira i te ahi o Allah, [noa'tu] ränei,

trans-unit.source: Which mounts directed at the hearts.
trans-unit.target: E eke whakahaua i te ngakau.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Hellfire will be closed down upon them
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, ka e katia iho po auahi ki runga ki a ratou

trans-unit.source: In extended columns.
trans-unit.target: I roto i te tīwae roa.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
trans-unit.target: kore i koe whakaaro, [e Muhammad], pehea ta koutou Ariki me nga hoa o te arewhana?

trans-unit.source: Did He not make their plan into misguidance?
trans-unit.target: e kore ia i hanga to ratou mahere ki misguidance?

trans-unit.source: And He sent against them birds in flocks,
trans-unit.target: Na ka tonoa e ia he ki manu ratou i roto i nga kahui,

trans-unit.source: Striking them with stones of hard clay,
trans-unit.target: Patu ia ratou ki te kohatu o te uku pakeke,

trans-unit.source: And He made them like eaten straw.
trans-unit.target: Na ka hanga e ia ratou kia rite ki te kakau witi kai.

trans-unit.source: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh -
trans-unit.target: Hoki te haumarutanga taunga o te Quraysh -

trans-unit.source: Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer -
trans-unit.target: Ratou haumaru taunga [i roto i] te tira o te hotoke me te raumati -

trans-unit.source: Let them worship the Lord of this House,
trans-unit.target: Kia koropiko ratou te Ariki o tenei Whare,

trans-unit.source: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
trans-unit.target: Ko wai kua whangai ratou, [whakaora ratou] i te matekai, me te hanga ora ratou, [whakaora ratou] i te wehi.

trans-unit.source: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
trans-unit.target: Kua kite koutou i te tangata e whakakahore ana ki te utua?

trans-unit.source: For that is the one who drives away the orphan
trans-unit.target: Hoki e ko te tangata e pei atu i te pani

trans-unit.source: And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
trans-unit.target: A e kore e whakatenatena te kai o te rawakore.

trans-unit.source: So woe to those who pray
trans-unit.target: Na Aue ki te hunga e inoi

trans-unit.source: [But] who are heedless of their prayer -
trans-unit.target: [Ko] engari ko te tangata o to ratou inoi -

trans-unit.source: Those who make show [of their deeds]
trans-unit.target: Ko te hunga e hanga whakaatu [o ratou mahi]

trans-unit.source: And withhold [simple] assistance.
trans-unit.target: A ka kaiponuhia āwhina [ohie].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, Kua homai matou ki a koutou, [e Muhammad], al-Kawthar.

trans-unit.source: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].
trans-unit.target: Na inoi ki tou Ariki, a patunga tapu [ki a ia anake].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.
trans-unit.target: Ko e mo'oni, koutou hoariri ko hatepea atu te tangata.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O disbelievers,
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "E te iino,

trans-unit.source: I do not worship what you worship.
trans-unit.target: e kore ahau e koropiko ki ta koropiko koe.

trans-unit.source: Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.
trans-unit.target: E kore ano e koe karakia o te mea koropiko ahau.

trans-unit.source: Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.
trans-unit.target: E kore ka waiho e ahau hei karakia o ta koropiko koe.

trans-unit.source: Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
trans-unit.target: E kore ka waiho koe karakia o te mea koropiko ahau.

trans-unit.source: For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."
trans-unit.target: Hoki koe ko to koutou karakia, a ko taku karakia hoki ahau. "

trans-unit.source: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,
trans-unit.target: A, no te mea kua tae mai te wikitoria o Allah me te raupatu,

trans-unit.source: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes,
trans-unit.target: Na e kite koe i te iwi tomo ana ki te karakia o Allah i roto i te hui,

trans-unit.source: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
trans-unit.target: Na ka whakanui [ia] ki te whakamoemiti a koutou Ariki me te ui te faaoreraa o ia.

trans-unit.source: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.
trans-unit.target: Ai e ngaro te ringa o Abu Lahab, ka mea pakura ko ia.

trans-unit.source: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
trans-unit.target: e kore e tona taonga aua ia ranei e i riro ia.

trans-unit.source: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
trans-unit.target: ka ia [tomo ki] tahu i roto i te ahi o [Blazing] mura

trans-unit.source: And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.
trans-unit.target: Na tana wahine [rite te pai] - te kawe o te wahie.

trans-unit.source: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
trans-unit.target: A tawhio noa tona kaki ko te taura o te muka [miro].

trans-unit.source: Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One,
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "Ko ia Allah, [e ko] Kotahi,

trans-unit.source: Allah, the Eternal Refuge.
trans-unit.target: Allah, te Refuge Mure.

trans-unit.source: He neither begets nor is born,
trans-unit.target: e kore ia whanau ranei te whanau,

trans-unit.source: Nor is there to Him any equivalent."
trans-unit.target: E kore ano he reira ki a ia tetahi ōrite. "

trans-unit.source: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "rapu whakawhirinaki ahau i roto i te Ariki o te atatu

trans-unit.source: From the evil of that which He created
trans-unit.target: Mai i te kino o taua i hanga e ia ki

trans-unit.source: And from the evil of darkness when it settles
trans-unit.target: A i te kino o te pouri, ina mutu ai te reira

trans-unit.source: And from the evil of the blowers in knots
trans-unit.target: A i te kino o nga blowers i roto i knots

trans-unit.source: And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
trans-unit.target: A i te kino o te envier ina hae ia. "

trans-unit.source: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
trans-unit.target: Mea atu, "rapu whakawhirinaki ahau i roto i te Ariki o te taata nei,

trans-unit.source: The Sovereign of mankind.
trans-unit.target: Te Ariki, o te taata.

trans-unit.source: The God of mankind,
trans-unit.target: Te Atua o te taata nei,

trans-unit.source: From the evil of the retreating whisperer -
trans-unit.target: Mai i te kino o te tangata kawekawe korero whati -

trans-unit.source: Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -
trans-unit.target: Ko wai muhumuhu [kino] ki te u o te taata -

trans-unit.source: From among the jinn and mankind."
trans-unit.target: I roto i te jinn me te taata. "
